“Oh,” you say, startled for a moment, and trying not to let you attraction slip through your mask. “Well, that should be fine. It's a treat, after all.” You smile warmly at Jessica, who grins back.

“Thanks mom!” Jimmy exclaims. “This is going to be awesome!”

“This is the young lady?” The teller asks, smiling as she indulges Jessica's apparent excitement. “Very well. Step this way...” she casts her arm behind her, lifting a veiled area behind the store. You watch as the two depart into the private booth, and begin to walk around the store to see if you can't find a book on the pens.

Five minutes pass. Your search is fruitless. There's loads of books on pop mysticism, but if there's any genuine magic stuff here, it's being kept somewhere out of sight. As for Jimmy's idea of having your pick of customers, the store doesn't seem to get much traffic. Not that the goth could tell; she's so engrossed in her magazine she doesn't seem to even be aware if you're still present.

You're about to despair when a possible candidate for your switch walks in, and enquires about having her fortune told. She's as striking as the store attendant, yet in a completely different way. She's clearly part of the vintage set, in her mid-twenties, with bright orange-red hair, piled up and twisted in two ornate curls with a bow accessory, and makeup straight out of the 1940s. She's wearing a black and white polka dot sun dress, sporting a delicate handbag and, urgh, heels. Still, she's attractive, and could be an interesting life to step into...

“Uhm, I think someone else is with Madame Elena,” the assistant replies, a little uncertain – she's been lost in her magazine again. But, before the next customer can reply, 'Elena' steps out from behind the curtain.

“That's all right, Wendy,” she says, in the same exotic voice as before, not a hair out of place. “The young lady departed some time ago. I shall be ready to attend to our guest momentarily.” She steps forward, the same elegant, flowing way as before, and walks over to you. You arch your brow; is it the real Elena, or Jimmy? She leans forward conspiratorially.

“All right dude,” she hisses in a low tone. “Step one complete.”

So it is Jimmy! How has his acting improved, and how did he know the store attendant's name? Did he use the brown pen, or did he just ask some careful questions in the booth? You need answers, although not in the middle of the store. 'Madame Elena' flashes her most mysterious smirk.

“What do you think? Want to go goth? Or that customer's pretty hot. How about being her? The store shuts in 15 minutes, then we can head out, or check the back room for something about the pens.”
112212211.title: Finding a fortune

1122122112.content:
“Serve your next customer,” you say, the implication evident. The heels are going to be tricky, but there's something about her body that's drawing you to her. She looks interesting, as though her life is going to be an adventure to embrace. Jimmy's trademark smirk transfixes itself across Elena's dusky lips. And, just like that, the show is on.

“Mysteries await!” he says in Elena's thick, mellifluous voice, flicking his body's fingers in the air and twirling, eyes gleaming with mischief. The waiting victim smiles. “This way, young lady, future surprises lie within!”

The woman enters the booth, her lithe figure slipping behind the cloth, Jimmy lingering outside. “Wendy my dear... you may depart. Do not fear, Denise here is an old friend. We shall close after the reading, so close the doors behind you.”

The goth attendant nods, eyes you with some suspicion, but complies. “OK, I'll see you tomorrow.” With that she leaves, closing the door behind her, and twisting the hanging sign to closed.

Jimmy has now moved behind the curtain too, so you head over. There's an eerie silence from inside.

You cough. Silence.

“Uh...Madame Elena?” you ask, edging closer but staying in character. Still silence. You step up to the curtain, and are about to head inside when...

“Eek!” Denise Hunt's high-pitched squeal comes out of your lips as you try to move back. Suddenly you're falling, tumbling on the heels, landing hard on your shapely ass. From the floor you stare up in horror. Elena's deflated face hangs loose through the curtain, sagging around the mouth. Jessica's head pops out immediately afterward, bursting with laughter.

“Come inside, dude,” Jimmy says, Elena's head hanging from Jessica's chest like a Halloween mask. You stagger to your feet, appalled.

“Jimmy! You're...wearing both of them?”

Jessica shrugs, parts away Elena's locks, and ducks her head back inside. With a few pats and presses later, and a quick reshifting of her jaw, 'Elena' has returned. “So?” she asks, eyes gleaming.

“So? Jimmy! Where's the respect? These are people! People with real lives.”

“So is Mrs Hunt, doesn't stop you walking around in her body, wearing her clothes, right down to her bra and panties. Don't be a hypocrite, we're playing with different rules now. Come on. Get inside and check this out.”

Once more you straighten yourself, and, rubbing your sore legs, shift Mrs Hunt's body behind the curtain. Inside the customer's collapsed body hangs off the chair where she had been sat.

“Found out what the brown pen does,” Jimmy confides, flicking his robes as he walks around to take a seat opposite the woman. He gets out the brown pen, points it at her, and clicks. He shakes for a moment, as if receiving an electric shock.

“All right. This is how you improve your disguise! The brown pen does some kind of... scan. You point it at someone, and it gives you... not their memories. But you get the essential information. She's... her name is Phoebe. Phoebe Callis. Age 26. She's a photographer... and lives with her girlfriend Sam. Her cell's pin is 6790. And...” he frowns. “It doesn't stay, the info begins to fade pretty quickly. It only fixes when you put the skin on, I think. Like, I know how to act like 'Madame Elena'. Her real name's Helen Morrison, by the way. If you scanned Phoebe here, took her form, you could pass for her well enough. And you should totally do it!”

This was always the plan, but as you dig your nails under Denise Hunt's bob and pull her flesh loose, you can't help but worry about Jimmy. This is going straight to his head. You unbutton your blouse, slip off your dress, get out of the heels, and begin to peel away Mrs Hunt's body. Jimmy doesn't seem to think this requires any privacy, but eventually leaves you alone, closing the store as Elena would – it closes several hours earlier than the rest of the mall for some reason - and raiding her till. You brush down Mrs Hunt's shapely thighs and belly fat, pulling the skin down your legs, before finally stepping out of her skin. You reach for the brown pen, pick it up, point it at Phoebe and...

The shock startles you. You had seen Jimmy's reaction, but it's as if you've stood on a live wire. Then, as soon as its over, you find your mind flooded with information. Facts, figures, dates, measurements, pin numbers, passwords. Not memories – there's nothing about Phoebe's life – just her personal data, as though you've tapped into some kind of personal intranet. It's already beginning to fade as you pick up the skin, holding up the empty, hollow husk close to your own face, breathing in her perfume. In a moment, this will be your face; is this what identity is? When you step in, are you really David, or Phoebe? You will certainly be strikingly attractive: a thin, proud nose, high cheek bones, and curled hair still fixed with spray. Phoebe's look is pretty unique, although with your knowledge you know how to replicate it. You look at the rest of the skin, and its slight imperfections: the mole on her neck, a spot on her back, roots revealing where she dyes her hair to achieve its luminous orange. Then you step inside, and find your own body vanishing before you.

“So, here's the deal,” Jimmy says from behind the curtain, his words muddied by Elena's European flair. “I'm thinking of staying as Elena for a while. This is one hot body, after all, and the store is ideal as a base. Plus, if the pens are real, what else is going to be real? I need to find out more.”

“You're sure the pens are magical?” you ask, tugging Phoebe's head over your own, coughing slightly as your voice transforms into her chirpy tones and your face pinches into her form. “It could be some kind of government technology.”

“In my attic? Dude. Actually... shit. Why was this in my attic? Good point, man.”

“It's a mystery,” you say, checking your reflection in the crystal ball, patting your hair into place just as the real Phoebe would to make sure her appearance is just right, before beginning to don her clothes. “We should find that out.”

“Yeah,” Jimmy says. “I need to look into that; maybe ask my mom. Look dude, how about you take the pens for a while, see if you can't create some trouble? Learn how to be someone else.” He pokes his head through the curtain, appraising your half-naked body. “Nice, dude. She's a real find.”

“You're not so bad yourself,” you tease, emulating Phoebe's most seductive grin. Wow...that brown pen really did work. You have her muscle memory too, you think. Heels won't be a problem now. You finish donning her bra, and reach for the sun dress.

“Ha! Anyway, get dressed, go home, see your girlfriend, live 'your' life. I'll stay here for a bit, see if I can't find out what's going on. We'll meet outside Jessica's at midnight. I'll bring Jessica and Denise here so we can restore 'em.”

An evening as Phoebe is a tempting prospect, and you'll have the pens – there's no reason to stay as her if you don't want to. On the other hand, you're getting worried about Jimmy. He's messing with something neither of you understand, and seems keen to abandon his own life. And the way he's talking about the skins... it's like he's forgotten they are not costumes.
1122122112.title: A classic look

choices: Change your face and spy on Jimmy
11221221121.content:
A strange thought takes hold as you walk through the mall, toward the carpark and your – or at least your current body's – car. You play your part, acting as you think Phoebe would, looking at some rings and accessories in a display, and suddenly you're reminded of a lesson Miss Franklin gave last term. Franklin, who is right now having her wedding dress fitted somewhere above you (who has a bridal shop in a shopping mall?). If it weren't for her presence in the mall, and the rings, the thought would never have occurred to you.

Short, thin, with mousy brown hair constantly tied in a ponytail and thick glasses, Franklin always gives off a bookish, librarian vibe. She's apparently a bit more relaxed outside of school, but in front of a class she's only really passionate when teaching you about Greek history; the rest of the time she looks like she wants to hide. Franklin and rings... then it hits you. The Ring of Gyges.

You need to think. You straighten Phoebe's dress, tuck your handbag, pens inside, under your arm and head to the restrooms. There, pretending to touch up your makeup in the mirror, you try and remember the lesson. There are two others with you. In one corner a blonde college girl (she's wearing her college sweater) is talking animatedly to a friend on the phone. She's slightly chubby, and is constantly flicking at her short pixie crop hair; you guess she's just had it done. An attractive, severe-looking businesswoman, black hair swirling down onto a sharp Italian suit, is checking her handbag. She looks in her early 40s.

Gyges, you try and remember. He was a shepherd. He found a cave with a ring in it. So far so normal, but then he basically turned into Gollum. The ring let him turn invisible, and he used his power to seduce the queen, kill the king and seize the kingdom. The message in the story? Man is only moral when he can get caught. Power corrupts. Like the power Jimmy's given you, handing over the pens into your keeping. Maybe it hasn't corrupted him fully, you guess.

And now the pens are yours. You frown, contemplating your power, the pens' power, for a moment. Phoebe's perfect brow wrinkles too, squishing her – your – elegant, thin nose. Then another thought hits you, and Phoebe's lipstick-stained lips twist into a perfect, shocked O.

What if it isn't Jimmy? You never considered that before. Jimmy showed that he could be Elena and Jessica at the same time; why not a third suit? What if someone wanted you to have these pens, and has been masquerading as your prank-loving friend to get them to you? It would explain why you were virtually led on a tour of what the pens could do, and why he handed such power over so easily.

You stare deep into Phoebe's face, trying to think about what to do. You could continue out of the mall as Phoebe, of course; you know you could pass as her easily, and the idea of spending an evening playing at being her gives you a rush of excitement. But what if your helper isn't really Jimmy? Perhaps you should think about slipping back to the shop, perhaps even in a different skin, and tailing 'Madame Elena', or 'Jessica', or 'Jimmy', or whatever face they're wearing. The idea that your friend just happened to find these pens in his attic feels too convenient.

You finish your touch-up. The businesswoman and college girl are still there. And, just as you're wondering what to do, Miss Franklin - the cause of your dilemma - walks in too, laughing to herself about something one of her friends must have said.

“Time to make like Gyges,” you mutter. The question is, do you stay as Phoebe and enjoy your evening, or swap your disguise and tail 'Jimmy'?
11221221121.title: Myth and mystery

112212211211.content:
It seems like Jimmy. He talked like Jimmy, he acts like Jimmy and he looks like Jimmy (when he wasn’t wearing your girl). Yet?
You put such idea in the back of your mind. He feels like the same guy. There is a bigger fish to fry.

Sam, the girl of Phoebe, is a beautiful woman of age 27. She is hard worker who in the cusp of getting an MBA. A girl who was the daughter of hard working hispanic immigrants. She had just come back from a recent trip from Wall Street recruiting trip. Sam was about to make bank and Phoebe was glad to be along for the ride.

Sam had been in tremendous trouble with her parents for being her. At the age of 17 she had meet Phoebe. She had known Phoebe for since they were children. They had been inseparable and the closest of friends. Neither had luck with boyfriends. They had finally experimented at age 17 and finally met each other, truly . Until Sam’s mom had walked in on them in the dark in the buff and Phoebe had blurted “We’re not gay or anything”.

Wrong move.

Their parents were furious with them. It was the late 90s and being Gay was not easy. DOMA has just passed and Matthew Shepard had been killed, being LGBT is not easy now, but it was harder then. Phoebe’s parents were evangelicals and Sam’s had been with Catholicism for years.

Sam and Phoebe were given an ultimatum. Give up this relationship or their parents would kick them out. The girls chose each other. Looking back at Phoebe's memories you wonder how they were this strong to resist their parents. They left home and never looked back.

Would you and Jimmy be that strong? Huh? You think. Where did that come from. You too push that thought from your mind because you approach Phoebe’s and Sam’s door.
112212211211.title: A night as Phoebe

112212211212.content:
“I'm sorry about this,” you say in the bathroom stall, addressing the crumpled skin on the floor as you twist Phoebe's frame to remove her clothes. You lingered, you waited, and your new disguise lies on the floor: the last of the three women to leave the restroom. You need to find out if your mentor really is Jimmy, or if he was just a disguise in some elaborate game. That means you can't stay as Phoebe. Attractive though she is, it's an instantly recognizable face.

Carefully you reach up behind your retro hairstyle and pull Pheobe's fine, sculpted face away from your own. You edge out of her neck, her shoulders, her pert breasts and flat stomach, before peeling away the lower half of the costume. Then you reach for your new identity - the chubby blonde college girl with the short haircut.

According to your stolen information from the brown pen, she's Lucy Binder, a sociology major. You step into her skin, and despair as your feet shrink then bulge. Lucy's not a small girl, and as you pull up her torso you watch your waist grow and expand, her large breasts falling loose as you slip into the arms. Finally comes the head; you tug the pixie crop back, gargling slightly as your cheeks fill out and your mouth reshapes to take on your new teeth.

“Wow Lucy. You need to get to the gym.” Your new voice, so perky, sounds alien as you pinch the fat around your new waist. You begin to put on her clothes, gather your belongings, and, with the coast clear, open the stall so you can sort out Phoebe. Moments later you've dressed the skin and shoot the beautiful woman you once were again. You leave as she begins to reinflate back to her own self, no doubt confused how she's ended up in a toilet cubicle, but otherwise unharmed.

* * * * *


“That's right,” Elena strides through the car park, drawing on a cigarette as she talks on a cheap, disposable mobile phone. “He bought it hook, line and sinker.” Her posture is relaxed, uncaring: anyone who looks at her would see just a middle-aged fortune teller returning home. Of course it's not really Elena but nobody else would know that, even if the casual words and phrases sound strange in her exotic accent.

Nobody except you. Bubbly, unobtrusive Lucy Binder, still talking nonsense on her phone to her friend (of course you're only pretending), flicking her new hairstyle as she discusses Todd Hendricks and how he is “so divine” - all the while listening to Elena's every word as she walks through the car park.

“Nah, I've let the kid have fun. If we're going to recruit him, he needs to understand the real power of it. He's found some pretty young thing, and he'll be spending the night as her. If you want my guess, he'll find the whole damn experience so intoxicating he'll jump at the chance to come on board. I remember my first time as someone else. Wow, what a rush.”

On board? Lucy's voice slows as you strain to listen, forgetting your masquerade for the moment. You were right. The Ring of Gyges; whoever's been impersonating your friends was hoping to get you hooked on swapping identities.

“It was easy,” Elena takes a drag on her cigarette, blowing out smoke in a stream as she fumbles for her keys. “First his friend Jimmy. Some prankster, so he bought the persona I put on. Then his girlfriend for the shock reveal. I swapped out at the mall; used that Madame Elena again... yeah, yeah. What can I say? I like her body and know her routine; hell, I've lived it often enough. I've already restored the Jimmy kid; left him at the mall wondering what the hell was going on. Put the girlfriend and her mom in the car earlier. I'll head to Elena's, slip into mom's skin and return them home. Promised the kid we'd meet up at the witching hour, mom's skin will be fine for that. I'll get the C-Set back then.”

The Stranger – you have no idea who they are, or what they want – scratches an itch under Elena's curling hair. Your mind is racing, and so are Lucy's legs as you struggle to keep up. You're breathing heavily a little from the added weight; as you feared, your new body isn't that fit.

The Stranger reaches Elena's car and opens up the boot. You can just about see two large bags with what looks like wigs and clothes inside: Jessica and Denise Hunt. Elena's dusky face nods to whoever's on the phone, flicking the cigarette away, before closing the boot up again.

“I'm sure he'll go for it. We've been scouting him for a while now; he'd make an outstanding recruit. Yeah, I was thinking of revealing it all to him tonight. Let him enjoy his evening. Yeah... I'll check in once I've made the offer. He accepts, I'll take him to the safe house straight away. He refuses... you know how that goes.”

Your - or at least Lucy's - eyes widen. The Stranger still hasn't noticed Lucy's portly frame walking toward the car, which means you've got options. There's no way you're going to wait until midnight after what you've got heard. Either you can confront whoever's wearing Elena's face now, or you use one of the pens.
112212211212.title: Spy Game

choices: Shoot Elena and go on the run
Surrender the pen and find out more
1122122112121.content:
“And what if I do neither?” Lucy's voice trills through the air, full of menace as you level the pen at Elena's form. The fortune teller's body turns around, a look of both amusement and surprise on her face.

“I'll call you back,” she says to the phone, ending the call and placing her hands on her mature hips. Her eyes narrow as she appraises you, a look of mild amusement playing on her lips. For a moment the world turns silent, the only noise your nervous breath and Elena's hoop earrings, swinging like wind chimes.

Then the palmist's hands, with their dramatic nails, begin to clap slowly. “Oh,” Elena's voice plays over the vowel. “Very good. Very good indeed. We picked a good candidate in you. You're smarter than you look; at least, you're smarter than that face you're wearing looks. So stay smart, and don't do that.”

“I'll do it,” you say, shaking a little. Adrenaline is coursing through Lucy's frame now. At least the imposter didn't even pretend he was Jimmy or Jessica or anyone else you know. No obfuscation, just business.

Elena's face smiles. “I really wouldn't. Honestly, David? You've made a mistake. The end result was going to be the same, but you've just missed a night of passion pretending to be that pretty young thing you left as. Nice choice of skin, by the way. I'd never have suspected her. Where did you switch? And are you still wearing Phoebe underneath?”

“The toilets, and I let her go. She has a life! You can't just treat people like this!”

Elena raises a quizzical eye. “No? Who's going to stop us? David, you have no idea how deep this goes. What the point of it is. The pen you're holding right now? Just the start. It's a cliché, David, but this really is about saving the world.”

“Bullshit. It's about getting your kicks being someone else.”

Your interruption brings a shake of the head. “A perk, not the point. Get in the car and I'll explain it all. I'd rather not discuss this in a carpark; Elena's robes aren't exactly the warmest choice of clothing, and I don't want anyone overhearing our little chat. Think about what anyone would see if they came upon us. Some chubby college girl pointing a pen at a fortune teller? It's going to look strange, isn't it? Might raise suspicions.”

You shoot furtive looks to the left and right. Elena's completely in control, while you feel as though your world is crashing down. You're in way over your head and you know it.

“Why should I trust you?”

“You don't have a choice. Think about it, David. You turn me into a skin, you'll never get any answers. What are you going to do, keep Elena's skin in your wardrobe? Throw it away and effectively kill her? Wear her, and abandon your own life? Let me go, or hold me hostage? You're out of options. And what are you going to do when the others come for you? You know there's more of us, you heard my call. One day you'll come home and your mom, or your dad, or your sister, is going to be someone else. Maybe they're already someone else. You didn't think of that, did you? Maybe we've been watching you for weeks, assessing you. Maybe one of us is under the skin of that tomboy friend of yours, Trish. You have no idea, do you?”

You thrust the pen out, trying to look threatening. Elena laughs.

“You're wearing a different face, but your fear's still all over it. If you shoot me now, you're going to be on the run for the rest of your life. You'll never be able to go home. You'll never get any answers. You'll be hunted for the rest of your days by an unseen force who can literally be anyone.”

“So can I.”

“Not as well as we can. Do you think it stops with two pens? Really, David? Don't you think we'd start a beginner with training wheels, first?”

Elena takes a step forward, hand out, beckoning for the pen. “And don't you think we'd protect ourselves against being turned into skins ourselves, somehow? So give me the pen and let's talk. Trust me, you're being recruited for something with a higher purpose. It's a great honor, one worth accepting.”

Elena's contradicting herself, her story shifting as fluidly as her appearance today. Already she's been three people, and none of them the true identity underneath. You're not getting answers, just hypotheticals. Your family has or hasn't been replaced. The pen will or won't work. The truth is you have no idea, but the questions have sent your thoughts into a tailspin. Lucy's flabby arms are trembling now.

It's fear.

Fear of just what this shadowy organization could do. There doesn't seem to be a limit.

You've only got two choices: You could go for the shot and spend the rest of your life in hiding. Elena's conversation has already betrayed the fact she has another pen: how else would she have restored Jimmy? If your pen really is just 'training wheels', you can steal her version of this 'C-Set'. You'd have to abandon your old life, though; either leave town and spend your life pretending to be other people, or live in hiding nearby as someone else, watching over your friends and family, never sure if it's really them.

That's assuming the pen works on your opponent. Firing it could be a death sentence.

Alternatively, you can drop the pen and accept Elena's offer. That way your family and friends would be safe and you'd get all the answers you could want. You're being recruited for something, which is both exciting and enticing; you'd enter a world that very few know about. But you also feel like you'd be making a pact with the Devil, entering into some unknown agreement for an unknown purpose. It's unlikely you'd get to stay in your current life.

Then there's the morality of it. Stealing someone's body and identity is the ultimate intrusion, and turning them into a costume permanently is, in effect, murder. It's clear that's what this organization is all about. Can it be justified? Where do you draw the line?

Whether you fire or not, your world is never going to be the same again.
1122122112121.title: Direct confrontation

choices: Wear a skin and begin your escape.
Restore Jessica and go on the run with her
11221221121211.content:
You fire. It was the only logical choice after all. A confrontation with a clandestine organisation which you know nothing about with the power to take over people's lives seemingly seamlessly. There was no guarantee that the person wearing Elena's form wouldn't've just killed you or had you replaced if you had handed over your only weapon.

It turns out she had been bluffing. Elena crumples into a heap like any other person but when you sift through the skin and clothes, there's only one skin to be found. She had been telling the truth. The person underneath is just trapped in Elena's skin until you restore her. There doesn't seem to be any method available to you to forcibly remove someone from their skin.

What you do find is what is best described as a Parker pen box. It is a nondescript black box which looks like it wouldn't be amiss in a stationary store which holds 5 pens. The first two you recognise as the black and brown pens that Elena provided to you earlier that day. There's also a red, blue and white pen in the box as well whose function is unknown to you.

The adrenaline is pumping through your body. You have just made a big step in shooting the only person that might have spared you. Your only choice now to go on the run. You look up and see Jessica's lifeless skin in the boot of Elena's car.
11221221121211.title: Shoot Elena and go on the run

choices: Use a pen on someone in town
Head to the museum or concert
112212211212111.content:
"Shit, shit, shit." There's no going back now. As much as you'd like to take Jessica with you, something tells you this road isn't one that you want to drag someone else on. You're never going to be able to go back to your old life. You're never going to see your parents or friends again - at least not with your own face. Throwing Jessica into the same type of life just seems cruel.

You quickly throw Elena's skin into the boot of the car and hop in, taking off. Your instinct is to swap with someone else, and quickly: swap with someone that isn't linked to anyone. Right now you're wearing Lucy, but she's too traceable. So is the car you're driving in: you'll need a better form of transportation. Jessica and her Mom's car is still at the mall, but that's not suitable either. And you still need to return them to life. Hopefully when you return them to life, they'll chalk it up to some joyriding kid and forget about the whole strange circumstance.

Your first stop is to return Jessica and her mom, and that means parking in a street a whole two blocks away from your own. You pull up, slip all five pens into your pockets, grab the bag containing Jessica and her mom, and head for a nearby broken fence.

Quickly, with a little difficulty, you duck through, forcing a way through an overgrown, long-ignored garden. You know exactly where you're going. A sidestep down an alley, an awkward climb up a sheltered porch roof, and Lucy's chubby form has slipped into Jessica's room: it's an old route you've used to visit her without her parents knowing.

You creep into the room. Downstairs you can hear the TV, and what sounds like Katie talking on the phone. Great. First, you take out Jessica, dumping her on her bed. Then, tiptoeing across the hallway, you return Denise. You shoot her with the black pen, watch as she returns to life, and bring the door to a close.Then it's Jessica's turn. You climb halfway out of the window, Lucy's form struggling where you would have made an exit with ease, and point the pen again.

"Bye, Jess," you say solemnly. For her own safety, you're never going to be able to see her again. You level the black pen and fire. Then you're slipping back down, across the porch, and along your secret path.

As you approach the hole in the fence, you stop dead in your tracks.

Elena's car, 'Elena' still in the boot, is gone.

You have no idea who took it. Maybe it's them. Maybe it's some opportunist car thief about to have the shock of his life. Either option is terrifying. Your blood runs cold. Lucy's arms well up to gooseflesh. Your eyes dart around, looking at every corner, window, shadow. Is this a trap? You press yourself up against the fence and look through the cracks. There are a few people in the street. An old man is watering his plants. A businessman is speaking on his phone. A phone engineer is fixing a junction box. They could be anyone. Anyone. The thought haunts you. It probably will keep haunting you for the rest of your life.

You do the only thing you can. You run.

*****


You're in the middle of town, drinking a coffee, shaking like a leaf. Somehow you managed to slip away without anyone noticing, but you can't stay as Lucy forever: you're going to have to swap skins. The only question is who with. There's literally hundreds of choices. You could zap any one of the coffee bar's patrons, from the barista himself, to the athletic blonde in the corner, dressed in a polo shirt emblazoned with the local gym's logo. You could cross the street, enter any of the shops and become the owner for a little while. There's even Officer O'Sullivan, looking bored as ever in her police car parked outside. You could easily draw her somewhere and zap her too.

But all of those options involve staying in town, taking on someone's life. And what if they can detect you, somehow? There's too many flaws in the plan.

You need to make a clean break. There are options for that, of course. You know there's a concert tonight: some pop-rock singer and her group. There's bound to be someone there you could become - maybe even someone in the band. They're touring, so you've got the perfect escape route. Alternatively, there's the local museum - some famous art collection. At weekends it's always drawing a crowd; people even come from overseas to visit it. It might be the ideal place to start.

And if you were to become someone else, what pen do you use? Black turns a person into a costume, Brown scans their personal details so you can impersonate them more easily. But what about red, blue and white? Maybe one of them turns someone into a suit that lets you access the person's memories. Maybe one of them is a cloning device, meaning you don't have to steal someone's life - just their appearance. Or maybe they do something even stranger...

All you have is questions. One thing is for sure, though: you can't stay as Lucy a minute longer.
112212211212111.title: The Great Escape

1122122112121111.content:
You decide the best thing to do is stay in town. That way you can check the situation, work out what the pens do, and see if you can rescue your friends from being worn as expendable disguises. You know they've impersonated Jimmy and Jessica... who else?

If you know anything about hiding (and you'd like to think you've seen enough trashy movies to have an idea), it's to hide in plain sight. They'll be checking for people leaving town somehow - it's what anyone smart would do. They'll also probably take over your family, too: maybe Tina or Nick. The ideal option for you is to hide somewhere in between.

That's when it hits you. You know just the person they'll never suspect. A person who's close enough to let you keep tabs on both your family and your friends. You'll be the one person 'Elena' actually suggested you become. They'll never suspect that.

*****


The door opens slowly. "Yes? Can I help you?" Miss Franklin is applying curling tongs to her hair as she opens the door, still dressed as you saw her earlier: conservatively. You look into her hotel room: it's a double, but she seems the only occupant. Lucy's lips widen in a smile.

"Actually, it's the other way round. I saw you drop something at the mall earlier, I thought I'd return it. I heard you and your friends talking about this hotel, so I thought I'd track you down, see if there's a reward or something?"

Franklin looks confused. "Wow. Uhm... that's very kind of you to track me down like this. But I really don't think I did lose anything."

"Really? Because I found this pendant, with a metal guy's face on it, next to a sink, and..." You know Miss Franklin always wears a pendant with a little Alexander the Great on it. She's not wearing it now, and while it wasn't dropped, you're hoping the confusion is enough to buy you time. Franklin looks concerned for a moment and sets down the tongs, rushing to check her shoulder bag.

You step into her room, close the door, and fire the brown pen. "Sorry, miss," you mumble. Before she's turned around, before you've recovered from the storm of information flooding your mind, you fire the black.

"Weird," you say, rubbing Lucy's brown with the brown pen as you recover from the shock. "I always thought her name was Hannah." It's not - it's Vanessa.

Quickly, you strip out of Lucy's clothes. You're about to remove her overweight body and don Franklin's skin when you pause, and wonder what the other pens do. You pull out the red one, point it at Franklin, and fire. Nothing happens. You point and fire again. Nothing.

"Well...the red one's a load of crap," you shrug. Next, white. As you point, you realise it's got two settings: there's a way to switch the buttons. Hmm. It's more complex than the others, so you decide to leave it. Instead, you level the blue and...

Your head spins. Right now you have your own personality and thoughts, but there are two others, vying for a place. Franklin's mannerisms and essential details, and... Lucy's memories. All of them. You remember her cat Pogo, hit by a car ten years ago. The shame and embarrassment every time you - no, she - looks in a mirror. You remember Marie, and Vincent, and your highschool romance. Wow...so that's the blue pen. Memories! Seized with this useful information, and aware the brown pen's information is beginning to fade, you finally slip out of your Lucy shell, and head over to Franklin.

Once you're finished climbing inside, you pick up her glasses and slip them on. The room turns from a fuzzy blur to vivid clarity, and you look at yourself in the mirror. The naked, short, mousy-brown haired woman facing you looks as if she just wants to duck into her shell.

You pick up the blue pen and fire it, her memories flooding in. You remember her childhood on the other side of the country, the teasing calls of other girls as you ignored sports and focused on Greek history. You remember falling head over heels for the ancient heroes, until one day your own hero - Ian - arrived to sweep you off your feet. You remember your excitement at his proposal, and for your girl's night on the town tonight - your memories tell you she's nowhere near as quiet as she is in class. Vanessa's smile widens as you recall the reason she gave you the grades she did... and her perspective on all the goofing you and Jimmy did when you were supposed to be studying. You're amazed how much of it she knew, and never spoke of.

But you don't have time for this. You need to get ready. You pick up the tongs, and begin to finish your hair and makeup. Then you slip on your revealing dress for the night: a white ruffle-skirt dress. The moment you finish zipping it up, you realize just how stunning Miss Vanessa (Nessa to her friends) Franklin actually is: her meekness has hidden a true beauty right under your nose. You hope it will do the same for your pursuers.

You smile, and don the "Bride to be" sash and cheap, rhinestone tiara the girls brought you earlier, getting into character. With her memories, mannerisms and personal information, nobody will be able to tell you're not Nessa Franklin: you could even fool her fiance or family if you wanted. You're safe for the time being, and the sensible thing to do seems to be to pretend to be her tonight until you can get time to think. After tonight, you've got a day to recover and plan out your move before 'you' return to teaching: and spying on Trish and Jimmy to keep them safe.

There's still the question of what to do about Lucy, too. You can't leave the poor girl as a deflated skin in a hotel room, can you? And your bachelorette party is about to begin...
1122122112121111.title: Use a pen on someone in town

1122122112121112.content:
Not really sure whether you would find a suitable disguise just around town, you decide that heading to somewhere that was frequented by many people would be your best bet. The concert would probably have more people to mingle with but it would be an absolute mess, filled with awkward teens and large crowds. It would be difficult to zap someone inconspicuously there.

You decide to go to the museum. You enter with trepidation, a famous art collection filled with Monet and other artists who you know nothing about. The coffee hasn't calmed your nerves in the way you had hoped. The fact that you are being forced to look for someone's life to hide in isn't exactly a soothing thought.

There's a solemn quiet in the museum. Normally the place is filled with kids running around giggling and pointing at giant dinosaur skeletons and other exhibits but the art collection has attracted a different kind of crowd. A number of distinguished guests have come for the grand opening of this multimillion dollar art display and you feel completely out of place in your Lucy skin and college sweater.

Rich socialites and other upper class snobs give you odd glares as you walk around, trying futilely to blend in with the crowd. Maybe the concert would have been a better choice and its no wonder the entrance guard gave you an odd look as you walked in.

While pretending to admire the artwork, you notice a stunning woman who gives you a strange little smile. Unlike the other people who have either ignored you or turned up their noses at you, she gives you a knowing smile and approaches you.

" 'allo," she says in a lilting French accent, "Here to admire the artwork?"

You nod meekly, curious but also suspicious of this beautiful woman who has approached you. She is dressed in a midnight blue cocktail dress which accents her curves in all the right ways and has topped it off with a black cardigan-like jacket and high heels. Her long dark brown hair is carefully accented with light reds and oranges and her piercing green eyes look like they're staring into your very soul.

You introduce yourself as Lucy Binder and she tells you her name is Gabrielle Rieu, an exchange student from France. She explains that she's seen you in some of her sociology classes which of course, you have no recognition of because the brown pen does not give any memories, and she wanted to introduce herself as her night thus far had been a non-stop flow of young rich males hitting on her and uncultured socialites who shunned her for actually turning up for the art. The two of you hit it off, and you somehow manage to fudge your way through facts that Lucy should know that you two talk about.


*****


It has been about half an hour since you started talking and it feels like you two are friends now. Gabrielle excuses herself to go to the bathroom and you follow her, saying you need to use the loo as well. The bathroom is surprisingly empty and you quietly lock it behind yourself. Although she has been kind and friendly towards you, you know you have to do. Just as she's about to enter the stall, you pull out the black pen and whisper a quiet apology before zapping her into a pile of skin and clothes.

As you gaze upon the skin in your hands, you contemplate what to do.
1122122112121112.title: Head to the museum or concert

choices: Live Gabby's life until you can fly out
11221221121211122.content:
While it would be simpler to just put on Gabrielle's skin, you realise that since you're on the run, it would be a lot easier if you figured out what the other pens could do. After all, they could have abilities which would make it a lot easier for you to hide from your unknown pursuers. You pull the red, white and blue pens from your pocket and examine them. Other than the colour, there's little difference between them and the other two pens you've been using already. Just making a choice at random, you pick the blue pen and press the button while aimed at Gabrielle's skin.

Suddenly your brain is filled with memories. Not Gabrielle's, but Lucy's. Flashes, no it wouldn't be accurate to call them flashes. Clear memories of her life fill her mind starting from the most recent ones. You remember her talking to her bestie Marie in the carpark while bitching about your boyfriend Vincent. You remember her first kiss with her high school sweetheart Jason. You remember her disdain that she feels when she looks at her chubby body in the mirror. It all floods into your mind. What hasn't seemed to come is her personality, but the brown pen gives you an instinct on how to act like the person you're wearing. The addition of these memories would make your impersonation basically flawless unless you slipped up.

So that's the blue pen, a pen that gives you the memories of whoever you're already wearing. You hold the red pen in your hands and are about to try it when there's a knock on the door. Startled, you put the pens away in Gabrielle's clutch and grab at the back of your Lucy head. Pulling her face away from yours, strip quickly out of her clothes and body as you hear a woman's voice complaining to a guard that the bathroom door is locked.

Soon, you are naked again and its somewhat disconcerting to feel all your male parts after spending so long as women today. You don't have time to use the brown pen on Gabrielle so you set to work putting on her body. Stepping into her skin as your body is sculpted into her skin into a fine lithe specimen of female kind. Your torso shrinks into a curvy but slim form and your breasts, while not huge enough to be an inconvenience, are still sizable enough that you knew many of the males were checking out Gabrielle in the gallery. Finally, the head piece goes on and you check out your reflection in mirror and admire her stunning beauty. In any other circumstance, you would find the excitement of slipping into her life to be incredibly arousing but considering your circumstances, you refrain from doing anything unnecessary.

You squeeze into her tight dress and don her clothes before dressing Lucy into her own clothes. Just before the door opens, you manage to zap Lucy, hide the black pen in your new clutch and press the button on the blue pen which gives you Gabrielle's (her friends call her Gabby) memories. A guard and a dumb looking socialite enter the bathroom as you exclaim. You explain that your friend suddenly collapsed on the floor and you have no idea why the door was locked. Neither of the two are suspicious as Lucy wakes up dazzled and confused at her whereabouts. After all, the last thing she remembers is talking to her friend in a parking lot.

As Gabrielle, you excuse yourself after Lucy has been moved to a first aid room still babbling and confused and leave the museum in your Renault. Your new memories tell you that your family is rich and that you've been spoilt senseless by their wealth. Unlike most college students, you have your own private apartment not far from college and no roommate to disturb you. It's big and well furnished and it doesn't take long for you to get there and collapse on the couch exhausted. Before long, you've fallen asleep from all the stress and excitement of the day.


****



You wake up to the sunlight shining across your face. The presence of long brown hair confuses you a little but then you remember that you're still wearing Gabby's skin from last night. Sitting up groggily, you sweep your sleek hair out of your face before heading to the bathroom for a shower, your memories telling you that you're running out of shampoo and should probably go pick some up. The shower is divine, you slept all night in your make up (although in your opinion Gabrielle doesn't really need it) and didn't clean up before going to sleep. As the warm water caresses your lovely body, you resist the urge to explore your new form as you remember this isn't really any time to place since you're on the run.

You dress in some comfortable trackies and head out to the dining room to think. As you prepare a light breakfast (Gabrielle's body needs to stay in shape after all), you think about your options. While you would probably enjoy being this young French woman at any other time, your memories tell you that she has a flight at the end of the week. Semester break is coming up and you have a ticket back to Paris on Sunday to see your parents. Today is Tuesday, so you still have to survive the rest of the week without being caught. Besides, there's no guarantees that the shadowy organisation that you're on the run from doesn't already know you've taken Gabrielle's life or that their reach doesn't extend to France. If there really was a group people who could live other people's lives, there's always a chance that they've replaced important figures in other countries as well. There's just no way to be sure now.

Gabrielle's memories also tell you that she has one last exam to sit on Thursday before she can fly out. You would feel terrible making her fail this test especially since you can tell that she genuinely liked you when you interacted at the gallery. Besides, you do plan to stay as her for a while despite your pangs of guilt.

You decide to:
11221221121211122.title: Test out the other pens

112212211212111221.content:
You do your best to settle into Gabby's life. You enjoy her breakfast, tidy up the plates, and head out to campus. With her memories, the impersonation is easy: you stop off at a coffee shop on the way to pick up her usual order, and make a mental note to pick up some shampoo when you head home.

"Hey, Gabby!" There's a call from the coffee house door. You don't recognize the voice, but Gabby's memories do: it feels almost dizzying to hold the two contradictory thoughts together. Cally Roberts: Gabby's - your - friend. A smile erupts across your beautiful lips as you turn to her.

"Bonjour, Cally. We are well?" Gabrielle always greets her friend this way - Cally seems to like it rather than the English equivalent - so you do so too.

"We are! You heading to the gym?"

"Per'aps later. I just felt like wearing something comfortable today; I was heading to ze library to study for dis stupid test on Thursday."

Cally wrinkles her nose, falling into step as you both leave the coffee house. "Yeah, that's going to suck. Don't sweat it, though. You've always been at the top of the class, you'll breeze it."

"I don't feel like it," you confess. Gabby is slightly more confident than you are, of course, but her memories tell you she always crams hard before a test. Gabby would go to the library to brush up, and if you're going to 'be' her for the week, you'll have to fall in line with her habits.

"You'll be fine. Promise. So, what'cha been up to? Did you end up at that art thing you were talking about?"

"I did, it was remarkable" you nod, suppressing a grin at your description. "Art has a power to open your mind. Today, I feel like a different person."

You talk to each other all the way to campus. Gabby's life is fun, relatively carefree, and easy to slip into. Her identity is your protection - a safety net against whoever had tried to recruit you. All is going well... until you reach campus. Then a chill runs through your stolen veins.

Your mother is standing there, near the main entrance, looking a little lost. Not Gabrielle's mother - Mrs Rieu is in France after all. Your mother. Your real mother. First you feel faint, panicked and frightened. Then you feel Gabby's delicate hands tighten in anger.

The fuckers are wearing your own family, impersonating them, to track you down.

You swallow your emotions, forcing a smile across your disguised face. How did they get here? You can only assume 'Elena' identified the college sweater. Fine... they're looking for Lucy, not you. This is a test. If you can hold your nerve and impersonate Gabrielle past this infuriating impostor, you'll be able to continue in her life until you can fly out. You keep talking to Cally, trying not to look at whoever's wearing your mother's face. Of course, that's almost impossible: the harder you try not to, the more you want to stare.

"Excuse me, ladies?" Your mother's voice rings out in the morning air. You and Cally both turn, startled that you're being addressed.

"Yes?" Cally asks. You arch Gabrielle's eyebrows in quizzical interest.

"I was wondering if you could help me, I'm trying to find the administrator's office?"

Of course she is. She's trying to track down Lucy. Where else would she go? You smile warmly.

"Of course," you say, wishing you had Gabby's mannerisms to slip into as you give directions. "You head down the main path, den take a left, and it is that small red building down ze slope." You finish with a smile, even if you feel the opposite.

"Why, thank you" your mother's voice says. "You've been very helpful."

"No problem."

You and Cally begin to walk away again. You hold your breath as you walk away, and pray your masquerade - however brief - was strong enough. Inside, you're in turmoil. But even a bead of sweat or a look back could give you away...
112212211212111221.title: Live Gabby's life

1122122112121112211.content:
You've seen The Great Escape enough times to remember the climax. No, not Steve McQueen leaping fences with a motorbike. The moment when a simple slip gives the game away.

"Hey, David!"

You turn. "Yes, mom?"

There's a horrible moment, like a knife twisting in your insides, as you realize just what you've done. The moment your guard was down, a simple question, relying on your gut instinct, has given you away. Your mother's body - worn by some unknown agent - grins. Your eyes, disguised as Gabrielle's, widen in horror.

"Found you." Your mother's voice is like ice. In her hand she's reaching up with something: a pen, perhaps. It doesn't matter. You're exposed on the campus, and they've cornered you perfectly. End of the line.

"Huh?" Cally, Gabrielle's friend, standing at your side, looks utterly bewildered. "Gabby, what..."

The interruption gives you the chance you need. Gabby's strong - all that gym work pays off - and you grab the shocked Cally by the arm, catapulting her toward your mother's body. The impostor has gone for a perfect disguise, wearing heels, and is unable to resist the student sent flying in her direction. Cally and 'mom' go falling to the ground in a sprawl of limbs.

You rush forward, stooping down: not to help, but to grap the pen from your opponent's clutches. This one, is seems, has a whole raft of different colored buttons. Whatever; there's no way they'll be shooting you with it now. That gives you a brief head start. Gabby's body is compromized: you need to find a new home, and fast.

You burst into a sprint, thankful you decided to dress in runner's clothing for the day. Behind, you hear aggravated screams and raised noises. Confusion from Cally, howls of frustration from the agent. Gabby will have some explaining to do with her friend once she's her true self, but that's the least of your problems right now.

*****


You've run for a good five minutes, down alleyways and through carparks. Gabby is fit, but you still have to catch your breath after pushing her body to the limit. Right now, you're drenched in sweat and your hair is a mess. You're also a little more than half a mile from your encounter. Options are running out. You slump down next to a dumpster, struggling to regain your breath, wiping sweat-drenched hair out of Gabrielle's eyes.

You know this part of town a little. A little further on, you are sure, is the local hospital; it's a teaching hospital, so located conveniently near to the medical school. Right now your priority is a new face to hide behind, so that's definitely a possible destination: lots of patients, lots of staff, all coming and going. Trying to find you there, even if they work it out, would be like looking for a needle in a haystack. Unless, of course, they have a way to track you down.

Alternatively, you could go with the idea you planned before: head out of town. Gabrielle was too perfect a disguise to adopt at the museum and meant you staying in the vicinity, but your ultimate goal was to escape for good. The museum is on the other side of town, though, and you've already missed the concert, so that's not an option either.

What about the theater?

You frown. What theater? You have no idea what idea just popped into your...

The Hicks Theater. There is a travelling show of Twelfth Night. Its last performance is today's matinee. Then they will be leaving.

With a sharp intake of breath, you realize that this is Gabrielle's mind, not yours. Gabby was - is - a cultured girl, into her art. She not only knows that only half a block from here is the back of the town's playhouse, but that the current performance is about to end. This is all news to you; you think the only time you've ever set foot in the place was on school outings.

However, Gabby's cultured brain is imparting you all kinds of knowledge. Twelfth Night is a play where a woman pretends to be a man, only to fall in love. Part of her personality finds the idea of you assuming your next identity as one of the cast hilarious. You could make a great Olivia or Viola, and use your new body to slip out of town with the group.

It's just a question of turning right or left at the end of this alley.
1122122112121112211.title: Spotted

11221221121211122111.content:
The theatre is a good idea, but it's too far away and you need as much time as possible to find a face and establish an alibi. You get up, your chest heaving as you gasp for air as a result of your sprinting, you need an excuse to get attention in the hospital. Looking around the alley you're currently in, there's nothing around on the floor or any of the container, but you notice a small window next to a door leading into the back of the store right in front of you. You grit your teeth as you walk up to it, looking out at the street to make sure nobody's around. You shut your eyes and look away as your fist slams against the window, shattering it into a million pieces and rather loudly, but what did you expect. The pain stings like mad and when you open your eyes, blood trickles down your fingers, small shards of glass protruding from your knuckles. You hold your wrist and squeeze, biting your lip from the pain.

The hospital is just up ahead, you quickly pick up the pace from a moderate walk to a brisk glide, pushing open the door with your shoulder, you run up to the front desk, trying not to get blood all over it.

Gasping in pain, the secretary looks at you, then to your hand, then back to you. She gets up and without saying a word, walks off briskly down the corridor nearby, yelling for another nurse. You smile and walk to a nearby chair, sitting down in it. A few seconds later, the secretary returns with another lady, she's rather young, slightly older than you. Judging by the look on her face when she sees your condition, she's probably a trainee. She's brought along a large sterilized tissue, ushering you up, the two of you proceed to a room nearby. The secretary however, returns to her desk, soon to be greeted by another ailed individual.

"So, what happened?" The nurse says as she cleans your hand.

"Uhm, I was at home fixing my window. Y'know, the do-it-yourself kind of thing." You lie, it's not the best cover story, but your hand's on fire.

"I see, well it'll be alright, we'll get'cha patched up quickly." She says with a smile.

You return it warmly, she's a pretty woman. Lengthy black hair tied up, she's wearing the hospital's blue uniform. A cross with the pharmaceutical symbol behind it is emblazoned across her breast along with the hospital's name underneath it. "St. Joseph Hospital"

"Alright sweetheart, we're gonna' have to disinfect it now." She places a bowl at your side, producing a bottle of peroxide.

"Oh dear." You mumble, she giggles at your dismay.

"It'll be all over soon, don't worry." You hear the cork of the bottle unscrew, and she nears you.

She grips your wrist gently and guides it over the bowl, tipping the bottle, she pours the chemical over your wound. You jerk your hand instinctively, yelping in pain. A mixture of crimson and white settles in the bowl. You sigh in relief, the pain starts to subside, but your hand is sore. The clanging of a metal tray rings in your ears. The nurse approaches you with a tray bearing a pair of both large and small tweezers, settling them by your side. Picking up the large pair, she takes your hand and looks you in the eye.

"I'm going to remove the glass now, please stay as still as possible, alright?" She says.

"Alright, alright, let's get it over with.." You reply, already irritated.

Quickly, the nurse plucks the shards of glass from your hand and you're surprised at how fast it ended. Luckily for you, most of the glass pieces were large and easy to remove, so she didn't have a hard time. Cleaning up the resulting bleeding, she bandages your hand, tying it very tightly with the knot on the back of your hand.

"There we go." She says, dusting off her hands as she finishes.

You look to the door, it's unlocked still. Hopping off the table prematurely as she walks to a nearby cabinet to put away her supplies. You make sure the door is properly shut and lock it, then turning around, brandishing the black pen from your pocket. The nurse is reaching up into the open cabinet, putting back the bottle of peroxide.

"I'm sorry." You whisper, pressing the button.


A few moments later you're tying your hair back, looking down at the body of a pale, blonde girl who you just attended. She's passed out, and you're about to make that known. Opening the door, you run to a nearby doctor and grab his shoulder, a look of urgency clearly across your face.

"Doctor, my patient's passed out, I think she lost too much blood before getting here!" You say.

"Alright alright! Where is she?" The doctor says.

"I'll lead you, this way!" You say, turning around and heading back.

A few moments later, Gabrielle groans as she rouses, her white bandages spotted with a circle of blood, you stand to the doctor's side as he examines her.

"She seems alright, must've been the shock." He says, putting away his stethoscope.

"Thank God, for a moment there, I thought I was about to get fired."You joke.

The doctor snickers and shakes his head, "Not at all, just make sure she gets out alright."

"Thanks." You say as he leaves, shutting the door behind him.

You explain to a confused Gabrielle her predicament, sending her on her way, albeit sadly. You knew you were going to miss Gabrielle, but there's no time for sentiment, you need to look and be inconspicuous. Walking out into the hallway with Gabrielle, you almost freeze when you see your mother walk through the door. No, you're not going to make the same mistake twice. She spots Gabrielle and promptly walks up to you.

"Excuse me, love, I'm here for her, I hope she's alright." Your mother says.

"What? Who are you..?" Gabrielle frowns, looking at your mother, confused.

"Do you know this lady, Gabrielle?" You ask, looking at Gabrielle's clearly bewildered expression.

"No, I don't. I've never seen her in my life." She mutters.

"Don't be silly, of course you have. I'm here to take you back home." Your mother seems irritated now, you can hear it faintly in her well decorated tone.

"I'm sorry ma'am, but we're afraid we can't sign out any patients without any form of verification." You say.

Your mother looks at you and frowns, then she sighs.

"Alright, fine. I'll call her father then." Your mother says, flipping out her phone. It's not the one she usually uses.

"You'll have to excuse me, I need to get back. Let the secretary help you, okay?" You say, smiling.

"Sure." She says complacently, looking away.

You turn from them and grin, walking down the corridor to the back where you're out of sight. You need to figure out a way to get out of here, you're tired of running and deserve a break at least. Suddenly, your thoughts are interrupted as a senior looking doctor bumps into you on the way down the corridor.

"Oh, I'm sorry Natasha, didn't see you there." The Doctor says with a rather smug expression.

You look up at him confused, judging by his tones, he knows you and is expecting a reaction. Shit, you forgot to use the brown and blue functions in your haste to settle things. You've got no idea who anybody in this building is. Your best bet is to supply him with a flexible reply.

"Of course you didn't, Doctor. I was in the middle of the road." You say, having been hugging the wall the entire time.

He snaps you a look and smiles, leaning in suddenly, he whispers into your ear.

"How about you meet me in my office in 5?"

"Uhm.. I don't know. I'm kinda' busy." You say, trying to find excuses.

"No you're not." He says, smiling, he turns and walks past you down the hallway to the secretary.

You need to blue zap and fast, don't want another situation like that. Heading to the women's washroom, you enter a stall and close the door, pulling out the pen your mother had, it seems to be a combination of all the others. Perhaps the colour coded buttons serve to represent their functions. Aiming at your hand, you hit the blue button and just as planned, your skin's memories come flooding in.

Natasha Bellgrave, aged 26.

You absorb the information quickly, it's nothing new, but then you're amused by one little piece.

The doctor that bumped into you in the hallway is your "secret lover". He and you regularly have affairs in his office made possible by his position in the hospital, as far as memories go, you think nobody else knows about it. His invitation was probably just a booty call. However, you find yourself aroused at the thought, remembering several heated moments shared with him whilst at work. You chuckle and leave the bathroom after freshening up. Making your way to his office, his name is Dr.Jack Fields, as is evident by his named painted across the frosted glass panel in his office door. Opening the door, you step inside and shut it behind you, locking it almost habitually. He's leaning back in his chair, at his desk, having a drink.

"So, what did you want to see me about Jack?" You say, slowly advancing as you pull your shirt up and off, revealing your black lacy bra underneath.

He stares for a moment, and then grins in his smug manner. "I wanted to see you about that thing you did the other day."

"Oh?", you reply, dropping your shirt on the floor, you walk around the side of the desk slowly as he turns towards you. You climb up onto his rather large frame and straddle his lap, reaching behind your back, you unclip your bra. Shrugging the straps off, you allow him to gaze at your rather firm breasts, topped with nice brown nipples. "What did I do the other day?"

"Nothing, nothing at all." He puts his cup down on his desk.

You smile, fishing the pen out from your pants pocket, leaning in subtly, you kiss him on the lips and jam the pen into his chest, pressing the first button, the black one.

"Time to get out of here." You smile.
11221221121211122111.title: Head for the hospital

112212211212111222.content:
You stride across the museum foyer again, letting your radiant hair willow out behind you. Even in track pants, Gabby looks stunning. That's only going to play to your advantage.

As you finished your breakfast and slipped the plates into the sink, an ugly thought had come to you. You had tried to trace exactly how the shadowy organisation could track you - and hit on a major snag. Nobody would suspect you are Gabrielle Rieu, but the 'Elena' imposter saw Lucy... and her college sweater. If the organization were half as good as they seem to be, they'd soon track down Lucy, zap her, work out where she had been with the blue pen. That would take them to the museum, and its security cameras. They'd be able to watch as your Lucy disguise followed Gabby into the bathroom. The rest is all too easy to work out.

All of that, of course, depends on whether they identify Lucy, but you'd rather cover your bases. You're not ready to change skins yet, and if they can play that game, you can too.

"'Allo, I was wondering if you could 'elp me?" You give your most embarrassed smile as you arrive at the security desk. The guard, clearly bored from the lack of visitors on a weekday morning, gives you a helpful smile.

"Yes, m'am?"

"I was 'ere yesterday. You may remember me, my friend collapsed?"

The guard nods. "Yeah. And the door was locked. I remember, miss."

"In the commotion, I think I left my purse? I was wondering if it 'ad been 'anded in?" You smile, and bat your eyelashes. It's not long before you're led to the security room. And, the moment the door is closed, you zap the guard for some privacy.

He doesn't collapse. Instead, he just stands there, dumbstruck. Not frozen, but with a vacant look on his face. You look down in your hand: you've used the white pen by accident. Shit... and you have no idea what it does. While he's stunned, you decide to act.

"Sorry about dis," you say, Gabby's accent sounding even more apologetic than your real voice would. Quickly you hurry to the CCTV network. The DVD records are all kept in a row, the date clearly marked. You grab the relevant copy and pocket it. "Just don't remember any of dis, OK?" you say.

"OK," the guard answers. You blink. Could that be what the white pen is for? Some kind of Jedi mind trick?

"And you don't remember me or my friend from yesterday, either."

"I won't." Obviously this pen can wipe memories. You wonder what else it can do.

"You will remember we came 'ere to check lost property, but dat we did not find anything. Then you will forget dis ever 'appened."

"Yes." You decide to see how far it goes.

"Stand on one leg."

The guard doesn't move. You gulp, and look at the white pen. This has sinister implications. A pen that allows you to alter someone's memories? It works like that thing in the Men in Black movies: just a chance to make people forget what they've seen. In the wrong hands - the organization's, for example - this could have terrible possibilities. Fortunately, you're not an asshole. You're just on the run, and out of options. You're not going to abuse this power.

You level the white pen again, firing. The guard blinks and looks around, first at his surroundings, then at you.

"Miss?" he says, confused. "Sorry, I must have been a world away. Anyway, sorry we couldn't find anything. Guess you lost it somewhere else, huh?"

"I guess so," you smile bashfully. "Thank you for your 'elp."

You leave the museum, figuring your tracks are at least covered now. But there's still the question of whether you live Gabby's life for the next week. You could always head back to campus and prepare for her test. Alternatively, you could head to the college administration building. You're confident enough with your Gabby memories and acting skills you could claim a family member has fallen ill, cry some fake tears and get a pass on her paper. She's wealthy enough to allow you to buy a ticket straight to Paris and fly out immediately - Gabby's memories mean you're able to speak French easily enough. Or, once you hit the airport, you could find another identity. Gabby's a lovely girl, and you enjoyed chatting with her. Stealing her life feels wrong... but if you're going to survive, you're going to have to steal someone's.
112212211212111222.title: Covering your tracks

choices: You decide to rescue your family and friends
It's too risky.  You continue with your plan to escape to France
1122122112121112221.content:
It's business as usual so to speak as you head back to your apartment to live out your new life as Gabrielle. You have classes later today but you just feel melancholic for some reason. Maybe it's your Gabby memories and personality that's making you feel this way. The strange juxtaposition of your memories with hers has given you these mixed feelings, it's almost like she's telling you how upset she is at having her life stolen away. At the same time, you know that she would understand your situation, that she was just in the wrong place at the wrong time and that she'd have probably done the same thing in your situation.

You lounge around on the couch playing with the pens absentmindedly. The black, brown, blue and white pen have all been used at least once so you know what they can do. Strangely though, it's only now that you notice something different about the white pen. Instead of the standard button, the button is actually on a rail. It snaps into the second position with a satisfying click and you press again. A red dot appears on the wall. You're slightly confused. Why would an organisation who has the power to create these mighty devices make one of them a dual purpose laser pointer? It just doesn't seem logical.

Taking aim again, you press the button while pointed at your delicate hand. You watch in surprise as a hole appears in your skin, revealing what looks like your skin underneath. Just as quickly, you see that hole seal itself forming Gabby's flawless skin once again. This development definitely merits another go. Instead of a hole, this time you swipe the laser across your wrist. Again there's no pain but you see a large gash appear on your skin. Before the 'wound' (for the lack of a better word) can seal itself, you seize it with your other hand and pull on your finger tips. Somewhat to your surprise, the entire hand lifts off like a glove and underneath your own hand is revealed. Gabby's hand dangles from a sliver of flesh underneath your male hand. After you don the hand-glove again, your female skin seals itself and restores your body to perfection.

You understand now. As a recruiter, Elena would've had to have had back up in case her potential recruits got too greedy. After all, these bodysuit devices are powerful things, there's no way an organisation as well thought out as this wouldn't have a failsafe for traitors or defectors. A white pen to modify memories as well as strip people from their skins. It's the perfect device for a hunter, one who sniffs out bodysuit jumpers like yourself. You hypothesize that Elena would've stripped you out of your Lucy skin if you had simply given up and then wiped your memories of that day.

This new found power gives you ideas. It is now entirely possible to save some of the loved ones you've left behind. Even if you don't know which of them have been replaced, you can just try out this white pen and if necessary, pull one of the imposters from their bodies. There's only so much you can do alone though. It's highly likely that all of them have been replaced and that the organisation is just waiting for you to try something. You need an edge. As you stare at the last remaining pen, you hope that it will provide what you need.
1122122112121112221.title: Back to the plan

choices: You decide to wait a few days before mounting the rescue
11221221121211122211.content:
The red pen is in your hands. With some trepidation, you press the button gingerly. It's anticlimatic, but nothing happens. You press it multiple times and aimed at various things such as yourself and blankly into space but nothing happens.

"Piece of junk," you exclaim as you slouch back into the couch. You can't believe that the last one was a dud and you fume silently, Gabby's normally serene face screwed up with a mixture of disappointment and rage. As you lay there thinking about all the lives you have borrowed, you accidentally press the button on the red pen absentmindedly. To your surprise, your body starts to swell until you reach a sizable girth. In shock, you run to your bedroom where your full length mirror is, heavy foot steps along the way, where you see Gabby's normally slim athletic body has expanded to overweight proportions. In fact, you look like the splitting image of....

"Lucy!" you shout, half in shock and the other half in fascination. You think back and realise the moment that you pressed the button, you had been thinking about Lucy and were wondering how she was. The image in the mirror definitely looks like Gabby but with Lucy's figure. That's what the red pen does! It provides the user with a way to modify the skin's parameters but to what limits? This is what you have to test. Soon, you have seen Gabby in many different forms. Fat, skinny, anorexic, obese. Whatever body shape you can image, that's what you become. But it isn't limited to that. Hair colour, hair length, hair style, eye colour, skin colour even. There are it's limits though. You can't fundamentally change your appearance too much to become someone else. Just imagine if someone received plastic surgery, that would probably be the extent to how much your host's structure can change. Therefore, things like height are out of the question but even with its limits, you're amazed at how different you can make Gabrielle look just from the few things you can change.

After you've restored your Gabrielle form to its original state, you start to plan. You have five pens. The black one turns anyone hit with it to turn into a wearable bodysuit. The brown one gives you their mannerisms, parts of their personality and muscle memory and facts about them. The blue one transfers all their memories into you, provided that you're wearing them at the time. The white one is a hypnosis and skin stripper. The red one allows you to modify your skin's body at will. Your use of these will be invaluable to helping you retrieve your loved ones.

Loved ones? Is it really possible for you save them all? Or should you pick and choose who you want to go rescue? When would be best to do it? These are questions which you mull over as you plan your escape.
11221221121211122211.title: You decide to rescue your family and friends

112212211212111222111.content:
You sit on the edge of Gabrielle's expansive bed, going through the plan again. You waited until Gabby's test was out of the way before taking action, so if you end up leaving her body it won't compromise her grade. Last night her friends went out to celebrate, but you stayed at her comfortable home, plotting and calculating what to do. That's when it hit you.

They can't be everyone you know. And, given how much they seem to know about you, it's likely they will have only replaced those you would try and contact first. That narrows your focus.

Your mom. Trish. Jessica. Nick, in that order. They are your prime suspects. For your plan to work, you'll have to get one of them alone. But, now you know what the pens all do, that won't be a problem.

It's Friday morning, but before you go out, you need to make some adjustments. You pick up the red pen, and activate it. You feel Gabby's skin tighten, then sag. Her rich, highlighted hair begins to fade, grey slipping through. Her breasts lose their pertness, and her thighs widen. Finally her skin changes hue slightly.

Standing in front of you is Gabrielle Rieu has she would be thirty years from now: still a beauty, one who has gracefully settled into middle age. You smile and watch the crow's feet around her eyes spread. Perfect - just old enough to escape suspicion.

*****


You know your mom's routine best, and you're assuming that if she has been replaced, whoever's using her as a disguise will stick to it. That means a session at the local pool, every Friday morning. You get a day pass and linger in the locker room. Sure enough, she turns up for 'her' session swimming lengths. You time it so you're alone together, calmly collect the white pen from your locker, point, and fire. A gash erupts down her back from where you fired - exposing another's skin underneath. By the time the impostor has realized they've been made and spun around, you've fired the black pen.

"Gotcha," Your rich, French-accented voice says.

Slipping in to a changing cubicle, skin in hand, you aim the white pen and, a few strokes later, strip your mother's skin free. You're relieved as it reseals, unharmed, as you set it aside. In front of you is the impostor's skin. It's a woman's - your age, perhaps a little older, and from the flat, deflated face she looks remarkably average. The kind of girl you could pass in the street and never think of again. Perhaps that's the point. You had assumed it would be a guy, but that's a trivial concern. You strip off your clothes, steady the older Gabrielle's leg, and begin to pull the skin on.

Moments later you're looking at the angry, plain face of the impostor. You have no idea who she is, but clearly she's been assigned to wait to see if you would try to make contact with your family. Now the tables are turned. You look down at your current body. Average, in every regard. An average build. An average height. An average face. It's almost as though the organization's agents have used the red pen to make themselves as inconspicuous as possible. Well, if that's the case, you're soon going to find out.
