If you want to rescue your family, you need to know what your opponents are doing. Fortunately, that's not hard at all.

You point the blue pen at yourself - the pen that gives you the current skin's memories - and fire.
112212211212111222111.title: The rescue begins

choices: Trish's skin doesn't open up.  The memories were false!
Jessica also drops in for a surprise visit.
1122122112121112221112.content:
A gentle stream of information enters your mind. It's not quite the torrent that you normally get but its small enough that it concerns you. You search the memories that the blue pen has granted you and honestly it's not much. Basically all you know is that this person got orders to replace your mother, Marie Anderson and await contact with David. Two other agents had been inserted into people close to yourself being Trish and Jessica. You're glad that you were right about your guesses but you're frustrated by the lack of information. There's nothing in this person's mind about their identity, who they work for, why they look so average. The only information you have now are the parameters of this agent's mission. There isn't even an end time specified. You're assuming that these three agents will stay in place until they are recalled by whoever their employer is. The information you've received only really tells you that to rescue your closest friends/family will mean putting yourself in greater risk. After all, two of them are now inhabited by trained imposters of some kind.

Before you step out of the cubicle, you step into your mother's skin and assume her form with the blue pen giving you all her memories up until the point that the nondescript woman replaced her. It's more than a little disconcerting to wear her form but you promise silently that this will only be temporary, at least until you can relocate her and rescue the ones you care about most. To do that, you need to pretend to be one of the agents, going about their business while awaiting for David to return home.

You go about your mother's daily routine. A catch up with her own high school friends. A stop at the supermarket to buy groceries before returning home to catch her afternoon soap. Your mother truly has a mundane schedule. But it doesn't matter. If you follow it to a tee, no one will suspect that you aren't who you claim to be. And neither will the agency.

A day passes in your mother's life and you realise that no one knows that you have disappeared. In fact, everyone is of the opinion that you've simply been sent off to boarding school; a decision that your family had been discussing for months now and that you'd suddenly changed your mind in going. It's obvious that this shadowy organisation has been modifying memories in your absence. You've suspected this for a while, but this nemesis that you're up against definitely has their fingers in many pies.

Finding some way to expose Trish or Jessica won't be particularly easy as your mother. As Marie Anderson, you simply have no real reason to visit them and going out of your way to find them will expose you as an imposter. It's very fortunate then, that on your second day of watching through excruciatingly boring soaps that Trish comes to visit out of the blue. You act exactly as your mother would and invite her in but from the few memories that you retrieved, you know that this Trish is an imposter. When she turns her back on you, you aim both the white and black pens and fire.
1122122112121112221112.title: Drawing a blank

choices: A new face to fight back
11221221121211122212.content:
Sunday comes quickly. Gabby's final test went well, you think. For some reason you studied far harder for someone else's test than you ever have for any of your own - maybe you felt like you owed her. Gabby's friends headed out for a few drinks after the test had ended, and you joined them to celebrate, commiserate and part ways for the break - you are her, after all. Since you plucked up enough courage to remove the skin and hit her with the brown pen on Wednesday evening, the masquerade has been easy. You realized you've been overdoing it with her accent, for example; she's not an 'oo la la' kind of lady as you've been pretending; you've been laying on her accent too thick. Now you can remember and feel just as she would if you choose.. at least, on the surface you can.

Deep down, being Gabrielle is a melancholy experience. Outwardly you seem excited you are heading home; certainly your excitement spilled over in a Skype conversation with her mother - a test you set yourself to ensure you can both speak French and impersonate her perfectly. But inside you feel a deep sadness.

Part of it is that Gabrielle really didn't deserve this fate. You're her as a necessity, but it doesn't make it any easier; you know she wouldn't want this existence. Who would? But you can set those thoughts to one side. Late on Wednesday you discovered the red pen's ability to change a skin's weight, apparent age and details like hair and skin color. While you experimented with its powers, you knew exactly how Gabrielle - as perfect as she is - would have improved herself if she had the pen. She would have used the pens to borrow someone's life in your situation, you are sure. That eases your guilt a little.

The real cause for your sadness is your family and friends. Back when this started, you had every intention of rescuing them. Now you realize just how impossible that would be. For one thing, where do you stop? Rescue Jimmy or Trish and their family would face the same fate as your own. Rescue your relatives and your extended family would become a target... and six are harder to hide than one. Your only option is to leave them behind to the whims of this secret, sinister organization.

That's why, as she sits in the airport waiting for her flight, a beautiful French woman, dressed in comfortable designer jeans and a loose T-shirt, is sobbing quietly behind her sunglasses. You've made it through every test you have have faced, and you could escape to France in a few hours. You've checked your luggage - the pens safe and inconspicuous in your hand baggage - but you haven't been able to being yourself to venture into the departure lounge. As you stare at your French passport, you know this is the final step. Leave as Gabrielle and you never see your family again.

Are you really ready to give up? You have your reasons, but there has to be a way to save your family. What kind of life would you have if you left now if you did? You could be anyone you want (and Gabrielle is a great choice for a life, at least temporarily) but you would always feel like you should have done more now. Even if you take the fight to this organization from France, if you run now you'll regret it.

Saying put is still an option. You could swap with someone heading back to town. From the small overpriced bistro you're sat in, you can see the arrivals hall. A group of stewardesses are making their way through, standing out from the crowd with their perfect appearance and crisp crimson suits. You spot one, a beauty with auburn locks and far too much makeup, break from the group and head to the toilet. She could be a chance to head back to town.

Or you could switch with one of the steady stream of arriving passengers. There seem to be a few options: businessmen and women, back from a convention given the sharp suits and branded bags they are carrying. There's an older, still attractive blonde woman in her mid-forties, returning from vacation with her family you assume - she's still in a floppy hat and sundress, and hasn't lost her figure. There's also an Afro-Caribbean woman in her late twenties, her hair in a ponytail and dressed in a sports jacket, who could be a possibility. You're sure you recognize her as the star midfielder of the local women's soccer team; Trish dragged you along to a game once. You can't remember her name, but she plays at international level. Not an outright celebrity (women's soccer doesn't attract big crowds), but without question a potential new identity if you decide to turn back.

There are lots of options, but you have to decide: leave for France, or head back into town and fight.
11221221121211122212.title: Last call for your flight

choices: You were right to trust him
112212211212111222121.content:
It's a cool autumn day in Paris as you read a book in a quiet cafe along the Rue di Rivoli whilst sipping your coffee. As you brush your sleek hazel hair from your face, you remember that just about six months from this day, you had escaped the clutches of an evil clandestine organization which was intent on recruiting you into their fold. Even more amazing still, was the fact that you'd heard nothing or seen anything suspicious in the last half year to indicate that they were on your trail.

The last six months hadn't been easy. Always watching your back to make sure that you weren't being followed, keeping an eye on every single person you meet and never being able to trust anyone you meet; the stress of it all had been overwhelming. It didn't really help that you'd had to change identities a few times already. When Gabrielle's summer break was over, you'd been forced to switch skins. After all, Gabby was going back to your hometown to study and that proximity would've been enough to tempt you into doing something stupid or revealing yourself. So when Gabby flew off (with your memories as her implanted thanks to the white pen), you'd waved goodbye to her as her loving younger sister Isabel.

Life as Isabel hadn't been hard. She was around your age and had two loving parents who doted on her. There was something comfortable about this family and for some reason, you decided not to move on. You kept constantly vigilant of course and kept your senses sharp by replacing your new mother and father every now again, but you always stayed in the same family. It was for that same reason that you also became Gabby again when she returned for a break.

It had been about thirty minutes since you'd started waiting in that little cafe with your book when he arrived. Gabby had arranged a meeting with her older brother to catch up and talk about life and you weren't about to do anything out of the ordinary. After all, if you were going to be this woman in the long term, there was no sense in making her a recluse.

"Gabrielle!" exclaimed Jacque, as he kissed you on the right cheek, "It's been too long." He lingered slightly as he kissed your other and whispered in English "You are being watched. Act normal."

Your eyes widen for a split second as hear his warning but otherwise you give no indication of hearing it. The two of you reminisce for a while before he invites you to walk with him. You walk briskly beside him as the two of you browse the unreasonably expensive stores filled with Louboutins and Prada. As you feign interest, which isn't particularly hard given Gabby's actual interest in all these, you notice a young couple which seem to trailing after the two of you which you recognise from the cafe. Your brother, obviously aware of these two, pulls you into an exclusive Chanel store to browse. As you enter, the doors close and lock behind you; preventing the couple from following.

The shop assistant is a young woman who couldn't be much older than 25 nods at your brother and opens the curtain to the back room. You hesitate for a moment, your senses telling you that he can't be trusted.

"Please Gabrielle, I'm trying to help you." His eyes seem honest; they carry this sense of world-weariness to them yet there's something trust-worthy about them. You decide to trust your instincts and follow him. After all, they've kept you safe for the last six months.
112212211212111222121.title: Head to France

choices: You make it to the safe house without incident
1122122112121112221212.content:
You enter the back room with your hand in your purse, the black pen is gripped firmly in your petite hand. Inside, there's two men with sharp features; both of them around thirty in age. They watch as you enter and keep their eyes firmly on you, as if watching for any suspicious movements. Jacque nods at them and they seem to relax ever so slightly, their eagle like gazes still fixated upon you.

You stop right at the entrance to the room. "Alright Jacque, I think you owe me an explanation."

"Agreed, but I think this will help explain the situation a lot easier." Your brother begins to strip rapidly and in your surprise, you simple watch him. It isn't long until he's completely naked and your Gabby memories/personality tell you this is something completely out of the ordinary for the two of you. One of the men approaches Jacque from behind and pulls out a long metallic looking strip and places it against his back. It's a zipper. To your surprise, it adheres and you watch in wonder as Jacque pulls it open. You blink rapidly, not sure if it's some kind of optical illusion but there's no mistake. A gash has appeared in his back and the skin in the opening is clearly not his. His skin distorts as the figure within pulls and disengages themselves from the disguise.

A young woman emerges from the skin like a butterfly from its cocoon.

Her appearance was remarkable; young nubile flesh, long blonde hair and yet her face looked like it'd seen a war. She was probably no younger than 18 yet she seemed mature and wise beyond her years. The world-weariness that you'd seen in Jacque's eyes had clearly come from this woman.

"Quickly now I don't have time to explain, "Give your Gabrielle skin to Gerard here and we'll make our escape." As she said this, she pulled back another curtain to reveal two gagged and blindfolded women who she obviously intended to become a pair of disguises.

You hesitate. Obviously, this is happening too fast and you don't know what you can trust anymore. Sensing your reluctance, the woman walks over to you and grasps you firmly on the shoulders.

"Listen, I know you must be scared and confused right now David but I'm with the DGSE - French Intelligence. We've been looking for you for a long time; ever since you pissed off the wrong people and went into hiding. I'm here to offer you a change to get back into the game, a fighting chance. But first we need to get those two agents off your tail. And to do that, Gerard and Michael here need to take our places for now. Rest assured, we can get you back to Gabrielle life once its safe to. Until then, I need you to trust me until we reach the safe house."

There's something about this woman that you feel like you can trust. Maybe it's the fact that she's completely naked whilst she spouts these unbelievable words. Maybe its the fact that you've finally gone off the deep end. Or maybe you're just tired of running and this opportunity, no matter how absurd, is what you needed to whip you out of your stupor; the comfort that you'd obtained from just living as Gabby and her family. The friends and family you'd been forced to leave behind; maybe there was finally a chance.

The choice isn't hard. Shortly afterwards, Gabby and her brother leave the store followed closely by the young American couple. Another hour passes before two cute French girls also depart from the store, one of them holding a quintet of coloured pens in her Chanel handbag.
1122122112121112221212.title: Family Trust

11221221121211122212121.content:
It takes maybe another hour for the two of you to finally reach the safehouse. Even with your two decoys, your new 'friend' takes you along a plethora of different transport types and a maze of back alleys before you finally reach a dingy nondescript hole in the wall. As you follow your companion deeper into the building, you start to wonder if you made the right decision. She opens the door and you follow her into a sparsely furnished ground floor unit of some kind. After she offers you a seat at the dining table, you wait anxiously as she goes into a nearby room to remove her disguise. Even though you've only been wearing the unknown French girl's skin for a short time, you feel at home. Exposing your natural born form feels strange nowadays especially now that you're in such an unknown situation.

The DGSE agent emerges from the room as herself, dressed casually in a woolen sweater and pants. Her eyes widen a little when she sees the pen you're pointing directly at her and she raises her hands in surrender.

"I think it's time you gave me an explanation," you try to say menacingly but failing miserably due to your disguised voice.

A wry smile forms on her face, "I wouldn't do that if I were you." You hear the sound of a cocking pistol behind you and you see a burly man pointing a large handgun at your head. "We're taking a very big chance contacting you like this so please let us just be civil." She nods at her companion who holsters his weapon and takes up a position near the door. Likewise, you lower your pen and place it back into your bag.

"My name is Yvonne Poesy and I am a member of the Direction Générale de la Sécurité Extérieure. French Intelligence Agency." She adds when she notices your confused look. "For many years now, we have been investigating a secret organisation which has been systematically controlling world events through the replacement of important individuals at key moments in time. This organisation, which we have taken to calling La Dissimuler, has evaded our attempts to capture or contain any of its agents. So we branched out and started tracking their recruiters. That's what led us to you."

"Monsieur Anderson, you are one of a kind. You are the only one who we know of who has rejected La Dissumuler's recruiters and also escaped successfully. We can therefore offer one another something very unique. You may have noticed that our technology is a fair bit more primitive than theirs."

You'd have to agree. The zipper device that they possessed was a lot more conspicuous and less convenient that the pens. Not only that, you had only been able to access the most recent memories of the girl you were wearing; a most inconvenient disadvantage for this kind of technology.

"If you would allow us to study your pens in some detail, we will help you rescue your friends and family. No matter how long it takes, you will have our resources on your side when you decide to make it happen." Yvonne pauses for a moment to gauge your reaction. Your gut feeling is that there must be something more to this. Wouldn't it be far easier to just kill you now and take your pens? You're pretty sure everyone in the room would agree that you'd be dead from a gunshot to the head before you could even take out a pen to defend yourself. What gives?

She purses her lips at your silence. "We anticipated it may be a little difficult for you to agree to our terms so we decided to offer you something first." At her indication, the male agent walks into one of the other rooms and drags out a very familiar figure. An older teenaged girl with blonde hair. It's Jessica.

You rush towards her as the agent hands her over. She's clearly been drugged and her eyes are glazed over but otherwise she seems fine. Jessica is shivering under the blanket they have draped over her as she's wearing nothing but underwear beneath it.

"I would suggest that you deal with La Dissimuler's person first. We have been unable to extract them from your girlfriend's skin which is why we have kept her sedated until your arrival." The two DGSE agents watch in fascination as you pull out the white pen and extract a young male with an incredibly average face from Jessica's skin. You look at him in disgust as the male agent quickly injects him with some kind of tranquillizer and drags him off to the other room. With Jessica's skin cradled in your arms, Yvonne asks you once more.

"Will you join us Monsieur?"
11221221121211122212121.title: La Dissimuler

112212211212111222121211.content:
You look at Yvonne, outrage burning in your eyes. You're beyond angry. Hot spit flecks out if your mouth as you bark your response.

"Damn right I am." You stare at Yvonne, then cradle Jessica to the sofa, taking a blanket and placing it over her.

"Good. But you should not do... Wait!"

It's too late. You fire then pen and watch as Jessica returns to normal. You watch as she stirs.

Then, looking around, she screams.

"Jessica! Calm down! You're OK! You're OK!"

"Who the fuck are you! Where the fuck am I?" She's breathing heavily, clearly panicked.

"It's Dav..." For a moment you forgot your new identity. The zipper really is an inferior method. "Uh... my name is Marie. You're safe."

"Where's safe, you bitch? The last thing I remember is... Is... That douchebag Jimmy coming around and asking for me. Where the hell am I?"

You realize there's no point to explaining what has happened in the past six months. For Jessica, only seconds have passed. Some intruder has been living her life, stealing her precious minutes and seconds from her. They enjoyed her 18th birthday party, graduation; you wonder if she's in college now. It's all pretty hard to explain, and you're not sure if it's even best to do so. You pause, then reach for the zipper.

"No!" Yvonne barks. She holds out her hand commandingly. "Pen, now." You don't know why, but you obey instantly. Jessica returns to her state, and Yvonne turns to you, shaking the black device at you. "Why don't you think, hmm? She does not know this face of yours! She does not remember what has been done! She needs to be brought out of this state by someone far more expert, who can help her recover. This will be traumatic, she has lost months!"

You look down, sheepishly. The white pen solves that issue, but you're not sure saying as much would help. Yvonne casts her petite shoulders up, the blonde locks rising and falling dramatically.

"They need to pay for what they've done to her."

"To others in your family, too. But this takes time, David. You need to take time. It is like bursting a blister, sometimes you have to wait for it to settle, hmm?" She lightens, smiling and rubbing you on the arm. "I know how much this hurts you. But use it. Together we can tackle La Dissumuler. Once we are on a level playing field with the technology, they will not be able to stop us."

You wonder if anyone should have this technology. Who created it, and why? Where did it all start? Your mind is a mess of questions and queries. For now, though, you think it's better to listen. "What do you plan to do with the pens?" You begin to scratch at your stolen skin, feeling disgusted and ashamed just to be living like this. But it's the only way you know, now.

"Study them," Yvonne shrugs. "They are more advanced than our prototypes. We suspect the Americans may have more developed technology, but they are too tied up in their own bureaucracy to use it. French Intelligence does not have this problem. We use our zipsuits for active and counter operations, including wet work as necessary. I will take the pens, now, and your girlfriend. She will be restored, monitored in a secure hospital facility, given a story she can believe until the truth is made known to her. It's a difficult life, the one you have chosen to lead. Such an initial shock must be dealt with by professionals, no?"

You sigh. "I guess."

"Good. And the pens - ha! they do look like stylos - will go to research. You will not get them back soon, if at all."

You suddenly feel a little more apprehensive about the deal. The whole point of the pen was that you had a significant advantage, the person's memories. That prevents any really deep integration. Perhaps you could only give up some of them, and keep the memory pen for yourself. "I understand Yvonne."

"Poesy. Do not call me by my first name, we are not friends, recruit."

"So I'm a recruit, now?"

"D'accord. You have survived a long time. But those skills are not enough if you're going to work with us. Normally membership of my particular section requires, obviously, French nationality. With you such a condition does not apply - your current body is French, is it not? So, then, training."

"My accent will give me away. I'll need a disguise." You try and be pragmatic. The current disguise was meant to be temporary, after all.

"Of course you do. We will provide a suitable candidate. Her name is Rochelle Tanzir. officer, Police Nationale. Selected for training but, unknown to her, washed out. Determined woman, though. Orphan, French-Algerian, grew up in Lyon, no close family. No friends, she just studies. A shame she is not the right material. But she has agreed to take part in a programme, and she is not close enough to her classmates for any to spot a switch."

"And I start right away?"

Yvonne pauses, and thinks. "You do not need to do so. You can wait until Jessica is recovered. She will not be part of our team, but she can stay with you. It would mean our research team would be more likely to upgrade from our zipper, too. That would be an advantage."

"I'd still be out of the fight."

Yvonne taps her lips. "Not necessarily," she muses. "You could do what you have been doing since you came to France: live the life of another. We have information that leads us to connect a string of robberies with group of individuals travelling the country in their professional capacity. It would be low enough risk, I feel, to substitute you in. We suspect this group does not contain any La Dissumuler agents, although the funds from their robberies are being directed to them. Your disruption, or participation as a sleeper agent, would be of great benefit to us."

You wonder what professionals travel the country. Actors? Some kind of sports team? A circus? Yvonne has been vague. It's a distinct option. Alternatively, the sooner you pass this training, the sooner you can fight back properly.
112212211212111222121211.title: The Foreign Legionnaire

choices: Erase Yvonne's memories of the other pens
Become Yvonne and modify Rochelle's memories
1122122112121112221212111.content:
You agree reluctantly to the training. This is all happening so quickly and you don't know what you want to do. Sure, it's a brilliant opportunity that this big budgeted and resourced intelligence agency has offered you their help, but it'll all be for naught if you don't jump through their hoops first. If you were caught or worse, killed on a mission because you had no training, you don't know if you could ever forgive yourself for messing up. Even if you were just a sleeper agent, there's no way a group of wary individuals wouldn't notice anything amiss. Gabby's family was one thing, but a group of La Dissumuler associates or sympathisers was another thing altogether.

Yvonne leads you into the other room where you see a glass topped chamber, inside which you see a naked young woman lying there unconscious. The capsule's cover is partial frosted over and you see a fine steam emitted from her mouth as she breathes slowly but rhythmically. She appears tanned and has a long sleek chestnut coloured hair.

"This is Rochelle. You two will become very intimate over the coming months." Your handler points to the woman in her glass cage.

As you gaze upon your new identity, you realise that this is absurd. You're going from a fugitive on the run to a French intelligence agent of sorts. You have no idea why you've agreed to this in the first place, the offer has been a little too good to be true. And the worst part is the fact that your new sponsors expect you to relinquish your most valued possessions, the C-set to them permanently. The almost magical C-Set which has been your only true companion over the last six months. The technologically advanced pens which has given you an almost unfair advantage over anyone who has come across your path and kept you out of harm. Something about giving them up so easily just didn't sit right with you.

Yvonne holds the black pen in petite hands and shoots it at Rochelle as soon as the lid opens. Unbeknownst to her, you are still gripping the white pen in your right hand, hidden up your sleeve after you had freed Jessica. As she turns to you, her eyes widen as you shoot her with the white pen. Quickly, you duck out of the room and also freeze her male bodyguard; who had no expected any trouble as you'd left your handbag outside. He'd made an incorrect assumption that all your pens were inside that.

Panic started to set in. Both your new DGSE companions were completely at your mercy. None of them could move and you could easily erase or alter their memories. But this opportunity was far too good to pass up. The opportunity to get back into the fight but with the backing of an international spy network at your side. You could take the simple route and just erase Yvonne's memories of the other pens and only give up the bare minimum; probably just the black pen or maybe also the brown.

There was also one other option you could think of. As you looked down at the white pen, you realised how powerful its memory altering abilities were. You gazed at the frozen Yvonne; a perfect disguise for getting into the DGSE and possibly their inner circle. It would be easy enough to awaken Rochelle and make her think that she was you wearing her skin. Obviously, it wouldn't be perfect but given enough time and memory alterations, you were sure you could make her become almost a perfect replica of you. Meanwhile, you would become Yvonne Poesy, the seemingly experienced young woman who had been tasked with recruiting you to their cause.
1122122112121112221212111.title: Training

11221221121211122212121111.content:
Yvonne stares blankly at you as you pluck the black pen from her petite fingers. She continues to stare as you shoot her with the black pen and turn her into a pile of skin. It was to be expected after you had hypnotized her with the white pen. As you pick up her flaccid flesh, you think over the situation in your head. The DGSE had offered you a way back in, a way to fight an unknown oppressive organisation that they had dubbed the La Dissimuler; the same organisation which had tried to recruit you 6 months ago. However, you figured that there was no way that the DGSE was doing this simply out of the goodness of their hearts - there had to be another angle for them.

Sure, you'd shown some street smarts and a complete lack of scruples when it came to taking over people's lives but that couldn't be the only thing. The C-set was obviously their target but if that was the only thing, why would they bother even trying to recruit you in the first place. There was simply too many unknowns in play here for you to just hand over the C-set without getting some honest answers. That said, you didn't want to risk antagonising your new 'associates' by replacing your recruiter. All you wanted was some answers and the key to them was Yvonne Poesy.

As you worked your way into the young infiltrator's skin, a chill spread throughout your body. It wasn't the fact that you were still wearing Marie's skin as you slipped into another's. It wasn't even the cold. It was the thrill you had felt from living through other people's lives. That thrill you had lost and forgotten when you'd settled into Gabby's life and stopped taking on new personas. There was something that had stirred within you today when you had gotten the change to live a little, to slip around as a chameleon, taking on different forms as you needed to. Maybe joining this organisation would help give that back to you.

After you had sealed the skin up, you shot yourself with the blue pen. Instantly, the woman's memories flooded into your head and you sifted through them all, trying to find anything useful to you.

Her name was Helene Belamy. The name Yvonne Poesy was simply one of her identities, one of dozens she had taken during her career. Trained from a young age, she had been wearing zip suits on and off since she had been 14. Due to this, even though she was biologically around 18, she was chronologically close to 30 years old. Distinguished as one of the top in her cohort, Helene had been instrumental in operations which sought to curb La Dissimuler's growing influence in the modern world. Despite their efforts, they were definitely losing the war. Their resources, manpower and technology could not hope to match that of the shadow organisation. The greatest risk was that the larger the DGSE grew, the more susceptible it became to infiltration.

That's why they needed an X-Factor. An edge to help them get back into the fight.

When Helene had been given this task, her instincts had been to kill you and just take your pens. Nothing you had shown her, especially that foolish display with Jessica had won you any points. However, the Director had specifically ordered her to recruit you. Despite having the Director's ear, he would not be dissuaded from this and was adamant that this unfortunate American teenage be taken under the DGSE's wing. Helene knew of many people who would disagree with that decision.

You stood there in silence as you absorbed her memories, Helene's golden locks sway in time with your breathing. You had a little more faith in the DGSE's offer now; it seemed honest enough even if there questions about our recruitment. If the Director had enough faith in you, there should be harm in going along with it for a while. On the other hand, if news got out about your 'defection', you might lose any chance you had to return to your hometown and rescue your family. After all, your supporters were far and few in this foreign land.
11221221121211122212121111.title: The Art of Spying

11221221121211122212121112.content:
It wasn't easy and you were almost killed at least half a dozen times, but you got past the first six months. Six months in the role of Yvonne Poesy, the young DGSE agent who had attempted to recruit you to their cause. Key word being attempted because it had been six months since you replaced her and awoken Rochelle and modified her memories enough that she could pass as you.

Obviously it had not been an easy time for you. In reality, Yvonne was a highly trained field agent, experienced in the art of seduction, masquerade, combat - all things that you were not. Even with the power of the brown and blue pens, it still took a lot of effort to draw upon her memories, her habits, her training. And although you had almost gotten yourself killed or your cover blow more times than you cared to count, you had somehow completed all of the missions that came Yvonne's way. It had been a true trial by fire but you'd embarrassed enough politicians, assassinated foreign enemies and stolen technologies that you felt confident in whatever mission came next.

Your missions had been even harder because for the majority of that time, you'd been deprived of your precious pens. The pens which had kept you alive since your first encounter with La Dissimuler but you knew that R&D was hard at work replicating their designs. The zipsuits had been a difficult substitute to use but they served their function well enough. Yvonne's training and abilities also helped tremendously.

It wasn't all missions. You'd lived out Yvonne's life, meeting up with her few friends and family, keeping up her rigid gym routine and even indulging in a few short term relationships. None of it lasted of course - her training and your instincts told you to keep relationships at a minimum to not get distracted from the end game. The dissolution of the insidious organisation which the DGSE called La Dissimuler. You'd come tantalizingly close on a few of your missions but they always seemed one step ahead. This was a hidden blessing you assumed, since your borrowed experience wouldn't truly be enough to handle a proper La Dissimuler agent. Both you and the DGSE had to bide your time for the proper moment to strike.

Jessica had been a good companion as well. Although you were in the form of Yvonne, you had maintained contact with her through Rochelle. After all, you were still her mentor and contact. Your frequent sessions with her meant that you had the perfect opportunity to turn her into a zipsuit. To replace her as you had Yvonne and through her form, meet with Jessica. Jessica had obviously been freaked out by the first time this happened but over time, she grew accustomed to her new situation. She understood that you had to work with the DGSE in order to save your family and friends. It had gotten to the stage when they'd even let her go outside with supervision. The supervision was clearly there to keep her under control but also to make sure that she wasn't reacquired by La Dissimuler.

Today was a special day though. Today was the day that you started the counterattack. Today was the day that R&D were presenting their first replicated pens.
11221221121211122212121112.title: Become Yvonne and modify Rochelle's memories

choices: Continue the fight with the DGSE
112212211212111222121211121.content:
"Bonjour Poesy!" exclaimed the Director as he leaned in to kiss you on the cheeks. The Director of the DGSE had always had a soft spot for Yvonne and had considered her something of his protege. Rochelle was already seated opposite the Director.

"Excellent work with dismantling the Albanian trafficking network. Many mothers and fathers will be very happy once those poor souls return home. But enough of that. You are both here because we have finally cracked the code. We have replicated it at long." He pauses dramatically then flourishes a pen from his suit jacket. It's almost an exact match for the black pen that you used previously but this time it had a number of different buttons built into it. Almost like cheap four colour pens you could get from the local newsagent.

"This is the first production model of our labour. Made some improvements to it we have. Our version has the functionality of all five pens that our good friend here gave us. We will be rolling out this device to our most trusted agents. Including yourself of course Poesy."

He goes to hand the pen to you but pauses. "Except I have noticed something odd as of late. Our Rochelle here has been progressing rather inconsistently with her training. Sometimes she will have amazing results and other times I question my decision to recruit her."

Rochelle goes to speak up but you cut in. "David has been telling me that he is distracted of late. It has been six months since we offered to help him recover his family and friends but all he has been doing is training. He is anxious and impatient at how little progress has been made since he joined."

"That is a fair point. At least it would be if that were actually David. Isn't that right Monsieur Anderson?" The Director stares right at you and points the pen directly at your chest.

"What is ze meaning of this?" you say, outrage in your voice as you rise to your feet. There's no where to run and Rochelle seems unusually passive given the events happening before her. The Director motions for you to sit back down.

"I think you misunderstand," he continues with a grin, "Rather than mad I am rather impressed. It took me quite some time to realise what was happening. I thought it odd that Rochelle's test results seemed to vary from week to week. Sometimes she was no better than when she had completed her entry aptitude tests. Other times, they were extraordinary. Then I realised one key factor - Rochelle always did better in the weeks that she met up with you."

"You see, the Poesy I know is too professional to cover for an underling like that. In fact, she'd be much too cold to help someone I had ordered her to mentor. Someone she didn't even like. So the only explanation that made sense was that you, David, was actually Poesy. It wouldn't have made sense otherwise."

You hung your head. With the pen pointed straight at you, there was little point in lying now. He could easily knock you out or strip you from your Yvonne skin with the white pen's functionality.

"I suppose you'll skin me now right? You've gotten what you wanted. The power of the pens and now you won't have to deal with me either," Yvonne bitterly said.

To your surprise, the Director smiles. "Absurdité! On ze contrary, I want to congratulate you. You have managed to trick everyone in this office, myself included. You impersonated Ageny Poesy almost perfectly for six months and nobody noticed. You have completed all her missions satisfactorily, although I think there were some close calls there. If anything, Yvonne is all yours. You have proven a valuable asset with her skills and experience under your thumb. Alas, she was a great agent but together, I think you two are greater. Here." He casually tossed the pen over to you.

"A token of my good will. We are grateful that you have allowed us to replicate the insidious weapon of our enemy. We would be even more grateful if you would stay on and help us continue the fight with La Dissimuler. What do you say, Agent Poesy?"
112212211212111222121211121.title: Meeting the Boss

112212211212111222122.content:
You can't go now, you resolve. You've got to fight back against this mysterious entity that has entered your life, and is now happily living the lives of those near and dear to you. Your family and friends are in the grip of a conspiracy few could imagine exist. And, if you stand for anything, it's for them.

You rise, dabbing Gabby's tears away, and walk slowly and deliberately to the arrivals corridor, patting yourself on the thigh in thought. Gabrielle's body has, for the last few days, felt perfect on you. In fact, you can't imagine being a man again; the idea of looking at your dick again makes you feel strange, as if it's an alien appendage rather than part of your body. It's funny, you think; you used to consider it your most important body part. Now that it's gone - or at least submerged under Gabby's exquisite flesh - you don't feel like you miss it.

You reach the arrivals hall, and look for your targets through the crowd. The flight attendant you thought had been heading for the toilet was obviously caught by her friends, because she's making her apologies still, but finally heads to the restroom. You quickly single her out. If you're going to be a woman, you're going to be a beautiful one. Anything less would feel like a step down after several days as an undeniably hot French woman. You cut your way through the crowds and slip after her.

This is a drill you've done before. Outside is a ''toilets closed for maintenance" sign left by some careless airport staffmember, which you hang on the handle. Then you walk in and quietly jam the lock; you're lucky that the door has one at all, but you're not going to question small mercies. You spot the attendant heading for a stall, and point the brown pen at her.

Immediately, information rushes through your mind. Pin number, cell number, flight numbers. Isla Clarkson, age 30 years, almost nine years' experience as a flight attendant.

You call out.

"Miss? Excuse me?" Gabrielle's sweet French accent slips across your tongue like butter. You're going to miss the sound of her voice. The attendant stops, and turns to you.

"Yes?" She says with a thick Scots accent; evidently she's from a European airline. You don't hesitate a second longer: you lift the black pen and fire.

*****


You're out of Gabby's T-shirt and clothes, busy slipping her skin from around your ankles, when disaster strikes. You hear the sound of a door opening. Not from outside, but from within.

A woman steps out of a toilet cubicle: the older blonde woman in floppy hat and sundress you saw earlier. You can only imagine what she must see: a naked man, with the loose, limp, mask-like face of a woman around his legs, staring at her in shock. A few metres away, crumpled under a crisp crimson uniform, the red-haired locks of a flight attendant. Her eyes widen, her mouth flops open, and you brace yourself for a scream.

None comes. The woman continues to stare, mouth flapping like a fish, before her eyes roll and she falls into a faint. You waste no time in reaching for a pen and zapping her. Her stats begin to consume your mind. Mrs Mary-Ann Whittling, aged... Shit. In your panic you used the brown pen. You shake off the memories and grab the black pen, watching as she collapses into a skin.

You look at the chaos around you. Gabrielle's beautiful body is trailing around your legs, her flowing, highlighted hair spread across the floor. In front of you is Isla, a Scottish flight attendant, with any lucky due to stay in town at least overnight. And, a little further on, Mary-Ann, who has just seen far too much. You could continue the plan as before, become Isla, revive Gabrielle and Mary-Ann and use the white pen to repair any damage with a quick memory wipe. But what if you get it wrong? And do you really have time to do that before someone else stumbles in on the scene? The alternative is to become Mary-Ann. She's old enough that her kids - if she has any - could well have left home, meaning you'll just have to put up with your husband on the way back to town before exiting her life. Or maybe you could stay as her while you work to free your family. She wouldn't be your first choice, but she's kept her body in good shape, and it's certainly a guise nobody would ever expect.
112212211212111222122.title: Crash Landing

choices: You're finally alone- time to "fan the fur"!
No, a secret organization still has your family and friends, remember? Get busy!
1122122112121112221221.content:
No point in changing plans now, you think. The organization doesn't know about Gabby, much less Isla, and if you're going to be incognito, why not be someone attractive? The door is still locked, and after the close call at the museum, this should be quick enough.


You pull off the red Virgin Atlantic stewardess uniform from Isla's deflated body, then stick your feet into hers. The feeling of gaining a woman's body is familiar, but still no less arousing as you pull her waist up to yours. After the fine arms are snugly put on, you grab ahold of Isla's head and its beautiful auburn mane, and pull it onto your face.

Wasting no time, you hurriedly put on Isla's uniform, fire the blue pen just to be safe Isla Clarkson, 30 years, from Aberdeen... , dress Gabrielle in her clothes, and bring her back to normal, all in time for Mary Ann Whittling to wake up.

"Oh, my head," she mutters.

"Thank God yur alright," you say in Isla's (or now your) Scottish accent. "You walked in and fainted."

"I... thought I saw a man dressed as a woman in here." Your heart pounds within your new chest.

"Damn pain medication. I'm going to lose my mind with those," she says as you walk her out, now relieved.

A group of paramedics took Gabrielle and Mary Ann to the local hospital, while you made your way to the small hotel Isla is sleeping at while the plane is fixed and refueled overnight. You get there and shut the door, thankful for the privacy.

All you can say when you get a full look at your new body is "Och Aye." Isla grew up rurally but still managed to look good enough for a job at an airline. That's no small feat, as Virgin Atlantic was recently voted in a poll to have the best looking stewardesses. You run your hands through your ravishing red hair and grin sensually at the mirror. "Where shall we goo tonight, lassie?" you say in a sexy Scotswoman's voice.
1122122112121112221221.title: Seeing the Isla of (the) Sky...

choices: You disguise yourself as one of the guests and make a run for it
112212211212112.content:
As much as you don't want to drag Jessica into this life on the run with you, you know that if you just returned her to her life, it's likely that those organisation imposters would just impersonate her. They would live her life, wearing her skin like a cheap suit until you returned. It's unlikely that it would last long but the thought of some stranger wearing your girlfriend just gave you the shivers. You already had to live through Elena, then in the guide of Jimmy, parade around in Jessica all day. There's no way you'd let something like that happen again. You just have to restore here.

The parking lot is not the right place. You throw Elena's skin and clothes underneath a random car nearby. You have no idea why you did this but you feel that there's no point in taking the imposter with you if you can't get her out of Elena's skin. Jumping into the car, you just drive with no clear goal in mind. This car is dangerous, Elena's handlers know about Elena and her life. It's likely they already have a bead on you and its only a matter of how long it takes until they find her discarded skin in the parking lot and figure out you've taken her car. You need to change vehicles quickly but to do that, you also need to change vehicles.

Somehow you end up at a rundown motel in town. You're breathing quickly, the panic and adrenaline from shooting Elena haven't yet worn off. As you sit in the car, you observe the people around you and try to find yourself a suitable new disguise. Lucy's body won't serve you any good anymore. Elena will be able to identify you and depending on how deep the organisation's webs run, it's only a matter of time before they match you. It's a cheap motel and the customers are suitably cheap as well. You won't find any 'high quality' disguises here. Discarding your plan to obtain a disguise here, you saunter up to the counter and ask for a room. It's cheap but you only plan to stay the night. Your room is paid for courtesy of the cash you took off Elena before you dumped her.

You throw the bags on the bed and pull out Jessica's deflated form. Your plan is to stay the night and remove Lucy's skin here. Hopefully overnight, a pair of disguises will present themselves, maybe that redneck couple you saw down the hall or maybe even that rich businessman and the prostitute next door. Any of them are choices but the first thing to do is restore Jessica to her original state. You pull out the black pen and zap at her flaccid form.

It isn't long before she had inflated again and she wakes groggily. She sees herself in a dark motel room and notices the strange chubby blonde above her and starts to panic. With some difficulty, you manage to calm her down but it isn't until you pull off Lucy's head/mask that she finally believes your words. It's a strange surreal experience. You, with your head still halfway out of Lucy's neck, explain the entire situation to Jessica while she explains that the last thing she remembers is going to sleep last night. Evidently, 'Jimmy' replaced her halfway through the night.

To her credit, Jessica takes it quite well and kisses you tenderly on the lips and comments on how brave you are. She agrees to go on the run with you and the two of you plan to take some disguises tonight but leave behind Lucy and her mum's skin in the room. You figure that the organisation will take care of that for you. You go to shower after taking off Lucy's skin and when you emerge, think you see Jessica using her phone before whipping it away when you return. It's a little suspicious but you warn her about contacting people you know since the organisation could be anywhere. She nods in agreement and then goes to take her shower.

While she's taking her shower, you get curious about what she was doing on her phone. There's a pin lock but you've long figured out its her birthday and when it unlocks, you realise that she sent a text to an unknown number with the exact room number and address of the hotel!! It's impossible... Jessica couldn't still be impersonated by someone unless....

"I know why he wanted to recruit you know. You really are a smart cookie aren't you?" says Jessica mildly with an evil glint in her eyes, pointing the black pen at you from the bathroom door. In her rush to confront you, she only had time to put on a towel.

"You're an imposter aren't you? I'm almost having a hard time believing that he thought that far ahead." You guess that Elena anticipated foresaw that she might be zapped and put agents in Jessica's and Denise's skins in case you escaped and restored them.

Jessica smiles and smirks in a completely un-Jessica manner, her face twisted into a malicious grin. "I was surprised too when he requested I put on this skin just to be zapped but I guess it all payed off in the end. Don't worry, you won't remember a thing."

As she presses the buttons, you dive for the other pens on the bed. Not caring which one you use, you just press and swing wildly at Jessica. Her beam misses its mark but when yours crosses hers, a large gash appears on her face. She falters in surprise and as she stumbles dropping the black pen in the process, her towel falls off. You press again and slice at her naked torso. Another large gash appears and you dash forward and pin her to the ground. Underneath the gash, you see another person's skin!!

You fire the laser beam like pen at her over and over, opening more and more gashes. Jessica begins losing control of her fine motor control as you dig your fingers into the gashes and rip your girlfriend's skin from the imposters body. Underneath is a young man, who can't be much older than yourself. You have never seen this man in your life. Plastered on his face is that same malicious smile that Jessica had given you before.

"I guess you win," he says as you shoot him with the fallen black pen. He collapses into a heap.

You don't have much time to wait. Your location has been broadcast to the organisation and there can't be much time left. You need to get out of here quickly. Jessica's skin has suffered no lasting damage and you can already see that it's healed itself already and is ready to wear again. While you'd love to escape as a couple, you doubt there's any time to restore her again and explain the situation. All you know is that you can't stay in this motel a moment longer.
112212211212112.title: Restore Jessica and go on the run with her

choices: Find a way to restore Jessica
1122122112121121.content:
You think quickly. The first thing to do is find a new identity and escape. The businessman seems like the ideal choice - generally they want to get away from their red light rendezvous as soon as possible. You listen against the wall: there's still the faint thud of sexual activity. You frown. He's going to be at it for a while. Then you hear a noise outside.

"No. Way. Jack, I'm not staying here. Did you see that toilet?" The voice is a woman's, with a faint accent you find it hard to place.

"I've already payed the creep at the front desk the money, all right? It's fine. You've slept in worse."

"Yeah, in Mexico, Jack. Mexico. This town actually has clean running water. I think we can afford to stay somewhere a little... cleaner."

"Oh, stop being such a princess about it, Sandra. We're not going to trail around town to find another motel. Do you really want to sleep in the van? 'Cause that's what will happen." A third voice: another woman's, though far less prim, far more indie.

"It's a better choice than this dump, at least."

"But I've already paid!" Jack protests again.

"Then...unpay. Please?" Sandra is laying it on thick.

"Ugh. Is your little cheerleader brain really rattling around, struggling to understand the concept of 'no refunds'? This place is a dive. Customer service is not a priority."

"Screw you, Kat. Just because you like to slum it. Look, Jack. I'll pay you back. I'll pay not to stay here. Just... just look at that toilet. Go back to the room and look at it. It's not even been cleaned."

"OK, fine! If it stops you whining we'll go somewhere else! Kat, you cool with this?" Jack seems exasperated by the bickering.

"Just... ugh, fine. Whatever. Bring your girlfriend back to the car, OK? I swear though, if she's going to be like this all the way, I swear I will kill myself with prescription pills at the next drug store we pass."

"You should be lucky we're bringing you on this road trip anyway, Katrina."

"Someone has to be able to read a map when there's no cell signal, don't they?" Kat practically spits.

"Will you two quit it! You've been at each other's throats since we left, and we've got at least another twelve hours to go! Come on, Sandra. Let's return the key."

"Wait. Let me get my frickin' backpack, first, all right?" Kat again.

"Fine. You drop off the key. We'll see you at the van."

"Uh...whatever."

You hear the footsteps separate outside: this is your perfect chance. Casually, you open the room door, bringing it to a close behind you: you don't want someone to look inside and see four skin suits lying across the floor, after all. You look left, just in time to see a couple head down the stairs, then to the right, just in time to see an army surplus green jacket head into a room. You don't hesitate. You walk along the corridor and push open the door.

"Sorry," you whisper as you level the brown pen, seconds later the black, and fire them simultaneously.

The next couple of minutes are a mad scramble as you virtually claw away the clothes and pull on your new face as quickly as possible. It's much smaller than your own frame: the woman (22-year-old Katrina Holly Brown, a film studies major) is barely above five foot two, but you're still able to slip into her petite skin easily. You pull on her head and shake her hair, dark roots bursting through a bleached white with blue ends. Amazingly, her piercings seem to have transferred with the skin, and you've got a stud in your nose and through your tongue. You don't have time to pause though - your pursuers will be here any moment. You throw on her cargoes, T-shirt, and green surplus jacket. Then you grab her backpack and head to your own room.

You only have time to slip Jessica's skin into your pack, and the pens into your jacket. Lucy and Denise will just have to wait for rescue; you're sure the organization are capable of cleaning up such a mess. You slam the door, drop Jack's room key at the front desk and head out to the carpark, falling naturally into Kat's slouched, casual rhythm as you walk toward your new friends.

"You took your time." Sandra - it has to be Sandra - spits as you reach the beaten up VW van. You slide open the back, toss your pack inside and throw yourself in, closing the door behind you.

"Whatever. Just drive, OK?"

The van heads down the road, into the night. As you begin to pick up speed, you look out the back. Another set of headlights have appeared in the distance; a set that turns into the motel parking lot. You breathe a sigh of relief, and slouch back against the van side.

You've escaped. You're itching to return Jessica to normal as soon as possible, but that would mean getting away from your new friends. But you're also curious about the pens. Maybe you should find out what they can do before you return your girlfriend to normal.
1122122112121121.title: Flee the motel

choices: Find a way to leave Kat, you and Jessica find new hosts
Stay with the road trip, bring Jessica in
11221221121211212.content:
Sandra, it turns out, is the travelling companion from hell. When you first heard the conversation you thought Kat was a little bitchy, but Sandra's incessant talking to Jack about herself, her interests and her life slowly drives you crazy. You get the impression that Kat would have regularly interjected with a well-placed barb, but without her memories you don't feel confident enough to take on that role. Instead you do your best to look like a surly, sullen indie girl doing her utmost to ignore everything going on around her. You find an iPod in Kat's pocket, and pop in the ear buds to drown out the chatter.

Kat's body feels strange. You've lost around a foot in height, and that's a little disorienting; although fortunately the brown pen seems to have given you muscle memory, and it hasn't fazed you too much. Eventually the VW hits a chain motel - cheap but at least of a set quality - and Sandra begs Jack to pull in. Ten minutes later, you're in a room that seems to meet Sandra's standards: a twin with a cot bed in the corner. Evidently Kat is expected to take the cot bunk, but you figured she'd at least protest after the earlier hotel debacle.

"Come on, Kat. That was the deal. You take any cot bunk, we get the gas and take you along." Jack stresses. You still have absolutely no idea where you are going, or what you're going to do with Jessica. Ultimately, either you're going to have to ditch your travelling companions and let them carry on with their road trip, or you'll have to restore Jessica, explain to her the nightmare ordeal she finds herself in (no mean feat - she won't have any memories of being worn as a skin by no less than two sinister spies, being left in a bag and car boot, and literally being sliced off by the white pen). Then you'll have to convince her to take a new disguise. Sandra seems the perfect choice: beautiful enough, and it might give you a break from her real, highly annoying personality.

"Ugh. Fine. I'm going to take a shower." You grab Kat's pack and head to the bathroom. You need space to think.

"You mean you're going to smoke marijuana," Sandra remarks. You figure Kat won't let that go unpunished. You pause and roll her eyes like an idiot.

"Who calls it that? Nobody, that's who. Nobody since outraged parents in the 70s. Peace, love, dope, you're such a square, daddio." You give the peace sign and your best mocking snark.

"Screw you, Kat. Have fun getting high and wasting your life away."

You shake your blonde-blue cut, storm into the bathroom, and lock the door.

First, Jessica. You pull the skin out of Kat's pack, and lay it on the floor. Given the way your 'friends' were acting, you were tempted to test the pens on them, but given you don't know what they'll do, you figure Jessica is the safest test. You lay her in the bath, and reach for the two pens you're yet to identify. The white pen has a second setting, but given the first seems to be a skin remover, you're not quite willing to test that out.

First, the red pen. You concentrate on Jessica and fire. Your head itches, but nothing happens to the skin. You scratch your head...and feel Kat's hair longer than you imagine. You turn and stare at her face in the mirror, and her eyes, stained with deliberately-crude mascara, widen in shock. You now have Jessica's flowing blonde locks, rather than her grungy cut. You hold the red pen and fire again, concentrating on Jessica even more. Kat's body begins to grow, her breasts popping out to push hard against her army jacket, as she takes Jessica's shape. It's still recognizably Kat's body, her height hasn't increased at all, but evidently the pen allows you to morph parts, like an automatic plastic surgery kit. A little experimentation later, and you've returned Kat to normal, having assumed every shape imaginable, from a Japanese Kat with spiky green hair to an Indian Kat with long, black hair that fell to the floor. The pen is definitely going to be useful.

There's a knock at the door. "I don't hear the shower, Katrina!" Sandra. But of course.

"Fuck off," you retort, reaching for the blue pen. You'd better find out how this one works, too. You point it at Jessica's skin and fire.

Memories flood into your mind, an almost irresistible torrent of images, thoughts, feelings, sensations. You remember her mom and dad, how she ran away from home for a whole two hours when she was 12, convinced she was heading to Hollywood before she'd squandered her savings on chips and cola. You recall her studies, how she ended up going to the same university, on different courses, as her twin brother Jack - ah, so that's the connection - across the country from home. How she's spent most of her time on campus experimenting in every sense of the word, living a carefree life of booze and recreational drug use. When Jack said he was driving back home to their parents with his girlfriend, the insufferable Sandra, Kat asked to tag along for a free ride. Not that she wants to visit home particularly; she just needs more money. You remember everything. And Sandra's ridiculous drugs claim is perfectly founded; right now, Kat would happily be smoking a joint in the bathroom from her pack stash, wafting the smoke out of the small air vent. She's did it a few hours ago at a truck stop.

There's another knock at the door. Now, with Kat's memories and mannerisms, you're confident you could impersonate her utterly. She's not exactly the nicest person in the world, but you still feel more than a little guilty you're currently usurping her life. And there's the matter of your deflated girlfriend in the tub, too. You ponder what to do.
11221221121211212.title: Test the other pens first

choices: Harry leads you to a class room
Harry leads you to a lab
11221221121212.content:
Logic would say this is where you shoot and run. But logic says people don't deflate in front of your eyes, that you can't swap your identity like you do your clothes. Logic struggles to overcome fear, too, or a master manipulator both offering and threatening at the same time. Lucy's face frowns, and you hand over the pen.

"Smart choice," Elena says, taking it from you. "The brown one, too."

You reach into Lucy's pockets to retrieve it, but you never make it. Something tells you to look up, and as you do, Elena has the pen pointing directly at you. "Actually, don't worry," she shrugs. "I'll get it myself."

With that the world turns black.

*****


You wake to cotton sheets, warm sunlight, and a gentle breeze. At first, you think the whole, crazy pen thing was just a strange dream. But as you wake you feel different somehow, as if your body isn't quite... yours. As you come around, you realize the room isn't your own: it's white, unadorned, sterile. The cotton sheet is actually a basic wool throw. The sunlight is actually a series of spots fixed to the ceiling, blaring down. The breeze is a gust from the open metal door. This is a cell. A windowless, basic cell, like for monks, prisoners, or test subjects.

"I thought you'd want to wake up under some sheets, at least." The voice is a mans, low and booming. "Welcome back, David. In fact, welcome in general."

You cough, rubbing your head, feeling a mess of short, stylish hair: Lucy's. Shit! It was all real. You look down, under the cover of the sheets, and see Lucy's breasts and flabby stomach.

"Where am I?" your feminine voice asks, turning to look at your visitor. The man is a giant: dark, muscular and grinning with friendly warmth. He looks as if he could be a cage fighter.

"Safe house. Relax. It takes a few moments to recover from being returned. All recruits go through it; you have to know what it feels like, after all."

"Are you who zapped me?" You ask. The man laughs in response.

"No. You were mailed here for training. Sounds like you got the jump on her in the field though, huh? Not bad! I think that's a first for a recruit. Most times they swallow the story whole."

"It seemed too good to be true."

"Maybe you're right. But then, sometimes things are as good as people say, no? You might not feel like it right now, but you made the right choice. Why don't you get out of that skin? We've got to mail it back."

"Wait...mail? You said mail earlier. You mailed me?"

"Nah, it's just a term we use when someone is transported as a skin - we don't stick you in a parcel and call a courier. You've lost less than a day, and we'll get whoever that is to her life by Tuesday morning. Oh, and don't take offense about being, what did you call it? Zapped? Think of it as travel without the hassle. Anyway, we can't separate host and skin once 'zapped': even we have limits. And we don't want whoever's body you're wearing to be posted as missing. So get out of the skin so I can arrange for her return."

You slip out of the skin, under the watchful eye of your new mentor. It's uncomfortable, standing nude in front of him, only to pull down someone else's head, chest, arms, legs... and be nude all over again. The mentor takes the skin, and murmurs something about clothes in a locker against the wall. He vanishes, returning as you finish putting on white underwear, white socks, and a white jumpsuit: the clothes in the locker are all identical. You look around the rest of the cell. There's a box, with spaces for five different pens inside, resting on a barren desk. There's a jug of water and a glass too; your simple bed, a small sink, toiletries, and a mirror. That's about it.

Your mentor returns, opening the door. "There you go! Better, right?"

"I guess," you say. "Look, I've got..."

"Questions. I know. Of course you do. So take a seat. I'm Harry, by the way. Not my real name, before you ask: nothing about this place is real. I'm probably the last person who's going to call you David, too. You'll be given another name to use, depending on the work you'll be doing."

"Work?" You're still trying to get your head around being *mailed* somewhere.

"We'll get to that later. Some people are fluid in their identity, changing as needed to respond to incidents. Some are more...let's say deep cover. Some have other roles entirely. Each class of agent has a different type of name. We cover a wide range of projects. Sometimes we spy. Sometimes we just replace and affect a key decision. Sometimes we have to take more drastic steps. But, as strange as this may sound, I promise you: we're doing the right thing. We are helping the world. It's an honor to be selected."

"Uh huh." There's not much more to say. It sounds like he's describing the Illuminati.

"So, questions. Fire away. I'll give you...say...five."

"Five?"

"That's right. Four now. Think sharp, David." You curse your own stupidity as Harry grins. He's treating this like a game.

"Uh... what is this organization?"

"That question gets answered later in training. I'm not the best person to explain it, but I promise you, you'll get an answer to it later. Still got four."

"Are my friends and family OK?"

"Perfectly fine. It's usual for two agents to replace key individuals in the recruit's life to make sure the recruitment goes...smoothly. In your case, your friend Jimmy was our active agent, and there was a sleeper too: I won't say who, it might freak you out. Rest assured, your friends and family have all been restored to their previous selves."

"Can I see them again?"

"No, you can't. It's policy, David. Sorry. They won't miss you, though, if you get my meaning."

"You mean you're going to...replace me?"

"Temporarily, yes. Already have, in fact. You won't remember this, but you've already been replaced twice, a few weeks back, while we were assessing whether to recruit you. We can't waste an agent forever though, so we're going to tidy that end up. Don't worry - your family will be fine. We're very good at what we do. They'll be OK without you."

You are about to blurt out something, but pause. Instead, you decide to ask the most important question of all. You ask it slowly and deliberately.

"Why did you pick me?"

"Ah. That's a very good question indeed, David. When you can be someone else, a lot of skillsets become irrelevant. Age, physicality. We aren't looking for great intelligence, and charisma isn't always required either. We picked you because... well, you fit our criteria. I'm not the one who made the decision, but obviously you fit into a pretty narrow band of people optimal for what we do. Kudos."

"Uh... thanks?"

Harry rises, and flicks his head toward the door. "You're welcome. Now, enough questions. Come, let's get started. We've got a lot of ground to cover."

You shake your head at this whirlwind of barely-revealed information. You had five questions, but you're nowhere nearer to the truth. And you have no idea where you are heading.
11221221121212.title: Surrender

choices: You are lead to your first class
112212211212122.content:
You're lead down a white corridor which is stark in its cleanness. Everything about this complex just seems otherworldly and the cleaners appear to have some obsessive compulsive disorder which requires to keep everything spotless. There are doors along the walls but as Harry leads you down, he doesn't take a second glance at any of them. All of them are marked with strange symbols, not unlike the ones on the costume-sets. The two of you finally stop in front of one of the doors and your mentor ushers you in.

"Hey Gunther," he shouts at a white haired scientist looking fellow who is concentrating deeply on his work, "Got a Type 2 here who needs a name."

The elderly gentleman in the white lab coat runs over energetically and is surprisingly spirited for a man of his age. He looks at you up and down as if appraising new goods that had just arrived and gives a satisfied nod. He then hurries over to a nearby terminal and presses a button. All of a sudden, the wall on your left opens up. It's a giant door. No... calling it a door wouldn't do it justice. It's a well concealed gate of some sort and as it pulls back on itself, a number of white pods with glass tops fold out on robotic arms and line themselves up. Harry waves at you to follow the spry old scientist as he hurries over to a pod while you peer inside.

Inside is a woman. You almost jump back in surprise and Harry gives a little laugh as you bump into him. The woman inside is a pretty honey blonde who looks like the girl next door. You can see her pert breasts are at attention in that cold pod of hers and her slim figure is something that a lot of girls would die to have.

"Zis is Jenny. She'll be yours for a while," Gunther says in a heavy German accent. He presses a few buttons on the side of the pod and Jenny instantly deflates while the pod glass pulls back.

You look at your mentor with a Harry with a confused look and he gives a deep chuckle before he explains. "You've been assessed a Type 2. Remember how I said some agents are fluid with their identities? That would be you. Just think about it, you took on a number of forms and adapted almost perfectly throughout the whole day. Normally people are quite averse about entering other people's lives but you did it like it was second nature. Plus, the reason why you've been given Jenny is that we think you have a good affinity with female skins. Training is all about practice so hop on in so you can get started. You'll be attending your classes as your new identity."

As you slip into Jenny's skin, Harry explains that you aren't hardly the first person to wear this skin. Type 2's undergo special classes where they rotate identities every week and are graded on how well you can act as the person whose skin you're wearing and how accurately you can identify the other students even in different disguises. By the end, the best students are able to tell exactly who their classmates are just by interacting with them.

Another huge load of information from your mentor. You dress your new body in another set of white clothing and Gunther presses another button. Jenny's memories flood into your mind but you can't tell if these are real or fake. Was Jenny a real person who was abducted for the sole purpose of training these Type 2 agents?
112212211212122.title: Harry leads you to a lab

choices: Time passes in a montage... you're ready to 'graduate'
1122122112121221.content:
Harry leads you down a corridor. "I lied to you before," he says, almost in passing. You turn and frown at him, honey-blonde hair swaying.

"What do you mean?" Jenny's light voice comes out.

"That girl whose skin you were in. We could have removed it. You'll see later, one of the pens is very good at it. But we wanted to see how you reacted to waking up as the opposite sex, then shipping off your flabby blonde friend back to her life. Didn't phase you at all. That's why you're a Type 2, I guess."

"Is that unusual?"

"Yeah. Like I said, most people can't do it. Given your induction was aborted, we weren't sure you could, either. That test confirmed it."

"Are there many Type 2s?"

"A couple. They're less common than Type 3s or Type 4s. More common than a Type 1. It's the hardest role, if you ask me." You guess you'll have to learn the terminology as you go.

"That's... really helpful."

"I try. Here, you'll never know who's who until you're good enough. Speaking of which... who are you?"

"Jenny Miller. I grew up in a small town called Woodbridge. I've got an older brother and a younger sister, and..."

"Stow it, Jenny. I asked who you were, not for your life story. Think about your identity at all times. People don't just disclose that kind of crap. Be Jenny, not someone being Jenny and showing off about it. And don't let the others phase you; they may or may not work out you're new blood, depending on how good they are. We throw new recruits in at the deep end. You're going to learn it all: improvisational acting, cold reading, firearms, martial arts, surveillance, electronics, computer skills - plus additional grading as a Type 2 of course. Good luck."

And with that, Harry points to a wooden door at the end of the hall. You nod, and head through it...

And into a classroom. Unlike the rest of this barren, sterile place, it actually looks like a classroom, or at least a movie set of a classroom. Light streams through fake windows into a room with a whiteboard, tables, chairs. It looks like a typical community college room. There's about ten other students, of all different apparent sexes and ethnicities, with ages ranging from 20 to an old, wrinkled man in the corner. this is Wessler college, Jenny's memories tell you, that you've been attending now for...

You feel a hand squeeze your ass, and jump instinctively. It takes half a second to compose yourself. Think like Jenny... think like Jenny. You spin round, and find yourself in the arms of a tall, handsome man, brown hair cut short. Penny's memories tell you immediately this is Alex Clark - your boyfriend. You grin, and give him a playful shove... after all, you're supposed to act in character. "Not in class," you say, eyebrows furrowing in a cute tease.

"Oh, come on, gorgeous. You know you're hard to resist."

"Well, you'll just have to stay hard down there, won't you?" You smile. Alex's eyes search your expression; the rest of his body is in character, but the intelligence there is definitely trying to see through your disguise. You guess you passed test one.

"You're new," he says, low and quiet. Or not.

"New?" You put your hands on your hips. "What does that mean?"

"New. To class."

"Alex, don't be weird. We'll chat after class, OK?" You do your best to focus. That's a recruit trying to phase you. You're not going to let them. You take a seat where you remember Jenny always sits - she likes the way the sunlight falls, and reach for her pen to finish drawing the elegant love heart frieze on the bottom of the table. You watch as Lowder walks in to the room. Theatrical to the ridiculous, Lowder is an English lovey who fops and fawns about, instructing you all on improvisational acting. You settle in for a lecture.

"Busted." There's a call from behind you. Mrs Cheng, a middle-aged Chinese woman who usually spends her time alone to her thoughts, chirps up. You spin around, as do the others.

"I call busted, you Type 1 wannabe."

"My dear, whatever do you mean!" Lowder is beside himself, gesturing like a ham, voice wobbling. Mrs Cheng rises and grins.

"You're Tyler; could spot you a mile away. Tyler in a Lowder skin. Busted."

The ham pauses, and suddenly drops all pretense. "Ah, shit."

An alarm rings, and as Jenny you - and most of the other students - stay in character, looking startled. Two men you've never seen before step into the room.

"Recruits: halt simulation." Everyone stays perfectly still, rigid almost - except Lowder and Mrs Cheng. "Good job, Type 3. What gave him away?"
