11221221121212212122212111221121.content:
You're not quite out of the room yet, there's still a little bit of time until the driver arrives to pick the Van Lewens up. It'll be about half an hour so the three older people decide to mingle a bit in the lobby. You tell them you'll catch up, that you want to double check your things to make sure that you didn't forget anything. Accepting this they walk out and you immediately dive under the bed. You fish out the skin of Bob Foxworth, then his clothes. You place your hand in the pocket of his pants and pull out the fake Bloom which you deposit into Alexis' purse. You then gather up the skin and clothes and head down the hall to room 302 where, after getting past the lock, you dress the skin in its clothes and then zap it.

It reinflates and Bob soon reappears though unconscious. He regains it in a matter of moments and looks around confused. After a bit of talking, you've convinced him that he collapsed and he says that it happens, he thanks you. Satisfied you duck out of the room thinking you're in the clear when a voice from your right calls out to you.

"Miss Van Lewen, what were you doing coming out of room 302?"

You turn to see Anya Martinez, one of the many staff at the resort. She's a pretty young woman not terribly older than yourself, both you and Alexis, about 19 or so. Alexis and her had chatted a little bit during previous stays by the Van Lewens. She comes from the complete opposite background but Alexis found her to be kind of cool so she made it a point to talk to her. Unfortunately talking to her is something you don't want to do right now but you need an excuse.

"Oh, um, hi Anya it's just..." you think back. The memories you had of Bob have already mostly faded. But you do remember that he has diabetes so... "I was coming out of my room and I saw him walk out of his room and he just... collapsed. So I ran over to help him, he gave me his card to get in, and I stayed with him for a few minutes."

"Oh no, that's horrible!" Anya exclaims in shock. "That's Mr. Foxworth's room. He told us ahead of time that he's diabetic so perhaps..."

"He told me that it happens. Some times he gets lightheaded and can't stand." you reply, "But he told me he was alright and that's when you saw me coming out of his room."

"Madre, but you're such a kind girl Alexis." Anya replies giving you a smile. If you weren't on assignment, if you were on a bit of a break, you definitely wouldn't mind becoming her. "Thank you so much for helping Mr. Foxworth. I'll go in and just double check to make sure everything is alright with him though."

"Oh, it was no trouble at all Anya. I wouldn't be able to live with myself if I stood around." you say with a kind smile.

Once she goes into the room you let out a small breath. That was close but some quick thinking, and Alexis' natural kindness, got you out of that one. You pull your phone out of your purse, about 15 minutes in total have passed, so you head out to rejoin the Van Lewens in the lobby. The driver soon comes, right on time as he usually is. His name is Donald, an older man who has served as the Van Lewens' main chauffeur for the past 25 years. A comforting sight to all of them, most of all Marcus who appreciates his punctuality.

Once the resort is the distance you then turn to Marcus. "Daddy, could we stop by the bank?" you ask him.

He gives you a quizzical look. "Stop by the bank? What for?"

"I want to look at my gift." you reply, "All of the excitement and seeing Miss Vincent with that... that fake made me appreciate the real one even more."

"Alexis, darling, you can look at that gem any time you want." Clarissa says, "Later. Right now I just want to get home and not sit around while you admire that thing for a few minutes."

"But mom!" you protest, whine really, "You can just drop me off. Abby will be there and I haven't seen her in a while. I can just get her to bring me home."

"Abigail...?" Clarissa asks in exasperation, "I swear, you and her..."

"I saw Anya today too, right before I left, so that got me thinking of her." you say.

Clarissa cocks an eyebrow. "Her? Alexis, dear, I've told you that you need friends your own age and of your own social strata."

"Come on, honey. She does like talking to her." Marcus says.

You look over at him expectantly in a puppy dog fashion. "Please daddy?" you ask.

He looks at you and smiles. Like the memories told you, a total princess. "Sure thing honey. Just tell Abigail it's the usual arrangement."

"Oh thank you, daddy! You're the best!" you exclaim giving him a hug.

You hear Clarissa huff, "I swear, Marcus, you spoil her."

"Must be great being daddy's girl, huh?" Daniel asks in a sarcastic manner. You just look at him and stick your tongue out.

* * * * *

Being a weekend the bank is relatively slow with only light staff and a small amount of patrons. "Alexis, how are you?" the greeter, a nice looking young man, says to you with a beaming smile.

"Oh hi Ethan. I'm good." you smile back, "Is Abby here today?"

"Abs? Yeah she should be here. Usual spot." he replies.

"Thanks Ethan." you say as you walk by. You walk through to the back of the bank greeted by tellers and even a few of the regulars. Alexis' presence in the bank is itself a fairly regular thing and she has a tendency to brighten up the room. You wave and greet back and eventually make your way to a desk where a young woman clacks away at her keyboard. She's a bit of a contracdiction, a mousey face framed by hair and with a pert nose and glasses to finish off the thing. It would make her look cute. But her body... her chest is practically straining her blouse and as Ethan called her, her usual nickname is Abs due to, well, her rock hard abs. Alexis is the only one who calls her Abby.

"Hey Abby!" you exclaim cheerfully as you walk up next to her desk. She looks at you in surprise for a moment and then smiles. You feel yourself blush a bit. Mentally you smack yourself. That's out of character, a total rookie mistake.

Although if it's out of character Abby doesn't seem to notice. "Oh, hi Alexis! I didn't know you were coming buy today. You here to check out that gift?"

You nod. "Yeah, and to hang out with you a bit. Daddy said it was the usual arrangement so if you want to grab something to eat afterwards..." you say and blush even more. That's when you realize that it's actually not out of character. This girl has a rather large crush on Abby. That means... oh man.

She stands up and leads you into the bank vault area where all the safe deposit boxes are. After closing and locking the door she opens one, there's a keypad inside, and enters a combination of numbers. The floor in the center begins to part and revealing a staircase leading to a sub-basement where the gem is stored. "C'mon, gimme your hand. You know it's a bit dark and it's my salary if you hurt yourself." You take it and your face turns crimson.

Eventually though there's a large vault door with one last keypad. You enter the number, Abby doesn't know this one and isn't allowed inside, and step in while the door closes automatically. You quickly scope out the inside of the vault. No cameras or anything. Of course not, who could get down here? And there, on a pedestal in the center of the vault, is the Scarlet Bloom. The real deal. You admire it and then remove the fake from your purse. You hold it up next to it: it's a great fake but the real one has just a bit more of a gleam. Carefully you remove a cloth from your purse which you use to pick the Bloom up, you then, fake still in the other hand, place the fake onto the holder where the real deal had been. You then carefully wrap up the Bloom and place it in your purse.

You idle for a couple of moments and then enter the exit code.

"You get your fill today, Alexis?" Abby asks and you nod. "Good. Oh and about that lunch? How about we get some kangaroo steak."

That pauses you dead in your tracks. "Kangaroo steak", that's the code for your handler. "Only if we can get some kiwi milkshakes." you give the approved reply.

Abby's face breaks into a smile. "Well done rookie."

You give her a look. "How'd you figure it out? Does this mean I fail?"

Abby laughs a bit. "Rookie, I've been doing this for 20 years. I can spot an agent no matter how well they think they can disguise themselves. That's why I'm assigned to as a field handler for the graduation missions. Anyone else, including the real Abby? You'd have fooled 'em completely. This was less about getting the jewel than about how you handled a delicate situation, how you reacted to unknowns and things going south, how you improvised and appraised. It wasn't about the end result but the lead up, that's why we had you get the jewel when we could've gotten it any time, and I have to say you did well. Damn well. Using kid was an especially inspired touch."

"Oh, well thanks." you reply.

"Don't mention it. Actually, it's a real good thing you're the girl right now 'cause we've got another assignment for you. A Type 1 assignment." she says and you nearly spittake. "The school she goes to? Saint Siena's? We had a Type 3 in there, long term deep cover agent to keep an eye on the place. It's a school for super-rich kids like the girl here so it's a great listening post. Only we think the agent went rogue. We need someone to go in, find the agent, and eliminate 'em and since you're already a student..."

Abby, or the person in her skin, notices your expression.

"Of course you don't have to. We give agents the option of taking a day off inbetween assignments. We can get someone else in no problem. It's up to you."

112212211212122121222121112211211.content:
You stand infront of a large bathroom mirror. Ivory walls surround you, a large, expensive luxury dormitory your parents paid for on school campus.
Of course, the rest of the dormitories are just as flashy, as their residents are no less rich.
You'd just gotten in from the several hour long drive back down to campus, easily slipping back out of the bank with your assignment.
Tired, your young, feminine face is uncharacteristically plain. It's as if her wide, pearly white smile paints the canvas of her face.
You're going to be in this body for a while, better get used to it.

Time for a shower, you decide. Dropping the black straps of your black dress from your shoulders, you let it crumple to the floor in a useless heap of soft fabric.
Revealing the toned, bronze body of your host, sporting underwear the same colour as your dress. You pull a bang behind your ear and sigh, reaching around, you unclasp your bra and let it drop, then sliding your underwear off.

You're not used to the idea of staying in a body for long, you're a type 2. This kind of thing is for type 3s or 4s..
Well, the length of your stay depends on how fast you find the rogue. It should be easy. You only hope he's not smarter than you.
Sliding open the detailed shower door, you step in and, to your surprise, find an array of buttons instead of knobs to operate the shower.
You press one marked with a red H, and a warm stream of water sprays out gently from the large showerhead above, jets on the sides of the walls lightly sprinkle your sides. As you clean yourself, you sift through the girl's memories.

Alexis Van Lewen.. only moments ago she'd just left a wedding. Albeit she wasn't very excited about it.
You're still a bit down at the idea of taking a kids life, even though it won't be for long. You don't remember being zapped, ever.
But then again, that's kind of the point.

"Mm.." You moan quietly in your high, girly voice.

This shower is incredible, the water trickles down your curves smoothly, leaving behind it's warm sensation.
You're using some expensive brand of body wash you've never seen before, forsaking the yellow scrubby hanging from the rack infront.
Used to bar soap, you feel like you're using hand sanitizer to wash your entire body.
Reminiscing about your family, you wonder what's up with them. If they're even themselves anymore. You can at least hope the organization left them alone.

Next, you pull a bottle of shampoo from the rack. Your hands are foamy and it slips from your fingers.
Clank!
The noise fills the silent dorm, not even the shower is noisy. It's almost like a waterfall, ironically silent.
You sigh, slapping your hands against your thighs. They jiggle with the impact, and you step back, bending over to pick up the bottle.
The cool air behind the stream of water previously enveloping flows through your legs, causing goosebumps to rise all over.
Immediately, you jerk back up and step into the apparent safety of the shower's water. You giggle childishly, you're a child.

You're.. a child..


"Alexis! Honey!" Your father's voice calls through the phone.

The clock on your bedside table reads 7:02, your memories tell you that this is the time Alexis regularly gets up for classes.
Your father also regularly calls you every morning to make sure you're alright. You don't see the purpose, but you're not Alexis.
Well, you get the point.

"Yes Dad.. I'm up.." You groan.

"Good, get dressed and have breakfast, call me afterwards okay?" Your father says rapidly.

"Okay daddy, love you bye!" You say, pulling the phrase right of "the book", or her memories rather.

The phone beeps off and you throw the thick blanket from your body. To your horror, you're in nothing but a pair of panties.
What happened last night? You actually don't remember much.
The cold atmosphere greets your warmer body, and your pink nipples instantly harden, goosebumps travel along your skin.
You're reminded of that shower, and instantly crave one. Folding your arms over your small breasts, you skip along to the bathroom.


Moments later, you're all dressed in your school uniform.

A white blouse and tie, with a thick burgundy overcoat and the school crest on it's pocket. From the waist down, you've got on a loose pair of black jeans and a pair of sneakers. Alexis isn't one to dress up fancy, especially for school. She only had on such a nice dress because of the wedding, she actually hates dressing up. Pushing open the bedroom door, you walk out into the hallway. It's quiet, especially this early. The girl's common room is filled with other girls just like you in some ways, different in others.

Your memories tell you that a girl named Tiffany lives in the room on your left, Brianna to your right, down the hall is a foreign exchange student from Qatar.
Miranda Said. She's beautiful, long black hair, light brown skin, lighter than even Alexis'.
Her father's influence in the oil market gives her family power, you're thinking that she might be host to the rogue.
It's your first day however, and you need proof. Alexis' memories tell you that she's also very shy and keeps to herself often. Sometimes she's bullied.

You walk down the large flight of stairs to the ground floor of the common room, and make your way to the cafeteria.

Long dining tables fill the room with antique wooden chairs of equal worth to fit, the tables already set with linen napkins and silverware.
Many of the girls currently having breakfast however, are eating common food like Cheerios, Pancakes and Toast.
This isn't what you expected, to be honest.

"Alexis!" Someone calls your name.

You whip your head around to look at them as you walk to the serving counter.

It's your friend Baaja, a young indian girl. Alexis has been friends with her since she was enrolled here.
Waving at her, she smiles and resumes talking to another girl nearby. You pick up a bowl and walk to one of the cereal dispensers.

Cereal, should be a simple choice.. right?

Only there are about 15 different cereals. One dispenser even has a mix.
You pull the lever on the one with fruit loops in it, and a plethora of colours tumble from the opening into your bowl.
A metal machine holds cold milk, another holds hot. You pour the cold into your bowl.
Walking to your friend Baaja, she scoots over and gives you room to sit closer.

"Oh my God I'm soooooooo tired.." The girl opposite Baaja complains, she's clearly as tired as she says.

Long, curly blonde hair covers her shoulders, her pale face complete with dark circles under her eyes.

"You should've gone to bed early last night Diana!" Baaja says, then stuffing her face with a slice of pancake.

You simply take a spoon and eat your fruit loops, trying to block out the annoying chatter.
The girls completely ignore you. In female circles, the only way to be recognized is to provide input, otherwise you're nonexistent to the conversation.

Minutes pass, and you're done eating. You leave your bowl on the table, as is the usual, and walk out of the cafeteria's double doors.


Class is drawling, your teacher is a snobby englishman, about 40 years of age or so.
Mr. Hemsworth, he's named. He's teaching you Geography.

"You see, class, convection currents gather in the Atlantic to form a massively heat dense area which causes.." You've lost him.

Darkness settles in at your head slowly droops, your forehead laying against your wrist.

"Alexis Van Lewen! Wake up, sweetie!" Mr. Hemsworth sarcastically calls.

You slowly raise your head and frown. Several other students around you are asleep, but your memories tell you that Mr. Hemsworth dislikes you in particular.

He continues on with his subject, and you notice someone looking at you. It's Baaja.

She smiles and waves at you, and simply return the gesture, before staring into space again.

After class, you're walking to Math as Baaja interrupts you in the hallway. Her straight black hair flies infront of her face as she halts abruptly before you, and she sputters to fix it into place. You smile amused.

"A-Alexis! Mr. Hemsworth is always picking on you isn't he," She says, you two starts walking, "I saw Brandon sleeping again, and Trish too!"

"Trish?" You sputter.

Shit.

"Yeah, Trish. Can you believe it? She's usually so attentive in class. Wonder what's happened to her." Baaja says, not recognizing your sudden words.

You're sliding the door closed behind you as you follow Robin into the beauty parlor, ready to lock the door and make the switch, when there's a call from the receptionist.

"Wes, honey?"

You lean back to make eye contact with her. "Yes, hon?"

"Phone for you."

You flick your eyes toward the patiently-waiting Robin, Wes's tones taking on an offended snarl. "I'm with a client!"

"Says her name's Lou, needs to speak with you about a dishwasher? That you'd understand?"

"Ugh." You turn to Robin, holding your arms up in mock surrender. "I am so sorry about this. I will be right with you." You strut over to the reception, picking up the phone. Your Wes muscle memory is your guide, and you keep your exterior composure. Inside, though, you're panicking. Before you started this charade, you agreed codewords in case you had to abort. Lou is how Elena would identify herself, if she had to switch skins and she could - it's a gender neutral name. Dishwasher was the panic button: it meant she had to speak to you in private instantly. Wes's arm scoops up the phone and pulls it to his ear.

"If this is about fixing appliances, I told your colleague this morning. It's not the dishwasher, it's the freezer." Freezer - code for 'you can speak freely'. You doubt anyone is going to be listening on another line. You hear Elena's voice immediately.

"Get out now. This minute."

"Have I..."

"This minute. Drop that face you're wearing and look for a red sedan out back. Abort, abort, abort."

The line clicks dead, and you set the phone down. You can't help but let a look of utter shock pass your face.

"Hon, are you OK?"

You turn to Wes' colleague, recovering your composure. "Yeah, fine. Just... don't ever get a relative of a friend to fix your kitchen, OK?"

You turn on your heel, promise Robin it'll take one more minute, and slip out back. There, as hurriedly as possible, you get out of Wes, restore him, and use the white pen to make sure he knows he's got a customer to attend to, and has been telling people he's got a broken kitchen freezer. Tracks covered - albeit loosely - you dash out of the door.

*****


Elena's still wearing the fortune teller's skin as you climb into the front seat, almost immediately shocked by the rapid acceleration. You don't even have time to put on your seatbelt.

"What the hell? Did I expose myself?"

"No, it's not you," Elena says, concentrating on driving. "We've got a Class Blue and that means training is over."

"Class..."

"Class Blue. Blue is bad. It means we've got a shitstorm." Elena is utterly composed throughout all of this; the language seems to flow rather than be uttered in panic. "That means we've got a real risk of exposure. Something, somewhere, went seriously wrong. Everyone goes into automatic lockdown: communications are severed, Type 3s vanish into their identities, everyone else finds someone to be and waits for pre-determined signals. No traces, everyone vanishes."

"So we're going to vanish?"

"Nope. It's pure coincidence that you happened to be doing your final assessment in the area, but protocol is clear. You are the nearest Type 2, and that means you've just gone active to try and solve this mess."

"Active?"

"That's right - active. Don't worry, you were doing fine. Your approach was interesting, your attack from a blind angle that nobody would have imagined. You realized a direct change would be tricky, and worked out the perfect spot to make a switch with the perfect candidate to cause a little trouble. So far, you're a pass. It's just that now, you're going to have to pass for real."

You gulp down your nerves. Your own body, with its strangely bland face, stares at you from the car's side mirror. You watch as the traffic passes and Elena negotiates bend after bend. Your stomach churns with nerves.

"Here's the situation. Someone in Chicago was rumbled in an op. A Type 1 was called, and immediately the situation was sanitized." That's a polite way for saying that whatever happened wouldn't be making the news. You wonder if the Type 1 killed anybody, or if a mind-wipe was in order. Either way, something drastic happened. "We caught almost all of it. But there's been a complication, so we need you to go in and replace someone. Her name is Samantha Reston. Make sure you've taken her place within the next half-hour. Once you're her, you call me on this number. I'll give you further instructions. The security password is 'weather report'. I will respond with 'chance of thunder'. I checked; it's clear skies all day locally, so nobody else should ask. I'll explain more then."

You're a little baffled by this whole development; it's so sudden, and a lot of responsibility seems to lie on your shoulders. You also wonder why, if it's so critical, Elena would be tasking you with it. Maybe this is another test? The real test, designed to haze you and see how you react under pressure? It's possible. Either way, you have to move quickly.

"Why aren't you doing this?"

Elena pulls the car over, slowly down as she parks up at the kerb. "Because this is a Type 2 job. I'm Type 1, and that means I kick ass. You're the specialist in subterfuge. So do what you do best. Find yourself a new face, get in there, and become Sam Reston."

You climb out of the cab, pens in your pocket, and the car speeds off. It's only then you look across the road toward your target. It's not what you expected at all.

"Crap," you say.

You're about to infiltrate...

You saunter through the mall, feeling magnificent. Every so often you pause and dip in to your purse, pulling out Phoebe's compact and staring at your reflection. You smile. You blow kisses. You give a cheeky wink as if you were a 1940s pin-up. You revel in Phoebe's classic style, the pearl necklace bouncing lightly against breasts well concealed in a simple sun dress. Your curls and bow sit perfectly on your head, as you survey the world around you.

It's a shopping mall, but no longer for goods. You're not interested in the clothes, or the games, or even the more high-priced goods. Instead, you're looking at people. Lives you could borrow for a time. You could be anyone, do anything. You could zap that man over there, pepper-grey hair and thin beard, and use his money to eat your dinner at the finest restaurant in town. Or you could shoot the woman in the beauticians getting a pedicure, with oversized breasts and silicone lips. You could seduce and enchant, or simply walk into the life of someone and enjoy it to the full.

But that's what Jimmy would do.

Jimmy, the prankster. The one who just wants to have fun. He doesn't even see the real potential of what this means. The ability to be anyone, to act like anyone, to adopt their identity utterly.

It's the most powerful gift in the world.

You tap your stolen nails against the glass of the automatic door as you exit the mall, heading straight for Phoebe's car. You've got big plans.

As you slip in the small cab, you turn on the radio and close your blushed eyes. You know everything to be Phoebe. You could go home to your girlfriend and your cats, or you could go to your studio and pick up your photography equipment, which would give you access to even more potential options. Or you could just take route one.

Jimmy thought about pranks, you're thinking about riches. You could step into the shoes of a bank employee, and rob it. You could even just walk into a bank and empty an account - Phoebe has several thousand saved away. But why stop there? You could run the town if you want. The mayor, Tina Chan, holds a weekend drop-in. You could always borrow her life for a short while. A taste of power could do you good. Or perhaps you could borrow the life of a celebrity? There's a concert tonight Trish was talking about, or perhaps you could do something even more wild. You had considered going to that sci-fi convention just out of town. What better way to cosplay than to be someone else?

Alternatively, what about revenge? You and Jimmy aren't the most popular kids in school. You've had your fair share of rejection and humiliation. Fellow students, and even teachers, have made your life hell. Why not use this to get revenge? Principal Collins seems to have had it out for you. What if he suddenly found his wife was sleeping around, or had put laxatives in his evening meal? Or why stop there? The football team seem to think nothing can touch them. 112212211222.content:
You rev the engine and pull Phoebe's car out of her space, and away from the mall, laughing her shrill laugh. You look into her eyes in the rear view mirror, and chuckle. "Oh, Phoebe," you sigh. "You're perfect in so many ways. But for revenge, you're not quite perfect enough. Just the first step in a wider plan."

You rap your painted nails along the steering wheel as you consider your next play. As it happens, regardless of who you're going to take on, the plan is the same. You need a new identity, and Phoebe - or specifically her car - is going to get it for you. You rev the engine again and pile on the power, tires screaming as you make a turn onto the highway.

There are two options for your next move. The football team are playing tonight. You have a whole host of strategies for taking them down a peg or two. You could take over one of the cheerleader squad and distract them, or become the coach or quarterback and ruin the plays. But part of you wonders if you should just shut them down early, sneak a sedative into their water bucket, or mess around with their kit in the locker room. As anybody from the janitor to one of the team, you could do anything.

But then there's Collins. His wife is an equally attractive possibility. Miranda Collins is well known in your school: a classic blonde bombshell, perfect shape and voluminous blonde locks. She raised eyebrows once when the school found the principal's online photo account, and took everyone's breath away as she was dressed as Marylin Munroe at a costume party. Collins did his best to have revenge on the students that found the account. And given that was you and Jimmy...

You sigh, and pile on the speed. 70...80...90. You're now at the limits of Phoebe's car, and you're laughing as you consider your revenge. Ms Franklin was always talking about the 'Ring of Gyges', and how absolute power corrupts absolutely. Well, this is absolute power. And a little corruption, to either Collins' or the football team's life, would be a good thing.

The dashboard flashes blue, and you hear the wail of a siren behind you. Phoebe's eyes sparkle, and you chuckle, slowing the car down. Elegantly you straighten your dress and preen your hair as you pull over on the darkest stretch of road you can find. The sun's beginning to set, and you wait patiently as the officer pulls up behind you. The shadow begins to walk toward you, a flashlight in hand, which shines straight in your face. You blink for a few seconds, and look at the uniformed figure standing outside.

It's not officer O'Sullivan, the only member of the local police department you know. It's much, much better. The officer is Hispanic, with long black hair tied up in a ponytail, strong features and large, pouting lips that are curled in irritation. You study the woman's shape under her uniform, admiring her athletic physique.

"What's the matter, officer?" You chuckle. "Tail light out?"

"License and registration, m'am." The officer says, barely restraining her irritation. You reach for your purse, and the pens within it.

"Of course." You say, before there is a short glow, and the sound of something falling to the floor."

Your name is Julieta Suarez. Officer Julieta Suarez, as you straighten your uniform, and fasten your belt, handcuffs, baton, to your waist. Calmly, you take your new seat, smiling with pouting lips as you 'accidentally' delete the latest files from the squad car's video record.

Now you have two options. Either you can head to the local stadium and mess with the football team - you could slip into another disguise, or even pull over the team on the way there and mess with them that way. Or you can head back to the station. You remember hearing that the delightful Mrs Collins works as a file clerk at the local police precinct. And now, as the trusted officer Suarez, you have easy access to the entire precinct...

Martinez is a Latina who could have been a model or movie star; every guy in your class practically drools over her. Franklin on the other hand couldn't be more different. Short, mouse-brown hair, thick glasses, always so meek. You're amazed she's going on the party at all. But the idea of going wild in that shy shell is appealing.

“Sure,” Jimmy nods, walking over to the escalators. “Hannah Franklin and Julia Martinez. It's a pretty simple switch. We'll just wear our current looks underneath.”

“No way, I want them back as they were,” you say, meaning Jessica and her mother. Nobody is paying attention to your conversation; to everyone else it just looks like a classic mother-daughter fight in a mall. “Tonight, young lady.”

Jimmy snorts and rolls his eyes, just like Jessica when she's in one of her moods. “Fine, Mom, whatever. We'll restore them when we get to the hotel room, OK?”

You look into the shop through the doors, the display room discreet behind a window display. “Looks like we don't have to,” Jimmy says, pointing inside. Four women are inside, checking out their dresses. Franklin is centre stage in her wedding dress, and – despite her glasses – looks stunning. As always, Ms Martinez's legs make you drool, and she looks incredible in her bridesmaid outfit. The other two women you don't recognise. One is taller than the others - slightly curvy with dirty blonde hair. The other is a stunning redhead, hair a long shower of curls.

“Who's it going to be?” Jimmy asks. “You pick two.” He passes you the pen.

“Wait, we're going in?”

Jimmy's right – the assistant is busy and the women are heading back to the changing rooms. With utter confidence, Jessica's body saunters into the boutique and slips, unnoticed, after them. You follow, entering the changing rooms just as the group vanish into their individual booths.

Jessica's face grins. Jimmy's given you the choice of who to zap, both for you and him.
