Her body shape was entirely different to his of course, a perfect hourglass he could never replicate. But as an academic exercise, he found it interesting to map her identity.

“You know you're keeping me here against the law?” he asked, a measured taunt. “Generally a job interview doesn't involve illegal detention.”

“Illegal? Come now. So is breaking into a restricted access area, impersonating a military officer, corporate espionage, and attempting to steal a prototype guidance chip. Who put you up to it? Hmm?” She tilted her head, like an apex predator sizing up its next meal. “Hmm? No answer? No matter. We are far more interested in you than who your current employer happens to be. We know exactly who you are.”

Elias smiled passively. Of course they did. He'd been caught through the worst possible luck imaginable; their servers had been reset and passwords altered. Otherwise he'd have been in and out without a moment's thought. He'd done it a thousand times before, to hundreds of companies across the world. That's why he'd attracted that stupid name in some circles. Chameleon? Lizards that changed colour? It didn't even scratch the surface of his talents. Psychology, profiling, misdirection, acting and makeup. He made his money on elaborate cons and daring thefts – if he said so himself.

“Do tell.”

“A corporate spy for hire, known for extensive use of disguise and impersonation. No job too big or small, as long as you get your rather exorbitant fee. Suspected in countless acts of theft, espionage, sudden changes of corporate policy, embarrassing incidents that harm reputations... and that doesn't even go into the long list of international incidents you are believed to have perpetrated. You tend to use non-lethal means; assuming a fitting identity through extensive use of prosthetics or character acting. You even use non-lethal means when cornered, too, it seems. What did we find on you when we caught you in the labs?” she paused as she looked at her file. “Gas and flashbangs, unlikely to cause any permanent damage. How touching.”

“There are rules,” Elias said calmly. “Business is business. But when it comes to people, I like to exercise a little respect for life. Call me old fashioned, but not enough people play the game properly anymore, miss?”

“Ms. Bell. Veronica Bell. I'm the vice-president of corporate intelligence.”

She smiled, pencil-thin, and leaned forward. Her fingers slid over the desk, her body revealing just enough cleavage. She was using seduction as a weapon; that meant she wanted something. He knew it was coming, knew every step in her repertoire already. Seduce, entice, an offer, then an ultimatum.

“You are quite a talent, Elias. Which is why we want you to work for us. Exclusively. We need an infiltrator, someone who can be anybody we want them to be. Sometimes your job might be to replace someone for a few days, sign a document, grant us a contract. At other times it will be to obtain our rivals' information. Standard corporate espionage. We could get someone second-rate, but we want you and your rather unique talents; we only take the best. I'm to make you an offer you will not refuse.”

Suddenly it all made sense. An unfortunate server outage? The disinterest in his employer? It had been a set-up. They just wanted him here, now, to join them. He felt like an idiot. “Join, or I'll disappear?”

“Something like that. But I think you will appreciate the job. The pay is outstanding, the benefits... exceptional. We will even offer you an upgrade to your equipment.”

“Sounds like I don't have a choice.” He was playing along now; at least until they let him out. The upgrade was something else he hadn't seen coming. Usually corporations couldn't dream to match his own tools. This one seemed confident they had something he'd never seen.

Her fingernails traced the top of his hands. Then, without warning, something penetrated his skin. It still burned as he recoiled in agony. Blood oozed from a tiny, precise wound. She smiled, pulling back her hand to reveal a micro-injector in her palm.

“That was insurance. I just implanted a chip, no larger than a grain of sand, allowing us to track you. We couldn't exactly let you go without it. As I told you, this is an interview, and we require a demonstration of your skill to make sure we have the right man.”

Elias nursed his hand, glaring angrily across the table. “Thanks for the warning. No what do I have to do?”

“Simple: walk out the front door. What you do then is up to you, but we want you to report back here, to my office on the 7th floor, at 11am tomorrow morning. That's it: leave now, then slip back in undetected. All staff have been given your description, and are to shoot on sight, or alert a guard to shoot you on sight, if you are seen out of custody.”

“And the upgrade?”

She smiled, and pulled out a pen from her inside pocket. It was black, unremarkable, save for a little button and a strange symbol. Elias looked at it with confusion. It didn't look like any technology he was familiar with.

“The ultimate disguise kit. Point and fire. The subject will be unharmed, as long as you shoot them again once you're finished with the disguise. That's all there is to it.”

Elias' confusion continued. What the hell was she talking about? “That thing?”

“This thing. Oh, it's quite a surprising tool. We obtained it from... well, that doesn't matter. There are some unique applications. I'll let you see for yourself. To describe its effects would be an injustice.”

“Fine. Tomorrow, 11am, with just a pen to escape. I can do that.”

“Outstanding. Now, listen carefully. The next person to come into this room will be one of our nursing staff, who will treat that little injury. I will leave the nurse's personnel file on the desk. You may consider that an opportunity to brush up on some key details.”

“What does the pen do?” Elias asked, picking it up curiously.

She smiled, icy-calm, as only someone who held all the cards could be. “I suggest you use it to find out. Remember though; this freedom is an act of faith on my part. If you are not in my office for 11am tomorrow, the chip I implanted will allow our agents to find you. And they will kill you without hesitation; no second chances. Now, either use the pen at your medical, or take it back to your cell with my compliments. I'm sure curiosity, survival instinct, or sheer inevitability will get the better of you.”

Elias shrugged, looking at the pen. A strange feeling passed over him, as if someone had just handed him a gun. He glanced back at his captor. Veronica was too arrogant and confident. She thought he was still going to be thinking about the pen by the time she left the room. What would happen, he wondered, if he just used it now?
151.title: Rise of the Chameleon

1511.content:
You stand up and begin walking around the room slowly and cautiously. Veronica notices this as well. "Just what are you doing?" she snaps.

"Just walking around a bit." you state as you continue to walk around the room, "It helps me think. This is some pretty heavy stuff you've laid on me. Some weird stuff too. Gimme a minute to make up my mind?"

Veronica sniffs dismissively but doesn't seem to say or do anything to stop you. The truth of the matter is that you're casing the room, looking for any signs that there might be hidden cameras. There's always little signs to these things, you've learned, and to your surprise there doesn't seem to be any. Perhaps that's a sign of arrogance of how unbreachable they are that they wouldn't need to worry about anything going on in this room. That's good. That should make things much easier. But two people came in, others outside the room saw that, so when one comes out you'll need an excuse... and you find it in the form of an air vent up in the corner. You size it up... just low enough to reach via chair and large enough for someone to fit in.

You look at the pen and notice three buttons: black, blue and white. You wonder what this all means, what it does. Absentmindedly you point it at Veronica without thinking and hit the blue button and...

Information comes flooding in. Veronica Bell, age thirty-eight, vice president not just of corporate intelligence but of the entire company. And more than that... so that's what these buttons do! Veronica doesn't seem to have noticed anything so you smile.

"You know, Ms. Bell, you're not gonna have to wait until tomorrow for my answer." you say, "I'll give it to you right now, actually."

With that you aim the pen at her and hit the black button. She can barely muster a look of shock before she suddenly deflates, a pile of loose skin in a pantsuit. Quickly you get to work moving the chair over to the vent, you look and see a small latch and pressing it causes the the vent cover to come off and you place it on the ground. You then look in your jacket and are thankful when you find some of the smaller pellets that they seemed to miss when bringing you in.

You place it on the table and then head over to the skin that was Veronica Bell. Thanks to that blue button you know exactly what to do and finding the opening you slip into it effortlessly as it conforms and reshapes your body. Once you've got her clothes back on you smile: you're Veronica Bell now. You then reach onto the table and grab the pellet. You brace yourself and toss it onto the ground. There's a loud bang and smoke instantly fills the room. It won't be long before the guards come but that's the time you'd need if you were actually pulling off the excuse you'll give.

The door opens no more than 60 seconds later and two guards come rushing in.

"Ms. Bell, what's going on?!" one of them shouts as he fights through the smoke. "We heard a loud bang."

You cough and push away the smoke. "What's going on is that one of your idiot co-workers missed a small pellet he had on him!" you scream, "What's going on is that you're too slow! Because of that he was able to get away through the vent with the pen! Do you know what your screw ups have done to us?!"

"M-ma'am, we're sorry we'll find him." The other apologizes.

"You're damn right you'll find him or you'll be finding new jobs!" you growl as you march out of the room, "I'm leaving for the day. We're in potential shit and I need to get my lawyer."

You head out to the parking lot and as you arrive at Veronica's, now your, Bentley you smile as you pull the pen out of your suit pocket. These pens truly are the perfect disguise. The blue button "downloads" all of the information related to the target, including memories, personality and everything required to impersonate them mentally, directly into your mind. The black button turns someone into a wearable skin. The white opens the skin back up allowing you to get out.

You drive to the law offices of Janet Wong, a high-powered corporate attorney who works mainly for Veronica and her company; partly because of the money, partly because Janet and Veronica were part of the same sorority at Harvard. You demand to see her but are told she's out and should be back in a few moments. A few moments pass and while Janet doesn't immediately show up, someone else does: Connie Wong. Connie is Janet's 16-year-old niece, a cute girl and overachiever interning both at her aunt's law office as well as Veronica's company with a job waiting at either one in a few years when she graduates college.

You had come to switch into Janet; being so close to Veronica you could take her and her company down quite easily and you're worried that the guards might quickly assume that you've actually switched into Veronica. But Connie being involved in both is also less assuming as she's still just a girl. They captured you, threatened you and you want revenge and she'd be the perfect place from which to sabotage things. Or maybe Veronica would. They might not suspect anything leaving you free to slowly chip away at her company helping competitors... or maybe enjoy the luxuries and perks associated with being her. Take a small break from the corporate espionage game before dumping Veronica and going back into spying with your new perfect disguise kit.

The information from the blue button revealed one more piece of information: there was never a chip. It was a bluff meant to scare you into cooperating. They'll be on a wild goose chase while you'll be right under their noses. But will it be as Janet, Connie or Veronica?
1511.title: The Pen is Mightier

choices: Find a way into the investigation
1512.content:
(Switching to 2nd Person POV.)

No, you realized that they were probably expecting you to use it on her. Besides, the chip was still embedded in your body, they would still find you.
After a moment of hesitation, a smile spread itself across Veronica's face, confirming your suspicions, they definitely wanted you to use it on her.
But, using it at the medical might not be a bad idea. Somehow, you thought you could remove the chip, one way or another. You needed the advantage if you were going to play this kind of game, especially with an organization that was able to set you up so easily. You needed to learn, and what better way is there to learn than to experiment?

"Alright Mister... Elias? I'm going to have to ask you to remove your clothes." A young lady with bright red hair said, looking at a clipboard.

Complying, you removed your jacket and placed it on a metal table in front, doing the same for your shirt. Your build was relatively modest, not too stocky, not too slim, just about in the middle. Of course, it needed to be that way, impersonations aren't all about your face and your voice. Body shape was incredibly important as well.
Spinning the black pen you'd been gifted in between his fingers, it was similar to an expensive pen you'd once been gifted by your wife.
Your real wife, Annabelle.
The plan starts now, you glanced at his hand, where Veronica had injected your hand with the chip. You have to get it out, and fast.

"Please lay down here." The nurse said, snapping him out of his thoughts.

"Right, sorry." You reply, moving to the elevated examination table next to her.

Climbing up, you quickly lay down, concealing the pen under his waist. The nurse set her clipboard down. You knew there were guards still outside from when they'd "escorted" you here, and you'd need to get on with it discreetly, so as not to alert the rest of the bloody building. Luckily, you'd just been given the "ultimate disguise kit", according to the lovely Ms. Bell. In all honesty, you doubted disguise kits could get any more "ultimate" than what you'd worked with previously. There's a reason you were so renowned among the rich and powerful. When in your sights, their money couldn't help them very much.
Or so you thought. These people seem to know very much about you, and you don't know very much about them. What are they playing at?
Clearly, they value you, and they're trying to test you in more ways than one. They want to verify if you're as good as they say, but they also want to know if you're obedient. They'll soon find that the only thing you obey is the money.

You felt a cold hard object press against your chest, a stethoscope. The nurse began her examination and was listening to your heart and breathing.
After a few seconds, she removed it and checked something off on her clipboard, then proceeding to wrap the plastic of a sphygmometer around your arm, slightly raising it. Grabbing the plastic handle, she pumped air until ti was tight around your arm, you felt your own blood coursing through your veins.
Looking up and over, you saw the needle rising on the dial, everything seemed alright. Another check.
An eye exam was next, then an ear exam, then she examined the inside of your mouth. Jesus, this woman loves to examine things.
Everything seemed finished a few moments later, and you swung your legs off the table, sitting up.

"Alright, one more thing." The nurse said, retrieving a needle from a plastic casing inside a refrigerator, along with a bottle containing some yellow liquid.

"What is that..?" If there's one thing you hate more than failing, it's needles. A bit unprofessional but you try your best to hide it.

"A little something to keep you healthy." The nurse smiled, before testing the needle and moving towards you quickly.

She grips your arm, but you're faster, you slap the needle out of her hand before she injects you. It hits the floor, sending little splotches of yellow liquid about.
Looking back up to you in surprise, you grip her neck and press your thumb against her larynx, stopping her from breathing, and screaming.

"You probably know what's next, don't you sweetheart?" You say.

A pistol appears from underneath the nurse's uniform, and she smiles. You return the smile, grabbing your pen before she can shoot you and plunging it into her ribs, hitting the button as fast as possible. Instantly her entire body seems to just drop, the pistol clattering loudly on the floor. You hold her skin loosely by the neck and it's a few moment before you've realized what's happened. This pen.. That's what they meant by perfect disguise. It turned the woman INTO a disguise!
It's almost genius, and kind of twisted, but you're getting past that quickly. You're wondering to what extent does this "disguise" work? If it turned her into a disguise, it'll probably work damn well. You're running out of time, you soon discover, the guards heard the struggle and are knocking on the door.
You jump off the table and grab the skin quickly, noticing a long, thin slit running down the nurse's neck. The texture of this woman's skin is strange, similar to real skin, but like it was a mix between human flesh and.. bubblegum. No time for thinking, just act. You've got to stop the guards. Ripping open the slit, you shove your head through the opening and up the nurse's neck, quickly stretching her head over your own. Much like wearing a mask you discover, and you quickly get acquainted. Then the sensations start and you're taking over by a completely foreign feeling of melting and hardening. Your very flesh it melding itself into something new, you get up, the entire body of the nurse hanging from your neck. A nearby mirror hangs near a medicine cabinet and you move to inspect yourself. You tug downwards to adjust the mask as you inspect yourself in the mirror.

"Hello?! Is everything alright in there?"

"Shit." you whisper. Wait a minute, your voice.. It's the nurse's. This is fucking amazing.

An idea bubbles up to the surface in your head and you grin.

"Hold on a moment! Don't come in yet!" You yell to them, your voice is completely the same as hers.

You rip the mask from your head and fish off the woman's clothes. You don't know whether to be turned on by the skin of an adequately attractive woman or incredibly disturbed by it. Needlessly, you dismiss the thought and focus on putting it on. The slit runs down her entire back, down to her ass, you discover. Pulling it open, you step inside and quickly pull it over yourself. Your entire body melts and hardens, filling and tightening in places, dissolving and loosening in others. As you open your eyes, you're astounded by a new feeling. Inspecting yourself, you're shorter now, the nurse was about 3 inches or so shorter than you. But you've got a full pair of breasts, and they're full. Gripping them, they fill your fingers and you bite your lips, trying not to make noise.

Open the door now! Nurse! Open the goddamn door!

Oh shit. You hurry to pull on the nurse's undergarments as well as her uniform, running to the door, you unlock it. Your appearance is as you want it to be, confused, surprised, and rushed. The soldiers storm in past you and search for well, you. You're obviously not there, to their dismay.

"He's not here." One of them says.

"Where'd he go?" Asks the other.

"He got out through one of the air vents." You lied.

"Shit, tell Security, we need to find this fucker and fast." Says the one looking down an air duct.

You smile to yourself, concealing it as you look at your shoes. A guard turns back to you and says something.

"You alright? Did he hurt you in any way?" He asks.

"Choked me, I pulled my gun on him but he still got away." You say, at least now it's the truth.

"Alright, well, get checked out. We're having this room sectioned off for inspection." He says.

Nodding, you promptly grab your pistol, her pistol, and leave, already having concealed your lovely new pen in your shirt pocket.
Heading to the women's bathroom, you figure it'd be a good place to get some solace before your next move. You pass by a few friendly nurses on the way, you don't know them but they obviously know you. A couple friendly greetings and you arrive at the bathroom. Opening the door, you shut it behind you and walk to a stall. Looking around, the place is well kept and sparkling. There's nobody else in here, you discover, after inspecting each stall discreetly. You lock the bathroom door and move to a mirror. There are probably hidden cameras for all you know, so you won't "undress" here. You need to get out of the building.
Gotta' ditch the old job, you can't recover the chip anyway, that section's being cut off. But wait.. you can impersonate anyone down to their DNA. What's stopping you? All you need is a way in.
1512.title: Wait for the medical staff

15121.content:
You're not going to abandon a job that you've started. Especially when you've just acquired the greatest tool of your career.

More importantly, you've just worked out exactly what you were stealing to begin with. A guidance chip? Sure, your army officer disguise was perfect for that, but what if it wasn't a guidance chip at all? These pens are incredible, and something tells you that you're only seeing the first signs of what they can do. This is nanotechnology at its finest. Didn't they say they'd implanted a chip in you? Again, nanotechnology.

The chip isn't a guidance chip for a missile. It's for whatever this pen is called. Guidance... it could mean anything.

You compose yourself, and rise up again, walking out to the mirror. The nurse's face greets you: her eyes, her cheeks, her smile. You flick a strand of your bright red hair out of your face, and take a deep breath with your borrowed lungs.

"Right," you say, the nurse's voice echoing as you adjust your new cleavage. "Time to get back to work."

You need to get that chip, and the nurse identity isn't going to pass. You walk through the corridors, again half-smiling to co-workers you don't recognise. This isn't helpful. You need to get out of medical and in to the real action.

"Hey, Anna." You give a non-committal half-turn as the voice calls you from behind. It's one of the soldiers from earlier. He comes up right to you, and you change your expression to one of expectation. Evidently, you are Anna.

"Hey yourself, Jones," you say, noting the man's name emblazoned on his duty shirt. He gives you a smile. It's strange; Anna's body is a full three inches shorter than yours, and so you find yourself in the unnatural position of looking up at the military man.

"We've made a sweep. No sign of him."

You do your best to look disappointed. "Great. So I got choked and you didn't even catch him?"

"I'm not the one with the slow reactions," he observes. "How'd you even let him get the drop on you, anyway?"

"I was giving him an injection," you respond. The solider just rolls his eyes.

"Shit. So you're telling me we didn't even get the tracer into him?"

"I think Ms Bell injected..."

"She didn't inject shit," the soldier sighs. "You know as well as I do that tracker chip is worthless without the nanite protocols. You really fucked up this time."

You try and act as you imagine Anna would: not upset, but defiant.

"Well, maybe if you guys had something beyond a delayed reaction, it wouldn't be a problem."

"Whatever. You need to report to Colonel Branner. This is a joint military-civilian contractor operation. I'll tell Bell what happened."

"Forget it, I'll do that," you say, hoping it will delay the search. "Might as well take responsibility. Where's Branner?"

"Industrial labs."

You nod, and walk off down the corridor. That's exactly the answer you wanted, you think, as you smooth Anna's hair back and saunter along in your nurse's uniform, confident in your disguise. The Industrial Labs is where you'll find the chip.

*****

You get in with a minimum of delay, and it quickly becomes apparent just how good this disguise truly is. As Anna, you're expected to give a retinal scan just to get in to the secure area, and you pass without incident. This is where they caught you before; your schematics of the building and its secretive corporate research/defense contracts wing had said nothing about a retinal scan, and those were too complex for you to mimic. Now, though, you don't even hesitate as the doors swing open to let you through.

You guess Branner will be in the executive chambers, but that's not something you're going to worry about now. As Anna, you make a sharp turn to the right, side-stepping in to the women's changing rooms. Another employee is there, towel around her waist, about to step inside a shower. The tech doesn't pay you a second glance, though you afford her a longer look. She's African-American, with shoulder-length hair and an attractive shape with athletic curves. She's got an attractive face too, with dreamy eyes and a slight pout. You offer a half-smile again as you step toward a locker, and she returns to the shower.

It doesn't take long for you to find the static-proof overalls, or to don them. Anna's flame-red hair takes a little effort to collect in the hair net, but then you've never had to do that before: it's always been a wig or your own, much shorter locks. Eventually you're in the protective equipment, and ready to step in to the lab itself.

The whole place is white. Polished tile floors, sterile benches, computers neatly pushed up against the wall. Entering gives you a blast of frigid, stuffy air - it's a climate controlled environment. That much you expected: this is a specialized weapons lab, after all. The men's entrance is on the other side of the lab, and the other two sides are dominated by a long window of tinted glass. Obviously some people like to watch the experiments here.

The rest, you already know: it was part of your preparation. Two cameras, each with a 90 degree pan. You look up and catch one in your peripheral vision. You'll have 15 seconds once the camera pans away. The pass code is - unless they changed it - 8467. The rest of the lab is empty. Steadying your breathing, you wait for the camera to pan away, and step forward.

Then you're out of camera view. Immediately you burst in to action. You tap the code furiously, and the lock springs open. The chip - there's only one in the secure vault - sits, paraded for you to see within two pincers. Immediately you grab it, and close the vault behind you.

Five seconds left. You takes three steps back and stop, standing still.

The camera pan continues, catching your form stood exactly where you were a moment ago. You smile, turning back to the changing room. The other tech is still in the shower, but you now have the chip. You pause for a moment as you strip out of the static-proof clothing, discarding the overalls in the bin provided, to look at it. It's small, and almost insignificant - a piece of plastic and metal. But it's also strangely twisted; almost cylindrical. Almost as if...

You walk over to the bench, and take a seat, pulling the pen out of your top pocket. You look at it, and twist heavily, much as you would with any other pen. In a moment it gives way, pulling apart to reveal an inner compartment. It looks much like any other electronic device, but there's a slot where... you grab the chip and set it in. With a tiny click, it slots in to place.

Anna's neatly manicured brow curves in curiosity. You wonder if it really is a guidance chip after all. What if this doesn't just turn your target into a disguise; what if it somehow could store memories, or mannerisms? What if it gives you guidance on your impersonation? There's only one way to find out, you figure...

Suddenly the door opens. Quickly you hide the pen again, and look up. It's a young woman in soldier's uniform, an athletic figure hidden under military fatigues. Three stripes on her arm says she's a sergeant, and Rourke on her breast suggests she's of Irish descent. Her hair is blonde, though her skin has the healthy glow of someone who spends most of her time outdoors.

"Lowry?" she asks. "Anna Lowry?"

"Er...yeah?"

"I was asked to come find you. Colonel's wondering if you got lost on your way to his office or something."

"I," you pause, thinking of something convincing. "I just needed to take a break, for a moment. Collect my thoughts. The attack was stressful, you know?"

The woman nods. "You got to toughen up. Colonel says he wants to see you right now. We thought we had the Chameleon today, he wants to know what happened, and SNAFU isn't gonna cut it. Anyway, my job was just to find you, then I'm done for the day. No reason I didn't find you in," she glances at her watch, "say, five minutes? Army grunts ain't all heartless."

You smile, and wonder what you should do next. You could, of course, play Anna and go and see this colonel. You don't have any of her memories, though at least you have a full name now: Anna Lowry.

But you're eager to test out your new toy. Sgt Rourke here, or the tech currently in the shower, could be a good test - and a quick way out of the building. Rourke will know more about what the military is actually doing here. And the tech may know a lot more about the pen itself, and what Ms Bell's plans for you are.
15121.title: A different type of guidance chip

151212.content:
"OK," you reply with a smile. "I'll be along in a moment."

It's a lie: you've no intention of going anywhere. O'Rouke nods though, and leaves. Instead you take out the pen. The sound of a hair dryer starts up, and you notice the other technician has towelled off and is preparing to get dressed. That should make your job easier, if this pen works anything like you think it will. You wait a moment, turning it over in your hands, wondering just what this corporation, and the military, has been up to.

The job was a farce - you can see that now. But this pen is something else; something incredible. It seems to transform people at a molecular level, and it's technology that should never fall into the wrong hands (such as your own). One thing's for certain: if you decide to run with the pen, you can't go home to your wife. They know too much about you. Borrowing people's lives like this has always been fine on an ethical level, but actually...wearing them? It's a hideous thought, like some kind of sci-fi project gone wrong. And yet, if you don't, you wonder just what this sinister civilian-military project would do. This is too much power for any one to have. But another device like this? Mass produced? It would change the world. They could replace anyone, do anything.

You can't let that happen. You make your mind up. And, as Anna, you stand up and head back into the lab.

"Hey, ain't you forgetting something?" The woman asks, turning off her dryer, speaking with a thick Southern US accent.

"Oh, yeah," you respond, smiling. She means the static overalls. You don't. You point the pen and fire.

Michelle Jackson... who does that bitch think she is? I ain't ever even seen her before... man, I'll be glad to end the day...

The woman's thoughts, name, very being fill your mind, taking you aback even as she collapses into an empty shell opposite. Holy shit. Guidance was the right word after all: guidance on how to be someone. With the knowledge you have, you could impersonate Michelle Jackson perfectly. Mannerisms, account details, relationship with her husband... it's all there. So that's what the chip is! And that's why what you're about to do is so important...

You step into the lab, now free from interruption. The camera pan only gives you a few seconds, but you're sure it's not being monitored automatically, and by the time they realize what's happened, you're going to be long-gone. You walk in to the lab, flipping out the controlled gas tubes and flooding the room. Then, taking out the magazine from Anna's gun, you clip some bullets onto a hot plate and turn it on. In about three minutes the primer will ignite. You turn and hurry out the room.

Three minutes later, the room explodes with a fury. Smoke, flash fires and sprinklers going off, klaxons blaring with a repetitive whine. Chaos erupts in the complex, everyone wondering what the hell is happening. You follow the crowd, a scared, panicked look on your face as you evacuate the building, a precious cargo in hand.

"Make way! Got a casualty here!" You get through immediately, everyone giving you space and help as you carry out the slumped, unconscious body of Anna Lowry, fully restored from her ordeal. Michelle Jackson, married laboratory technician, is being a hero - saving a work colleague from certain death. As you set the slumped body you carry down at the rally point, a crowd gathers. Anna is regaining consciousness, but seems confused. You smile a very un-Michelle smile as you turn your attention to your handiwork.

The whole building is in flames. The laboratory must have had more stuff involved, though you hope that everything to do with the pen has been destroyed. That means your prototype - and chip - are the only ones in the world. Away, on the other side of the complex, you can see Veronica Bell berate and point at a large, well-built man in military fatigues, with pepper-grey hair and a stern expression. Michelle's mind tells you that's Brenner. As she begins to piece together what happened, Bell turns and begins to scan the scene. She's looking for someone out of place. She's looking for you.

Michelle's recently-damped hair is indistinguishable from the other soaked members of the laboratory staff, but you've got charcoal smears on your lab clothes. It's only a matter of time before someone tells Ms Bell about how Michelle Jackson pulled Anna Lowry from the building. It's time to get a new disguise. As chaos continues to erupt from the building, you slip away, across the street, and into a nearby burger joint. Nobody seems to notice outside, although a few patrons and staff look up at the soot-stained woman who enters. You feign shock, walking loosely with Michelle's body as if you're in a daze, and stumble in to the bathroom. With any luck they'll decide you're just stunned by what's happened.

You look at your current face in a mirror. Michelle is a mess; her hair is wild and the expression you've plastered on her face is one of scared confusion. Still, you're pro enough to sense you're not alone in the bathroom. There's a flush, and a woman in a yellow sun dress exits a cubicle. She's got quite a large figure, definitely overweight, with wavy, parted blonde hair and a fresh face with large cheeks. She's in her late 20s you would guess. She's also perfect. Without a moment's thought you turn and fire.

"Sorry, hun," you say with your thick accent. "But I need to be you for a little while."

A minute later, you're adjusting your new, large breasts into your bra, and fitting your new, larger face over your own, contorting its muscles and flicking your hair back. Your name is Melinda Curtis, and you're in town shopping for the day. Your car is parked a little down the street. You're conscious of your weight, but you intend to slim down before your holiday. And... oh. You'd better put your dress back on, hadn't you? You grab the fabric and pull it over your head, stretching the light yellow fabric out over your curves, before bending down to pick up your clutch, and slipping the pen inside.

"Hi," you say in Melinda's perfect voice as you straighten your flabby jawline in the mirror. "My name's Mel. Yeah, I heard all about that fire... I was on the street opposite. What happened? A woman was found unconscious in the restaurant opposite? How did that happen?"

You turn, and point the pen at Michelle, returning her to normal as you walk out of the door. "Oh, right," you think. "That's how it happened." You unlock the bathroom door and step out of the restaurant, out into the street, where your (now blue) eyes are just another set staring across at the flames and smoke opposite. It's with a satisfied smile that you turn, and saunter away in the flats you wear in your new, plus-size form.

You need to get away from here and decide what to do. With Melinda's phone you could probably call up your handler and get a new contract, but this mission will go down as a failure and you could be drawing unwanted attention to your whereabouts. Alternatively, Mel's knowledge tells you she's got a nice rented apartment where you're unlikely to be disturbed. You could always lie low as her for a while - or find a better life to borrow while you work out what to do with this incredible invention.

Chameleon is no more. Now you can't just look like anyone you want. You can be anyone you want.
151212.title: Smoke and mirrors

1512122.content:
You arrive at Mel's apartment in the posh downtown section of the city and flop down onto the couch with a groan. Yeah, you'll definitely need to look into finding someone better: Mel could stand to lose quite a bit of weight and while you could do that yourself, she's only a means to an end. You think about her neighbors: who would be the best to be, who would be the easiest to get. For the next hour as you fix a snack and watch a bit of television you run through the possibilities before finally settling on the best possible one.

On the floor above Mel is a couple: the Chans. Ronald Chan holds a nice VP position at a large bank while Janice, his wife, works as a secretary for Veronica Bell herself. As a bonus both are fairly young, in maybe their mid thirties, and good looking. Plus Janice would undoubtedly be home due to the incident at Veronica's company.

So with that you aim the pen at yourself and fire opening up Mel's skin and stepping out. You want a little bit of a clean break before switching after all.

You then step out into the hall and take the elevator up to the next floor. You walk down the hall before finally finding what you were looking for almost directly above Mel's apartment. You then knock on the door and wait. It's about a minute or so and you're ready to knock again before the door opens. An Asian woman answers, fair-skinned, slightly curvy and chipmunk cheeked. Her hair, while a bit frazzled, is pulled back in a bun and glasses cover her slanted eyes.

"Can I help you," she asks though with a bit of a tired, distracted tone.

"Yes, hi my name's... Andrew. Andrew Lowe," you state with a charming smile. "My car broke down right in front of here and I just need to use the phone to call a tow truck."

She eyes you oddly, "You don't have a cell phone," she asks.

"It, ah, died," you reply sheepishly, "I'm really bad at keeping track of the battery life. Happens quite a bit."

"The third floor's kind of out of the way too," she adds.

Another sheepish grin, "Yeah, I tried a bunch of other places. Either nobody answered or I got the door shut on me."

Janice again eyes you but finally, possibly due to being worn down by the events of the day, she relents and opens the door wider to let you in. "The phone's in the kitchen," she calls out as she closes the front door.

"Oh, I'll definitely know where it is," you state to yourself. Once her back is turned you pull out the pen and fire.

A few moments later you're in the bathroom, dressed in a loose fitting shirt and yoga pants, your hair loosely tied up. "I don't know why I think I need to lose weight," you state as you run your hands over your thighs, "I'm better off than Mel."

You spend the next little bit lounging around before shrugging and hitting the liquor cabinet pulling out a bottle of nice wine. You're about to pour a glass when the doorbell rings. You head over to the door and look out the peep hole to see another Asian woman standing there. Janice's memories tell you that this is Tina, Ronald's sister. Tina and Janice have been best friends since college and she's the one who introduced Janice and Ronald.

You open the door and greet the taller, slimmer, short-haired and pants-suit wearing woman. "Tina, hi! What brings you around," you ask her as she steps into your apartment.

"I saw what happened on the news and figured I would come by to check on you, see how you're doing," She then notices the wine bottle and glass on the counter. "That rough," she asks.

You sigh heavily, "You have no idea. There was just an explosion, a fire and then it was pure chaos. Nobody knows if it was just some kind of industrial accident, some kind of sabotage or terrorism or what."

"Oh, Janice I'm so sorry," Tina replies and pulls you into a friendly hug. "Was anybody seriously hurt?"

You shake your head, "Not that we know of so far, thank god, but..."

You pause as you hear a bunch of doors closing outside and check out the window that overlooks the parking lot. A lot of black SUVs and guys in suits are entering the building. Bell's security? Why would they be here though? Well, Janice works for Bell so maybe they're just checking up on employees... especially someone who works so close to Veronica herself.

But another thought strikes you: Michelle Jackson went in one bathroom, Melinda Curtis came walking out of the same one a short time later. Did they find Michelle in a daze in there? Did other witnesses somehow allow them connect Melinda to Michelle? Could they connect Melinda to Janice?

It might be best to stay calm, stop being paranoid and lay low as Janice. Plus as Janice you'd have unfiltered access to Veronica and her company and after catching you and developing this pen you're interested in keeping a close eye on things.

But if they have made a connection... you look at Tina. She's the mayor of the next town over. Young, pretty, amiable and popular to boot. She'd have nice security too, a great safety net and would be hard to touch even if a connection was made from Melinda to Janice and then Janice to Tina. It might be a good idea to stay as you are for the moment but then it might also be a good idea to switch over to Tina Chan.
1512122.title: Hiding Out... Or Not

choices: Head to the next town over
15121221.content:
Right now you need to keep cool. Looking through your glasses at your 'sister-in-law', it's clear that the smart play is to keep calm and act confident. For the years you've played the spy game without this incredible gadget, that simple mantra seen you through more tight spots than you can recall. Janice doesn't know anything about the pens, but you have a golden opportunity to find out everything you want. You flick back a loose strand of hair that has escaped your precise bun.

"Is Ron back yet?" Tina asks. You blow out those chipmunk cheeks and shake your head, raising a quizzical eyebrow. It's a strange question, your Janice mind hints.

"Why would he be? He's on the other coast, remember? Bank business." You tease the stranger, but something makes you wonder why she'd ask such a question.

"Of course," Tina says, rolling her eyes and reaching down to her phone. "I totally forgot. He hasn't texted me all week, I lost track."

Bullshit. You can tell a lie at a distance, and Tina Chan, consummate politician she may be, just told her sister-in-law a complete falsehood. You turn to conceal any sign of understanding betraying your disguise and pour the wine, adjusting the frame of your glasses.

"Can I get you a glass?"

"Can't, got to drive back. I just wanted to come over and make sure you were OK."

You turn and smile, seizing the glass in your fingers and twisting it gently to release the aroma. You take a long draught. "I appreciate it," you say, as Janice would. "I know how busy you are. Being a mayor isn't easy."

"Don't I know it. Although today it sounds like you're the one with the stressful job."

You decide there isn't anything else to do but sink into the role. You nod, collapsing in your yoga pants and sinking into the nearest sofa, kicking your legs up and letting the wine do its work. Below you can hear the heavy sound of a door banging, and frown apologetically. "No idea what's gotten in to her," you say. "Usually she's pretty quiet."

"Always the way. The moment you want quiet, you get noise." Tina's easy philosophy is a little too forced, you think. There's a strain on her painted lips, a tension in the corner of her mouth. You only notice it because you've spent so long studying faces and their interesting muscles. "Did she say she was having a party or anything?"

Suddenly it all clicks in to place. Your heart thuds fast for a moment. Tina knows. Knows what, you have no idea. But suddenly you begin to doubt that her arrival was purely to look after her sister-in-law. What if she's checking, trying to see if the jump between Mel and Janice has taken place? Is she looking for you, or are you just paranoid? The easy way would just be to zap her here, but that's also the move that Bell would expect. Your gut tells you that the safest thing to do at this moment is to keep calm and be Janice. Tina could have a microphone or camera on her person. Perhaps in that flower on her jacket breast pocket.

"No," you shrug, taking off your glasses to pinch the end of your nose, before polishing off the wine. "She's just a neighbor. Besides, with the chaos today I feel like I could nap through anything."

"You haven't slept yet?"

"Not a wink."

"Maybe, then, I should leave you to it?" Tina rises, smiling once more. You look up, a little surprised.

"So soon?"

"A mayor's life is never done. You've got my cell if you do need me."

"It's OK. I'll give that husband of mine a ring later. Then I'd better get some sleep. My boss has something going on, so work's going to be cray-zee tomorrow."

You smile that adorable chipmunk grin of yours as Tina leaves, before shifting your curvy form up and out of the sofa to pour another glass. The banging noise downstairs has stopped, and a quick glance out of the window confirms the SUVs are leaving, along with what looks like an ambulance. Obviously that 'tracker' Bell hinted it hasn't activated. But the involvement of Tina Chan is troubling. The mayor knew far too much. Could it be this company has already got one or more of these devices in circulation? That Chan's town is being used as some kind of test?

It's far-fetched, but then if you'd said eight hours ago you would be wearing another person's body, with partial access to their memories and mannerisms, you'd have laughed. And yet here you are. You are Janice Chan. You have her body, with all its imperfections. You have her personality and knowledge. You're in her apartment, drinking her wine.

You could stay as Janice, head in to work tomorrow and find out exactly what Bell is doing. This even complete's Bell's 'assignment' - you can be in her office as requested, and claim that you were simply testing out your abilities. Or you can make another move, this time without a trace. It should be easy enough to leave Janice to her exhausted sleep and find a new identity to take you the next town over. From there, you're sure you could probe whatever spider's web has been created with these pens, and find out how deep this plot goes.
15121221.title: Sister suspicions

choices: Head to the mall or the mayor's house
151212212.content:
You decide that whatever is happening, some distance would be a good idea. Janice is useful, but heading straight back into the lion's den is only going to cause problems in the long run. Still, while you're her... you walk over to her laptop, opening it up while you sip her wine. A few clicks later and you've accessed the remote connection to her work account, and are glancing over her emails.

Most of them are no use. A few queries that she'll need to deal with for Ms Bell, a work schedule, nothing unusual. Ms Bell prefers for Janice to screen and send her emails, and most of the time it's just tedious day-to-day stuff; anything secret she handles on a separate account. There's also the company-wide emails about the evacuation, and updates for employees on whether they are working tomorrow (they are). But among it all is an email that catches your eye. It's from the post room, of all places, short and to the point, and hasn't been sent to Ms Bell's private secure account, but rather to her work account. Obviously someone doesn't know the right protocols.

Subject: Fire malfunction

Ms Bell,

We have a situation. The office fire triggered an emergency protocol hidden in the system. Did you know about this? The system automails something marked "CS" to a secure location by courier. But the fire caused a malfunction. It was supposed to go to the following zip, but the fire caused a glitch that autogenerated part of the address. We have no idea where in the zip the package was sent.

You double-check the email again. This is major. CS could be anything, but part of you wonders if it isn't another one of these pen devices. And the zip code... that's Tina Chan's small town. Tomorrow - or maybe even tonight if the couriers have acted fast - some entirely unsuspecting person is going to have military secrets land on their doorstep. And almost immediately after, you imagine, the company heavies. Janice would, of course, immediately contact Ms Bell on her private number. But you... you're not Janice. And, quietly marking the email as unread, you close the laptop.

Time to leave.

***

Analytical Engine. What the hell kind of band name is that? You don't even want to know what kind of music the kids are listening to these days. You look at the poster on the wall of the coffee house, three angry looking young women staring back at you from behind their instruments, plus a guy who looks as though he doesn't want to be there. Probably the biggest band to play this town in years.

It's a typical small town. Across the street there's an Italian restaurant that seems about the only decent place to eat. The bus passed a large shopping mall just out of town, and there's a small hospital, a college campus, even an art museum.

You shake your head, and finish your coffee. You left Janice collapsed on her bed with a glass of half-drunk wine before catching a bus. You haven't used the pens again, and your natural hair is tussled and unkempt, as if you're trying to give off a drifter vibe. It allows you to take a few moments to gather your bearings and get the lay of the land.

So far, it seems a perfectly normal town. A bunch of high school kids were in earlier, with a 'Jimmy' being told to shut up repeatedly by the other two, a 'David' and a 'Trish'. You guess the last pair are an item, given the way Trish was looking at David the whole time. They left a while ago, and now the only customer is a pretty red-head police officer, a look of bored stupor on her face as she sips her coffee and watches the street outside. Name tag reads O'Sullivan, and the barista called her Molly. As the local cop you'd be in a much better place to search for this 'CS'. Whatever it is must be important.

There are other alternatives, though. A quick walk around the town led you to an alley, and you saw a pale woman, hair cut in a luminous red bob, too much makeup on her face and nails, and dressed in a skin-tight, revealing black number. Red light district. Easy to make a switch to a new identity there.

There are other options, though. The mall looked like it didn't close until late and would give you options. And you could of course continue up that road and pay Mayor Chan a visit.

Whatever you choose though, you have no idea how you're going to locate this 'CS'. It's getting late. The only thing you can do is find the right person to replace, wait until morning and see what happens.
151212212.title: New in town

1512122121.content:
"Hey there," The red-haired woman said as she noticed your approach, "Looking for some company?"

A seductive smile coupled with the modeling of her figure by putting her hands to her hips and arching her back slightly intrigued you, you knew instantly that you'd be entertained at least.

"Yeah, I am." You mutter in response, and her eyes flash in response. She walks up to your and takes your hand, before turning and leading you behind her.

"Follow me tiger," She purrs, "I've got just the place."

***

"Jimmy!" Your mother shouts from the kitchen, your head perks up as you hear her shrill pitch. "Can you get the door please!"

Groaning, you hit start on your controller and drop it on the sofa besides you. Leaning forward, you stand and quickly walk to the front door, peering through the peephole, you see someone you assume is a delivery man. He's got a small brown package in one hand and a clipboard in the other and seems anxious. Unlocking the door, you swing it open and he instantly looks up at you, stretching his arm out to hand you the package.

"Package for this address, sir." He says plainly.

"Mum!" You call out to your mother in the back, "Did you order a package?"

"No!" She shouts back, "It's probably for Heather if at all!"

"Alright." You say to the delivery man, taking it from him.

"Sign here, sir." He hands you the clipboard, a pen dangling from the top lets you write your signature quickly and hand it back.

"Good day." He says, turning and walking back to his delivery truck. You notice UPS painted over the side, and huff before shutting the door.

Walking back to the living room, you sit down on the sofa again and rip open the package. The paper tears open to reveal a box with a crude CS labelled on the top in black lettering, you frown as you unseal the lid and take the cover off. A foam padding protects a single black pen shaped object. Picking it out of the box, you notice a single button near the top of the pen, holding it in your hand, you aim it at your wall and press the button. A red beam shoots out of the pen, similar to a Star Wars blaster, and upon hitting the wall completely disappears.

"Jimbo, what's that you've got there?" Heather suddenly says as she walks into the living room.

Turning to her, you point and press the button intending to blast her like a Storm Trooper.

"Watch out!" You warn, the laser shoots from the tip.

Hitting her in the chest, Heather's body freezes and she looks at you with a very confused expression. You see her eyes roll into her head before seemingly sinking, her cheeks start to sag as her shoulders drop, her body quickly deflating and falling into a heap. You jump up from the sofa in surprise, and run around to the newly formed pile of skin and clothing, Heather's long brown hair sticking out from under heap.

"Oh shit!" You start to panic, "Heather!?"

You grab the skin and drop it right after, it's warm, almost hot. Cringing, you slowly kneel down against and pick it up, standing straight you hold Heather by the shoulders.

"What's going on in he- Jimmy!" Your mother walks in, and shrieks. "What the fuck is that!?"
1512122121.title: Choose someone downtown

choices: Test the pen on the assistant
152.content:
Josh Pollak slouched through the store. He felt defeated. Michelle Francis was the girl of his dreams: honey-blonde hair and curves in all the right places. He'd met her in the second year of university, at a party where their limited social circles had come together. She was part of the popular crowd, from a wealthy family, who seemed to know everyone on campus. He was a loser whose only friends were lab rats and slackers. They'd struck up a friendship, which had blossomed into something more pretty quickly.

Then fate – or rather her friends – had intervened. None of them liked him at all. Dawn, all fake tan, fake nails and hair extensions, didn't find him cool enough; anyone less than a jock wasn't worth her time. She was rich, spoiled, and constantly inferred Michelle was too good for him. Maya was just as bad; a beautiful mixed-race girl with a distinct punk vibe, he got the feeling that she wouldn't have approved of anyone dating her friend - let alone him. Then there was her roommate and best friend, Charlotte: a slight, short, shy redhead covered in freckles. Charlotte was too close to her; he suspected she probably loved Michelle herself, and saw Josh as a threat. Michelle was blind to it all, but listened to her friends.

All of that would have been bad enough, but then he'd faced the worst part of all: Chloe Francis, her mother. Mrs Francis was in her 40s, but had retained an incredible figure and knew it: every time they'd met her appearance had been immaculate. She worked for some major corporation, and evidently had already mapped out her daughter's future. She'd insisted Michelle go to university in her hometown, although her daughter had rebelled enough to live on campus rather than at home. Michelle's sisters were already doctors and lawyers, and Mrs Francis had made it clear she saw Josh as a distraction her daughter did not need. Their two meetings had been frosty and uncomfortable; Michelle visited home every Sunday, and had mentioned that her mother often spoke of him in disapproving terms.

Now, here he was, late on a Saturday, walking around some second rate collectibles store, looking for something weird to cheer him up. Two days ago Michelle had told him they needed to stop seeing each other. It wasn't him, she insisted, it was her. He knew what that meant: the months of whispers had finally got to her. If only there was a way to convince her friends to say something good about him, get off his back...

He returned to his shopping. The store was full of old costumes, used models of the Enterprise, half-complete card sets and old Magic cards. He was about to give up when he noticed a small box, almost forgotten, on a dusty shelf in the back. It looked old and out of place - just his kind of thing. He couldn't resist the opportunity to walk over and take a look.

It was a small box, wooden, with letters neatly engraved on the top: “Costume set” , followed by some worn, unrecognizable initials. Weird, he thought. This is too small for a costume. Carefully, his fingers lifted the latch and brought up the lid. Inside were two pens, sat in a neat lining. One black, one brown. Both had a button on them, both a strange symbol. Weird...but awesome.

“What are these things?” he said, calling out to the shop assistant. “These pens?”

“Beats me,” the assistant said. She was cute, about 20 years old, bright pink hair pushed out in pigtails like some anime character, wearing a Firefly T-shirt and jeans. “The manager said he picked 'em up at a garage sale. Some kind of TV prop. The previous owner said the idea is you point the black pen at someone and 'pow' – turns them into an instant costume. Like a disguise you wear, or something. Pretty creepy, huh?”

“Does it work?” Josh asked. The assistant scoffed.

“Yeah, right! A pen that turns someone into a costume. What kind of planet are you from? It's a novelty, it's not real. Do you think those sonic screwdrivers we've got from Dr Who fans are real? Or that Darth Vader helmet? It's just a prop... no idea what show it's from, though.”

Josh smiled bashfully. Yeah, of course he was being stupid. The idea though... to be able to turn someone else into a disguise? Just point, click, and you were someone else? His thoughts turned to Michelle again. With such a power, he'd easily correct everything her friends and family had said about him. Or maybe he'd just get some payback on them, see how they liked it to have someone mess with their life.

“How much?” he said, closing the lid.

“Twenty bucks.”

“Sold.”

Josh scooped up the box and handed over the cash. Of course it wasn't real – it was just pretend. But what if... what if it actually did work?
152.title: Gossip and Gadgets

choices: Wear it so you can be her.
1521.content:
(Changing to Josh's POV, second person.)

"So, what's the brown pen do?" you ask the cute pink-haired assistant.

"Oh, you zap yourself with it once you have your people suit on, and you'll know how to be them," she says. "Supposedly. You do understand that these pen things aren't for real? Because you're worrying me!"

You take out the black pen. It's just you and the cute girl here. You point it at her. She puts on an obviously fake expression of terror and squeals melodramatically as you press the button on the pen...

...and you zap her with a bright narrow beam of light, magenta in color. The flesh disappears from inside her skin and it and her clothes crumple in a heap to the floor.

You go to the entrance door of the shop, turn the OPEN sign over to closed and also shut off the fake-neon OPEN sign in the window. You lock the door and pull down the shade over its glass panel. Only then do you go back and have a look at the girl suit you've just made from a real live young woman.

You decide you'll try to:
1521.title: Test the pen on the assistant

choices: Change your mind and wear it after all.
15211.content:
The pink-haired shopgirl was adorable and seemed so happy in her own cute skin, and you're thoroughly sick of being yourself. You admit to yourself that you've always envied girls just a little. Now here's your chance to become one.

You go behind the counter and see the pile of girl suit and girl clothes on the clean-looking floor. You touch the hollow skin: still warm, but cooling to room temperature. It feels purely like human skin except it seems more elastic. You see that there's an opening a few inches long from just under what had been the chin almost to the neck, and something like a zipper pull at the neck end. The edges of the opening have zipper teeth!

You find that although the zipper section seems to end where the zipper pull is, you can zip the girl suit open further. When you go in the other direction, the opening gets shorter and leaves flawless skin on the zipped-up section.

Your instinct is that zipping up this girl suit completely will turn it back into the girl. You're not sure where you got that idea but it seems reasonable. You flatten out the empty girl so that if zipping her shut restores her, she'll wake up lying more or less comfortably on the floor, fully dressed.
15211.title: Make it into her again.

152111.content:
As much as you'd like to try being the shopgirl, you zip the girl skin shut. Sure enough, the change from the ultimate costume back to the living girl it had been starts at once, and in maybe five minutes she coughs and sits up. "Don't tell me it actually worked!" she says, getting up with no difficulty from the floor.

"Okay, I won't tell you," you say. "Figure it out for yourself."

She looks at a clock with the Starship Enterpise logo on the dial, hanging across the room from the counter. "Hardly any time's gone by. I thought you'd try me on!"

"I can't just go around wearing hot girls as if they were cheap suits," you say.

"You're a gentleman," she says. "You know, if that brown pen thing works as well as the black one, this could be the perfect way to know if we're right for each other. Why don't you wear me for the rest of the day? Then I can wear you for a while. If we're right for each other, we'll know!"

"What if I put you on, use the brown pen, decide I want to be you, and stay you for life?"

She shrugs and looks adorable doing that. "It's a risk I'll take. Let's get naked, you zap me, you wear me, you get your inner woman with the brown pen, you put on your girl clothes and mind the shop. Tonight, tomorrow night, whenever, take me off and I'll try being you. Okay?"
152111.title: Zip the girl suit shut.

1521111.content:
Soon you and the shopgirl are naked in a back room equipped with a cot and a sofa among other homey touches that make it look like a small and comfortable apartment. You admire her body. She's not as pretty as your not-really-girlfriend Michelle, but her face is droll and kissable and intelligent, her small breasts are firm and high and beautifully shaped, her waist trim and her buttocks excellent. Her pubic hair is the same pink as the hair on her head and it's neatly trimmed but remarkably thick. "You're adorable," you tell her.

"Adorkable, more like," she says. "Best way to adore me is to be me."

"I love your voice," you say.

"Use it well," she says. You hold her and kiss her on the mouth, then you two separate and you zap her again with the black "pen" that had made her into a girl suit. In a moment the half-open eyeholes of a new girl suit are staring up at you from the floor.

In under ten minutes you have the shop open again. Only you're not you. Josh is little more than a set of memories in your pink-haired head. Unless you remind yourself that you're not the real Melissa Kowalski, invariably called Lissa by everyone who knows her, it doesn't occur to you.

The Lissa suit had slipped onto your body as if it wanted to take it over, your feet shrinking to fit the moment each was inside a hollow Lissa foot, and the rest of the transformation had gone just as well. It's a cold morning; you're in England during the summer of 1535. King Henry VIII is on the throne, his wife Anne Boleyn – Queen Anne – sits beside him. This is the time when history as you know it will unravel; it's up to you to find out why.

You backtrack, thinking about past events in your own timeline: events that take place in the future. In 2027 the pens were developed. One was a time-travel device, the other a molecular compressor. Every atom in the world can be screwed up into a tennis ball if compressed; and once you can reorganize atomic structure, disguise becomes easy. The pens are top secret prototypes; only the upper echelons of your organization know about them. And only a handful of people – you included – know about the symbols.

Yes, the reason for your visit to this time: the symbols on the pens. Symbols that have appeared in artifacts and archaeological digs from multiple time periods, from the ancient world to the Wild West. Nobody knows what the symbols represent, or who left them throughout time. The creator of the pens was a mad scientist in every sense of the phrase, and killed himself shortly after making his creations; he never explained how he did it, or what the symbols he added to the pens mean. You have been sent to find out.

Back to your present. You look about you; you're in a large garden of some kind. On instinct, you hurry behind the nearest hedge row. This is Hampton Court Palace, Henry VIII's seat of power. In two days' time, during a feast, someone will scratch the symbols on the back of the throne of England; it's a documented event, part of the evidence later used to send Anne Boleyn to the headsman's block as a witch, though at the time it was largely ignored as petty vandalism. 1553111.content:
A few minutes later, you're in the bedroom, pulling your old clothes back on.

"David.. stop being s-"

The sound of a helicopter loudly sounds from outside, then suddenly, gunfire rips through the top floor. The two of you fall to the floor, stunned.
Deafened by the gunfire, you see holes being formed in the wall across from you a dozen a second, Jessica's yelling something, but neither of you can hear.
She crawls to you, the gunfire stops, grabbing your arm, you're huddling besides the bed.

"Shit.. how'd they find me?" Jessica spits.

You frown, Jessica's never sounded like that before. But then again, your girlfriend probably was never even real.

The chopper lifts upwards, the sounds of men shouting is faint under the overpowering rant of the helicopter propellers.
Jessica's eyes widen, and she grabs your arm. Pulling you off the floor, she then leads you to the bathroom quickly.
Throwing open the door, she slams it and locks it, then walking briskly to the shower. You see Marisa's skin in her hand as he turns around.

"Put it on, we need to run and she's fitter than you." Jessica says.

Catching it, you look up at Jessica, uncertain.

"Hurry the fuck up!" She almost yells.

The chopper seems to distance itself from the house as the noise subsides slightly, but you hear the stamping of boots.
Clawing your clothes off, you turn Marisa's turn around and stretch it wide open, for a moment you're amazed by how elastic it is.
Sticking your legs into it, instantly they stick to your skin as if it was wrapping itself around you. Your legs and ass thicken with both muscle and fat, you feel yourself being molded by the skin. Trying your best not to vomit, you pull it up and stick your arms through. Your groin is squeezed so incredibly hard and fast that you feel no pain when it disappears, replaced by Marisa's still moist snatch. Your abs harden and tighten up incredibly as your waist slims, you're surprised at the way this body feels. She doesn't look like she works out, but god damn..
Flipping her long black hair forward, you stuff your head into the back of her neck. Your cheeks and jaw assume the more shapely and pronounced form of Marisa's and you're almost surprised when two full breasts appear on your chest.
Jessica stoops down and grabs your clothes from the floor, throwing them at you as well. She walks to the door and peeks out after opening it.

"We've gotta' go. Now." She says.

"But I'm not dre-" You say in Marisa's voice, sounding awkward as you lack her accent.

"Let's go!" She yells.

Flinging the door wide open, she grabs your wrist and pulls you along with her, running into the hallway, 3 men in all black are rushing up the stairs with sub-machine guns pointed upwards, at you.

"Stop!" The one in front yells, setting his sights on Jessica.

Jessica almost blurs as she moves both gracefully and rapidly to the right, before kicking out the goon infront's leg. He tumbles backwards and slams into the guy behind him. Bullets create a line up the side of the stairs as their guns fire. With a quick extension of her leg, the last man descends the staircase.

"Holy shit!" You say, one of your arms over Marisa's chest.

"No time! Run!" She looks at you, fear in her eyes.

So you run. Down the stairs, you're greeted by the sight of a dozen soldiers outside the house. Red dots blot the wall behind you, and soon they converge onto Jessica. She looks at you briefly.

"Cellar!"

In a blaze of gunfire, her body is torn apart by hundreds of rounds. Blood splatters over the wall behind as you stare.

"Jessica! NO!" You scream, she slumps against the wall, blood pooling by her limp arms.

The soldier's turn their sights on you and hesitate, for some reason, they haven't killed you yet. But you're not about to start guessing why. Whirling around, you speed into the kitchen. There was a small door near the back of the house that you saw, but only briefly. It'll have to be the cellar, or you're dead.
The stamping of boots sounds behind you as the soldiers collapse on you, you're out of the kitchen and through the back door. As you hit the trapdoor to the cellar, you throw the doors open and run down the small, cold stone stairs.

It's dark, the only light coming from the opening you just came through. Looking around, you hug the wall and grope around. Something touches your hand..
A light switch! As you flick it on, white light floods the entire cellar, momentarily blinding you. Opening your eyes, you notice a red box next to the light switch, somewhat similar to a fire alarm.

IN CASE OF EMERGENCY PULL DOWN

And so you do, almost ripping the small metal handle from it's place on the wall. Electricity seems to buzz to life around you, and you feel a strange pressure on your body. Red lasers seems to speed through the wall from a large metal object near the far end of the cellar. The beams converge on the door, and a wash of red energy forms a barrier in the opening. You see a soldier rush around the corner and peer into the cellar.

"She's in here!" He yells to others. "What the fuck is this..?"

Raising his gun to the red barrier, he fires a few rounds at it. They instantly disintegrate.
He seems to stare for a moment in surprise, before letting his gun point to the floor.

"Well shit." He mutters.

"What's the problem? Get the hell in there and grab her!" Another soldier arrives.

"Can't, atomic displacement field." He replies. "This whole cellar is sealed off."

"What?! God damn it!" The other grunts, more arriving behind them.

You stop staring at them and look around. the floors and walls are all silvery, with red beams of energy flowing through them.
The beams look holographic to you.. kind of like how you saw through Jessica's disguise.
There's a table with a laptop on it, and a few papers scattered about next to it, along with an envelope.
Sifting through, the papers are just incomprehensible numbers. You pick up the envelope.
Breaking the seal, you pull out the paper inside and unfold it. A small black pen, like the one Jessica had falls from the paper onto the table.
As you read, you recognize Jessica's handwriting, and you start to cry.


David, if you're reading this, it means I'm dead.
Don't be confused, all of this was inevitable. I've lived a long time because of the skins, and you're going to have to if you want to fix all this.
You're wanted, you should know by now, you've got special abilities. The reason they never showed up before is because your body needed the energy from the pen to turn them on, and I've probably used it on you. At the time of writing, I'm wearing your mother, Marie.
I've actually just given birth to you, trust me, it's really hard to write this. The nurses here are so kind, it's almost sickening when I think about it.
They don't know who I really am, but that's besides the point. The pen in this note is for you to defend yourself with, please, use it.
You're not the first to be born like this, you're actually apart of an experiment by the organization. There's another like you, his name is Daniel.
He's about 24 by now, do the math when you read this. He'll find you.
Honestly, It's sad that I have to do what I'm going to, just to keep my eyes on you.
I don't want to take your life away, it's just.. we have to protect you. I wish you could understand how much we love you.


Tears stream down your face, your lips curl in grief as you sob in Marisa's high voice. You pick up the pen and look to the laptop.
Stuffing the note in your pocket, you wipe your face with your wrist.

A boom cracks the foundation of the building, and dust falls from the ceiling.

Shit!

Instantly, the wall blows out and stone is sent flying over the cellar, bruising your soft flesh as you raise your arms in reflex.
Knocked to the floor, the barrier powers down, and red dots light up the room like fireflies. Soldiers drop into the room and surround you on the floor, you see one stoop forward, a black object in his hand. Quickly, he jabs it into your neck and injects you with something. Your eyes roll to the back of your head as you pass out.

You're dreaming, or at least, you think you are.

Images flash before you, you're seeing your mom dropping you off at elementary school, then your family at the dinner table, celebrating Claire's 9th birthday.
Suddenly, you're watching Tina drive you home from football practice, you're both laughing.
Something latches itself around your wrist and drags you away, you try your hardest to reach out to the image, but you're pulled into darkness.

You open your eyes, your head's pounding. Looking around, you see a woman above you, a nurse. A cold hard surface under your back, you look to the other way. A young man, the doctor. You're covered by a lime green blanket, it's thin, but cozy.

"Finally awake, is she?" The man says. "We'll need more sedative."

Your strength is suddenly restored, and you lunge forward. Slamming your elbow square into his chin, he's sent staggering back. The nurse tries to hold you, but you shrug her off and leap from the table. Across the room, you see what clothes you had on before, and your pen. Running over to it, you grab it an swing around, aiming it to the nurse. As you press the button, your hand seems to pulsate with red energy, you see lines being sucked into the pen's along it's body.
The beam fires and strikes her in the chest, she instantly crumples to the floor. The doctor follows quickly.
Huffing, you look around, there's nobody else.
